Reviews.Title: “Westin is the BEST!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Melinda S
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my recent visit to Chicago thanks to the outstanding accomodations provided by the Westin Chicago River West. The rooms were clean and confortable, and the staff were very helpful and friendly. Special thanks to their great coincerage Diane. She helped us with dining, travel and entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a centrally located hotel in Chicago.”
Reviews.Author: BAMW
Reviews.Content: The hotel location can't be beat. It's just north of the river between Clark and Dearborn. We request a high level floor and a riverview based on other reviews of this hotel. We received a riverview room on the seventh floor. The room was clean and well appointed with an excellent view of the river and south side skyline. I prepaid for our room which got us a rate of $109/night. That is db unheard of rate for a hotel in downtown Chicago. We also opted to not have housekeeping which earned us 500 extra points per night and a $5 voucher to be used at the hotel. We had room 724. On the second day, we returned to our room to find that the ceiling above the toilet was leaking. We called the front desk. They sent up someone to look at it. They also arranged for another room on a priority guest floor and gave us access to the lounge on the 20th floor. This more than made up for the inconvenience. Our second room was 1425. The room was great and a bit lighter than the one on the 7th floor. The bar in the lobby was good but pricey. It was $10 for a bottle of Guinness. The lounge on the 20th floor had complimentary water, soda, coffee, espresso and snacks. There was a wine machine that dispensed a taste, half glass or a full glass and charged it to your room using your room key. At 5pm they had snacks and you could order a drink. There were tvs, tables and chairs, music and couches in the room. In the morning they had a complimentary continental breakfast. A tip- park at Midway or O'Hare in one of the overnight lots and take the train into the city. The hotel charged about $50/night to park. We found a lot at midway with an online coupon for $9 per night. We were able to avoid all but one toll road coming in from Michigan and only had to pay $2.25 per person each way for the train. We walked everywhere while in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Chicago River North - Problems”
Reviews.Author: Davew1010
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 days at the Westin Chicago River North last week and encountered problems that any business traveler would try to avoid. Prior to arriving in Chicago, I set up a series of meetings. I called the Westin in advance to schedule the meetings in a restaraunt at the hotel. The folks answering the phone told me that their restaraunt is called Shula. So I asked the people I was meeting with to meet me at Shula. And at dinner time, I went looking for Shula myself to join the prospective clients for our dinner meeting. Turns out that the folks answering the phone work for Sheraton as it's also a Starwood property. They had told me about Shula not realizing I was staying at the Westin. As a result, my meetings started with some frustrated folks and one who went missing. When I told the Westin about this problem, they appologized, told me to have people meet me at Ember - their restaraunt - and they sent me a $5 bottle of wine. So i updated my meetings for the next day and asked people to meet me at Ember instead of Shula. The following evening, I found out that Ember only serves breakfast and lunch but not dinner. Again, I had to scramble to find a different restaraunt. When I asked the hotel why they did not point out that Ember is not open for dinner, I got no answer - just an apology. Westin topped off my visit with a dripping wet floor in my room. It seems that the room next door had a leaking shower and that the water ran under th wall and into my room. Consequently, the floor was wet and smelled of mildew. I had let the hotel know twice about the trouble they had caused by messing up my dinner meetings. So I was plenty annoyed when the best they could do was to tell me they were sorry and not much else. They treated the wet floor situation as routine and made no serious offer to fix anything. In fact, they didn't even offer to comp the room I had stayed in. Those are the facts. Based on the above, I'm going to avoid Westin in the future and the Chicago River North Westin - well, I hope situations never force me to stay there again. I see their management as incompetent, uncaring and not particularly and just plain stupid.

Reviews.Title: “Great sleeping in city location”
Reviews.Author: M2hra
Reviews.Content: While this Westin looks like a typical upper level business hotel, it has a different feel. The rooms are very quiet, no street noise even in a center city location. Views are over the Chicago River, Loop and near North side. Lobby is large, with extensive seating, bar service and has a comfortable feel that makes you want to sit and work or visit for hours. There must be 30 great Chicago restaurants within a 2 block radius of the hotel to appeal to any taste. The Westin staff are friendly, helpful and just top off a great experience. The rooms are spacious, tastefully decorated and even by the high Westin "Sweet Sleeper" bed standard, the beds here stand out as being extremely comfortable. I stay here regularly when in Chicago and look forward to my visits.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the business traveler. You can count on Westins!”
Reviews.Author: SusanM202
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel for business. Rooms are spacious, clean and comfy. Love the fluffy beds. Room service is always quick. Good place to spread out my stuff (laptop, folders, etc.) I can always count on a good night at this clean, consistent, friendly yet sophisticated hotel. Bar is good, food is good, prices are very reasonable for Chicago. I have stayed there for a few years now and try not to stay anywhere else in Chicago. Great location too. For a large hotel in a rather unfriendly city, feels like home and I have honestly never experienced anything less at this particular hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION, GREAT SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: Sandokan58
Reviews.Content: I spent two days at this hotel in mid-February with my family. This was my second visit ever to the Windy City. The hotel is located on the Chicago River, right in the middle of that great city's great attractions. The theater district is within walking distance as are many restaurants and shops. The hotel boasts very good restaurants and a large lounge right in the lobby. The rooms are rather large, typical of Westin. The service provided by the staff was excellent. Next time I visit Chicago I will certainly return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wow what a location...”
Reviews.Author: Wiscmom2
Reviews.Content: Great location - I did not stay at this hotel but I did get a tour and WOW! This is a beautiful property. Great location on the river like it's partners Westin & Sheraton Hotels. Wonderful work out area and again, wonderful bedding. Views are killer & staff is great.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in the Heart of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: phil1985
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay for a trip with the boys. The hotel is centrally located, walking distance to tons of bars and restaurants, Michigan Avenue, the Willis Tower, Gino's East and the River. The rooms are big and luxurious, (similar to all Westin's I have stayed in). Definitely would recommend this hotel for a central location and beautiful property.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Chicago”
Reviews.Author: travellikecrazy
Reviews.Content: I've stayed numerous times at the Westin in downtown Chicago on Dearborn Street. The hotel is easily accessible to the financial districts, shopping, restuarants and bars. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the staff are very friendly. There is a concierge level for SPG Platinum guests which makes it attractive for business travelers. Kwazi is the employee who works most mornings here and is great. He is always willing to meet your needs for a snack or breakfest. WIFI Access is good in the room and they provide a desk large enough to get work accomplished on the road. The lobby bar/restuarant is clean and serves sushi and other non bar like food. The Westin Workout is larger than a standard hotel room which allows a decent workout to be accomplished. They even have a trainer on site, Sam, who is very accomodating and helpful for providing clients with some on site training and advice. Overall a great hotel for the price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Thank You!”
Reviews.Author: JulieStephenson
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at The Westin Chicago North River. I was a little hesitant due to traveling alone, but once I got to the lovely hotel, and got myself settled, I felt relaxed and totally comfortable. The room was beautiful. The robe was amazing. The view of the Clark St. bridge was awesome. I wish I would have had more time to enjoy all of it! The workshop I attended was meant to energize me professionally, but personally, I think relaxing in the hotel the entire time would have been all I needed. Thanks for the great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: pats54
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin Chicago River North in Chicago. This hotel is centrally located in the downtown area. The staff were very helpfull and kind. Great Sushi restaurant in hotel,

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: jkwmidwest
Reviews.Content: If you are staying in Chicago and a workout facility along with comfort is on your hotel list, check in here. Sam, Manager of the workout facility, is fantastic at his job. The workout facility is comprehensive and he has the skills to perfect your workout techniques. Front desk and rooms at the usual Westin standard (high). Lounge for breakfast complete and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Sunbound
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice Westin in a great locations. Nothing bad to say about this hotel and the location. It has clean spacious rooms and a club floor/lounge...One of the rare Westin's with a club lounge which is always a nice bonus...

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: j b
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot and typically spend 30 days a year in Chicago. The Westin Chicago River North is an excellent choice - the rooms are comfy, its close to a ton of great restraunts and its easy to walking distance to the lake and businesses. I'll also mention that Sam Guiragossian, who runs the Workout Club, is a great guy. He is very approachable, knowlegable - regardless of your fitness level he is the guy to connect with.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brukar
Reviews.Content: Usually we stay up around Water Tower but this part of Chicago has really come into its own with shops and restaurants. And it's not difficult to walk north on Michigan Ave to go to Water Tower etc. The hotel was very nice and the women at the concierge desk was very helpful and patient as was all of the staff. One warning. I parked in a garage close to the hotel thinking it would be cheaper than valet parking ($55). It wasn't. For one day on the weekend I paid $65. Better to park south of the river and take a short walk back to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “chicago choices”
Reviews.Author: rogerrenaissance
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent two night stay. Their staff was intent on pleasing. The workout club is staffed by Sam who is not only personable but keeps the place immaculate. The equipment is brand new and I would rather go there than my home gym which is a comparative mess (LA fitness just bought my Bally's). My business was in the Mart and it was two blocks from there. There is a hotel attached to the Mart and its rate was lower but the Westin is so much better that there was no question of where I was going to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Real Comfort!”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveller11_66
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in January, 2012 and loved the location and comfort of the hotel. The hotel is located directly across the street from the House of Blues and Bin 36. There is a shuttle to and from the convention center which runs every 20 minutes. The bus stop is just down the road. There are plenty of shops and restaurants (Starbucks, too) within walking distance from the hotel. There is a large open bar right in the lobby called the Hana Lounge. The service was a bit slow here and the prices are pretty expensive; but, it's convenient with comfortable seating and televisions screens above the bar. Their restaurant, also off the lobby, called the Ember Grille, is open for breakfast, lunch and dinner. We only had breakfast here on the last day, and it also was quite pricey, with just average service. I would suggest getting up early enough to walk to Starbucks for a more affordable option. The hotel's gym was quite impressive compared to other hotels. The room was spacious, with a very friendly greeter at the desk, plenty of modern cardio machines, weights and room for stretching. The best feature of the hotel was the rooms. The view from our room, on the 17th floor, was beautiful and boasted views of the river. Our room was very quiet. There was a king sized bed with a feather bed and it couldn't have been more comfortable. The bathroom was clean and over-sized with plenty of small sized toiletries (including mouthwash) for guest use. The living area of the room had a dresser with TV, a sitting area, and a desk, complete with iPad, for hotel information and directions to local establishments. The hotel offers a "green" choice to decline maid service for a $5 gift certificate or Starwood Points. I thought this was a nice touch. I would stay in this hotel again, without question. I would have given it five stars if it had better service in the Hana Lounge and Ember Grille.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service”
Reviews.Author: keldes
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a typical Westin but the people that work there are super friendly and elevate your stay a level. The rooms are nicely furnished and clean and the price was reasonable. I stayed on one of the club levels and definitely recommend it. The rooms are a little nicer, you get free wi-fi, and you don't have to pay for breakfast. The club lounge needs to be a little larger and there could be a larger selection of food but it was adequate. The health club is well laid out with the equipment in working order. The hotel is centrally located making it easy to get to appointments downtown. There is nothing special about this property except the service, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Consistent high-quality hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Ladybug1330
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at this hotel for a conference. Overall, I was impressed again by the friendly, professional and courteous hotel staff. My room was clean and well-stocked with usual amenities. I enjoyed the use of the gym and the hotel bar/restaurant. There are a lot of restaurants and shopping areas close by, and the staff was very helpful in directing me to walk to my destinations also. Check in and check out was easy. Rooms are quiet, no outside noise to be heard which is nice in a large city. Overall a very pleasant stay and would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: krayZpaving
Reviews.Content: Good hotel with a central location and all the things you expect from a Westin. The upsides: - excellent room service menu - very friendly staff - nice Club Lounge with decent breakfast options (cereals, fruits, breads, bagels, eggs, etc) - rooms are quiet, and many have nice views of the river The downsides: - always full of Platinums, so upgrades are pretty much limited to moving to Executive floors - no Comedy Central on the TV (*so* annoying - The Daily Show & Colbert missed every night) That said, I've probably stayed 20 nights in the last two months, because (despite their having Comedy Central!) it's nicer than the W City Center.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Work and/or Fun!”
Reviews.Author: SMC_Travel_Girl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for a weekend in Chicago. Coming from someone who lives in Chicago it's conveniently located to everything! Within walking distance to Michigan avenue at anytime of year, on the river and centrally located in the great area of River North, full of amazing restaurants, bars, clubs and shopping! Additionally, our company hosts annual conferences at this location and the food, service and staff are very professionaly and great for corporate conferences and events!

Reviews.Title: “I have a very mixed opinion of this place.”
Reviews.Author: PassportAlwaysOnHand
Reviews.Content: First, let's talk the positives. One... GREAT beds. Two, very convenient location for business. Three, great gym. Now... The negatives. One... just seems rundown. The shower had low pressure, and the bathroom in general reminded me of 1970's Holiday Inn which is clearly not what you are paying for. Two... behind the desk I went to plug in my laptop. The wiring was all over the place, the modem was hanging upside down, they had a multi plug adapter that was falling out and someone jammed toilet paper under it for some reason. Just looked like a fire hazard. Three, the internet connection, which was direct and not wireless, was very very slow. So... overall, it is OK. It isn't great, with the exception of the bed. Now, if all you care about is sleeping when it comes to a hotel, I guess that it is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding workout!”
Reviews.Author: SRSSt_Louis
Reviews.Content: Sam is extremely knowledgeable about physical fitness. When I stayed at the Westin River North recently, I was surprised to discover that the fitness facility offered personal training for free. Sam taught me many helpful exercises, giving me expert corrections and advice. He then offered to put together a personal program for me -- something I could work on after I returned home from my business trip. The workout is fantastic, quite challenging, but very well suited to my fitness level. I thought this was an incredibly generous gesture. I would never stay anywhere else in Chicago, and I do recommend that everyone staying at the hotel take the time to visit the gym.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great room”
Reviews.Author: JNS514
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on New Year's Eve as part of a hotel block for a friend's wedding. We got there before check in time and asked if we could leave our bags at the front desk while we attended the wedding ceremony. The girl at the front desk was very friendly in welcoming us and it turned out our room was ready early. The room was very clean and had a nice view of the city. It's close to plenty of places to eat and shop. We spent some time in the room between the ceremony and reception. The flat screen TV was nice, the chairs were comfortable, and there was a good reading light. The shower had very good pressure and warmed up quickly. The light in the bathroom wasn't great, which made putting make-up on a little difficult. The beds were extremely comfortable (I think they call them 'heavenly beds'). Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Westin river north”
Reviews.Author: Jody H
Reviews.Content: Our room was fine. Nothing fancy but clean and quiet on the 14th floor. The location is terrific and close to Starbucks and a great juice bar. The service at the Westin workout was awesome! Sam was very knowledgeable and helpful with tips and ideas for a better workout to fit my needs. Very nice gym with great personalized service that was complimentary.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing "Heavenly" about it.”
Reviews.Author: John S
Reviews.Content: Let it be known that I have never written a review, though I felt compelled enough to share my dissatisfied experience. Long story short, we had two nights booked, then reduced it to one after just an hour in the hotel. Firstly, the Executive Club was not worth the extra cost. The attendant made us feel as though we were doing something wrong by requiring us to fill out a "guest voucher." In my 25 years of traveling (business & pleasure) I never once had to "explain" who I was for complimentary h'orderves and soft drinks. The staff had an expectation of gratuity when delivering an item (in this case a fan) to our room. I usually tip for everything, but when it feels expected, I don't. The "heavenly" robes felt and looked as though they were ten years old. The deluxe suite was nice, though a river view would have been nicer when we inquired and thus denied. Only to find out later that the hotel was at 25% capacity (direct from an employee)....I'm sure one was available. Lastly, at checkout, the office valet attendant called down to the valet, after placing his personal phone call on hold, told me it would be 10 minutes (even though we were the only ones waiting). When 15 minutes passed , our car came at a relatively fast rate of speed to the front door. I handed the valet $5 (regrettably) and then realized that he didn't even acknowledge me, my wife or our luggage, not one word or door opened for her. We found a great hotel just two blocks away at half the price (with river view), free wine and an incredibly fun atmosphere with amazing staff. We will NEVER stay at or recommend a Westin Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, a little noisy”
Reviews.Author: gefilte63
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel in a great location; it is very easy to get to all the attractions in Chicago from this location without using a cab. Staff was very attentive--especially the concierges. The only drawback was having a room on the 8th floor overlooking the river--which would seem like a good thing, except that the noise from the bridge traffic carried up to our room all day and all night. A little better window insulation would help, but otherwise this is a great choice and I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marianne M
Reviews.Content: I spent Christmas at the Westin this year and desperately needed to keep my metabolism up for all the food I was consuming. Met Sam at the fitness center and he was marvelous! After a brief chat he designed a complete workout along with stretches for upper and lower body, illustrations to all the exercises and an overview document that explained everything. He went far out of his way to be accommodating and helpful . Can't say enough about him and the rest of the staff. Many Thanks, Jerry & Marianne

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Texasdomer
Reviews.Content: The location is great. Nice to be able to walk along the river, head down to Michigan Avenue and shop and eat your heart out. The hotel is very nice and somewhat elegant. They got us a corner room which was very spacious and afforded a sitting area overlooking downtown. Room was nicely decorated and very clean. Got a great rate with parking included which is a big must in my book when heading to the Windy City. We will be looking this place up again next time we are in town.

Reviews.Title: “Vestigial Nikko organs finally excised.”
Reviews.Author: uilaw71
Reviews.Content: It had been several years since we'd sworn never to return to this former Nikko property, but meetings dictated a stay and brought a pleasant surprise. It is now fully in line with similar Westin properties and worthy of four stars. The property is on the river just north of the loop (across from Hard Rock) and convenient to Mag Mile shops and events. The meeting facilities are quite functional and service excellent even with multiple meetings on the same weekend. All the little add ons add up, but what else is new.

Reviews.Title: “Best Free Neck Massage in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: Ken J
Reviews.Content: Sam Guiragossian Manager of the Westin Gym rocks, he gives great advice and awesome neck massage. He kindly followed up after my wife and I left with a personal work out for us both. He is awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: PR
Reviews.Content: My wife and son and I stayed here for the weekend while my oldest son spent the weekend at U. of Chicago in a recruiting trip. The Westin was great. Its location is just fantastic. Close to restaurants and just a few blocks to shops. We didn't eat in the restaurant, so don't know how it was. Drinks at the bar were a bit expensive, and service was a bit slow, but it was incredibly busy. The concerige service was fantastic. We used it twice and got great recommendations for restaurants and shops. The gym is good for a hotel gym. Overall, great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, great location!”
Reviews.Author: johnsonevv
Reviews.Content: Located at Dearborn Street and the River, the Westin River North is what one would expect from a Westin. From the door man to the personnel at the front desk, the arrival at the Westin is gracious. The standard room is plenty big for two people. The bed is heavenly as billed. It's an easy walking distance to the Magnificent Mile and Macy's on State Street. The concierge made us dinner reservations at the Kinzie Chophouse - good food and easy walk. The hotel staff really want you to enjoy your visit. While we there they had hot chocolate and tasty sugar cookies. The hotel bar is comfortable, too. Really enjoyed the stay and got a good rate through Hotwire.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel for first Chicago Visit”
Reviews.Author: Coltrate
Reviews.Content: I always try to stay in SPG hotels as i feel you can be sure of the quality of these hotels and that is what I like when i travel! This hotel was no exception to this, it really lives up to the Westin name and brand. As this was our first trip to Chicago, we were unsure where to book and we were a little nervous booking this hotel but we are very glad that we did. This hotel is ideal if you would like to in the centre of Chicago. We wanted to be both near shopping and sightseeing and this was perfect. However, if i was to go back just for shopping, i would def consider staying in Westin on Michigan avenue. If you are going there before Christmas, the hotel is just beautiful, my daughter was delighted with the many christmas trees in the lobby. The rooms were a little on the small side (but then again you are staying in a city) but they were very nicely decorated and there was lots of sppace to sit and relax if you have the time. I would without a doubt stay here again on my next trip to Chicago. My only complaint is we are a starwood preferred guests and the hotel did not seem to recognise this. However I did receive a phone call from the manager with an apology with regard to this. This impressed me, it appears to be a hotel that really cares about it customers.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding rooms”
Reviews.Author: kenfr
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Westin in Chicago was a positive one. The protection from the concrete overhang off the main road was a real plus when we unloaded our car. The service personel were friendly and helpful. Beware that they don't always agree with each other. The bellman and the concierge had conflicting information. However, the rooms were outstanding. The view and amenities made our trip worthwhile. The shower and lighted makeup mirror were highlights, although one did not work. The breakfast is not included and rather pricey, but the dining room, The Embers, is conveniently located just off the lobby and the food was good. Not far from shopping and theatre, the location was great!

Reviews.Title: “Westin made our first Chicago stay unforgettable!”
Reviews.Author: marciopsiq
Reviews.Content: It is the second time that we have a wonderful experience at a Westin property even by getting there through discount websites. The first was in Paris, and now in Chicago. We were given a room with a beautiful view of the Chicago River, and the room was very large and comfortable, with a tasteful decor and wonderful bathroom. The location is perfect, in river north but right in front of the river, what is very convenient both for mag mile and for the downtown loop and it's attractions and transportation system. The hotel staff is nice and accommodating and they have provided transportation to Ohare early in a busy after thanksgiving Monday with a very fair price.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: gazlough
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Westin River North for 5 nights & really enjoyed our vacation. The main plus points for us were; 1. Very speedy check-in 2. Friendly staff - always a polite greeting & very well informed 3. Very clean & spacious rooms - we had an excellent view over the Chicago river from our 15th floor room. 4. The beds really are HEAVENLY!!!! 5. Excellent concierge service. We would recommend this hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, but rooms average”
Reviews.Author: Andrei K
Reviews.Content: (+) Courteous personnel (+) Very good central location in Chicago (+) Very clean (-) Valet parking is a rip-off: $52 (overnight parking available nearby for third the price or less) (-) Several fixtures in the bathroom were broken (e.g., shower head was cracked and sprinkling all over) (-) Very difficult to get to any power plugs in the room (-) Room was somewhat spartan, felt cheap. ...Especially, considering that that was upgraded "Delux" room.

Reviews.Title: “Among the better airport hotels.”
Reviews.Author: Lalit K
Reviews.Content: As per regular Westin standard. Late night menu is very limited though, if end up checking in late.

Reviews.Title: “Very Beautiful Hotel and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Michael S
Reviews.Content: Be sure to request a river-view room for great views of Chicago. Service is first-rate. Very Nice lobby. Easy check-in and check-out. Rooms are the best to be had.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay! Trainer on site exceeds expectations.”
Reviews.Author: hobbes2220
Reviews.Content: I travel fairly extensively for work which makes keeping up with my fitness routine more than a little challenging. In addition to the Hotel's fantastic location and site, they have made a commitment to help their guests maintain their own personal fitness goals by having a professional trainer on staff. I was absolutely delighted when, on my first day, I met Sam G at the gym. The gym is better than most hotel gyms; a few more pieces of equipment, and a LOT more of the other things that hotel gyms typically have very little of, if any (bosu balls, medicine balls, etc). Sam offered to run me through a personalized workout each of the two mornings I was at the hotel. Not only did he design a work out for me, he gave me print outs to take home so I could use what he had showed me at my own gym. Rarely have I encountered this kind of service, even at higher end hotels. Consider this hotel if working out is important to you when you travel and if you're interested in working with a great, enthusiastic trainer when you do. Kudos to the GM, Peter Simoncelli, for maintaining this important offering.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Westin.”
Reviews.Author: Grady S
Reviews.Content: Workouts with Sam in the fitness center were the highlight of my trip to Chicago. This complimentary benefit for your guests is priceless and it surprises me that others do not take advantage of this service. The fitness center itself was excellent as well. Sam took the time to develop a workout for me and then coached me through the entire workout for 3 straight days. For future trips to Chicago I plan to stay at the Westin River North to get to workout with Sam.

Reviews.Title: “I like more Michigan avenue hotels”
Reviews.Author: turistadeccs
Reviews.Content: river north is also close to most places the hotel is nice, fancy but I like the ones in the main avenue

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Stay”
Reviews.Author: lamc140
Reviews.Content: If you are an exercise enthusiast, the Westin offers the best workout facility that I've seen in a hotel. Plus, Sam, the manager of the workout room will put together a program for you and walk you through it. He's amazing. The hotel is centrally located, close to many restaurants and shopping, making it very walkable. We had a large corner room facing the river. The service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Could be cleaner”
Reviews.Author: JenniferLee2
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin Chicago River North 2011 Thanksgiving weekend. Room was nice and location was terrific. It was a bit noisy, as we could hear every car driving on the bridge over the Chicago River at night. But the view of the river was a plus. Plumbing was a problem, the toilet felt like it was going to fall off of the wall. Also, the bathrub had residue on the sides. After filling the tub to bathe my children, I noticed that the sides of the tub were not clean. I would stay here again, but maybe bring some Fantastic and paper towels to clean the tub. I would love to give a higher rating, but for the cleaning.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Wins!”
Reviews.Author: payah
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect--right in the heart of everything and very walkable. But the best part of the hotel was definitely Sam, the manager of the Westin Workout room. Sam offered the best( and daily) chair massage of life. As well, he encouraged me to begin a workout program based on my needs. He worked with me every morning. He was positive, upbeat, energetic and started my day in Chicago in the best way possible. The Club lounge was also staffed with very amenable people who helped to make our stay warm and fuzzy. After seven days, we were presented with our own morning berry bowl. The concierge worked hard to get us many dinner reservations. All in all, a fabulous experience at the Westin River North.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to expected Westin standard”
Reviews.Author: HDYankee
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin River North two nights in early September. The main reason you choose a Westin is the heavenly bed, at least for me. And the name isn't preposterous: You just don't want to get up out of it! The rooms are nice, I didn't have mich of a view but still: the rooms are nice, clean and are spacious enough. The bathroom didn't knock me out, it was ok. Nice touch were the really friendly and patient concierge staff. They really helped a lot and gave great tips for sight seeing and Chicago-style eats. Location is fine, but you do have to walk somewhat to get to anyplace of consequence. The only place right around the corner is the river, great for picture-memories.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Patricia J
Reviews.Content: Great service, fun atmosphere, rooms are gorgeous yet a little small but I would definately stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Westin Chicago River North”
Reviews.Author: Gloria B
Reviews.Content: The work facility is remarkable. It is certainly well-appointed. But the best feature is the personal trainer, Sam, on duty in the early morning. He is very perceptive in providing the right amount of assistance without being intrusive. Additionally his advice is very helpful! The complimentary 10-minute chair massage inspired me to hit the gym at at a ridiculously early hour two days in a row.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location by the river”
Reviews.Author: lvsena
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights here from 11/11 - 11/14/2011. The hotel is centrally located north of the river. The famous Magnificent Mile is about 15 minutes walk away. The Millenium park is about 25 minutes walk away. The room is a decent size. I was in Chicago for a conference so couldn't upgrade to the higher floor room (block rate) without paying $50 a night! That kinda sucked. It wasn't as if the rate I got was that great either. One of the nights, the next room was having some kind of drunken party at 2:00 A.M.. Doors slamming and much shouting. Had to call the security and it took them 30 minutes to get up to check on it. The gym inside the hotel is clean and has a nice view. I like that it opens late until 11:00 P.M. There are plenty of nice restaurants around the hotel. The room service was mediocre without much selection.

Reviews.Title: “Big hotel, with family feel”
Reviews.Author: Thymless
Reviews.Content: Arriving from the West Coast for a week long conference I found myself with a horrid cold at check in. Tee, a wonderful woman at the front desk quickly got me checked in so I could grab some cold medicine in the gift shop and crawl into bed. A few hours later i was awakened by a knock. I opened the door to room service bringing me hot chicken broth and a pot of tea with lemon and honey, along with a note from Tee at the front desk -hoping this helped me feel better...... The entire week I felt the hotel did its very best to make all it's customers feel at home. Many attendees at the conference raved about the food, service and hotel amenities. The rooms are of course filled with the Westin dream beds, showers and special amenities. The gift shop was open early in the morning as well as into the evening, making it convenient to purchase whatever you need. The area is convenient to all the city hotspots. We walked to wonderful pizza at Lou Manati's, to best steak dinner at Harey Carey's and to see broadway show at the Oriental Theatre. But it truly was the staff who made this 4 star hotel shine above all others.

Reviews.Title: “A fine Choice in a Great location”
Reviews.Author: ElQuesoGrande
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay at the Westin. All amenities one could want are here and we enjoyed a beautiful view of the Chicago River from our room. The staff , both front-desk and concierge, were very helpful and I would stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Robh9999
Reviews.Content: The Westin Chicago River North is in a great location on the North bank of the river & within walking distance of the loop & river north area. I was upgraded to a river view end room which was great, not the biggest room I have been in, but nicely laid out. I did have a problem with the room being hot at night - which was eventually diagnosed as the hotel turning the chillers off at night. I complained & on my last night the chillers were on all night & it was much better. The club lounge was in a great spot and the staff very helpful. The bar was nicely laid out & the service good. concierge very helpful. I have stayed in several Chicago hotels & this is the one I will come back to.

Reviews.Title: “CONCIERGE”
Reviews.Author: Marshall390
Reviews.Content: Denise, made us feel like we are very special. Not only did she recommend places to eat but shows to see and provided personal service by getting the charge card while we ate to provide us the service of making sure things were charged to the room so we could get the points. She made us feel like the Westin cares about each and every customer. The ordinary customer can feel special with the extra care given by your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Calm digs in solid location”
Reviews.Author: Geeksaregoodfun
Reviews.Content: The Westin Chicago River North is right across from the House of Blues and Harry Caray's. Its walking distance from the Clark/Lake stop on the Blue Line to / from the airport. The service is very good as are the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful rooms, will be back!”
Reviews.Author: exeter95
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I've stayed in Chicago, and would return to this hotel. The rooms were HUGE, clean, amazing bed and shower. The bar/restaurant is great and welcoming and the staff were helpful and friendly. They also have a very good quality gym. The location is really central. If you can't afford the Intercontinental but want to stay somewhere very nice, this is a great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, "Sam's the man"”
Reviews.Author: Dr_travelalot
Reviews.Content: Stayed here six nights for a meeting. The hotel is nicely located on the river and has beautiful views over the river. We changed rooms to one with a view and it was more than worth it. After a hard days work we started our night with a drink looking over Chicago's loop. Upgrade to executive club was partially worth the money. Breakfast was okay but wireless in room was hopeless. We had to sit in front of out door to get any reception. The room was nicely decorated but my wife's favorite are the heavenly beds. Worth mentioning is Westin's gym and especially it's manager, Sam Guiragossian! I find a good gym important in my travels. His is one of the best I worked out. Not particullary because of the state of the art equipment, but most of all because of Sam himself. He gave me some excellent advice and worked with me three days and made a tailored program to achieve my goals. He even follows up on my progress. All in all we spent a perfect week in Chicago and the Westin made it even better

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Suite was beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Pasm28
Reviews.Content: The Double Luxury Suite was a beautiful room on the 18th floor overlooking Marina Towers and House of Blues. The two double beds in the bedroom are comfortable and fine if you are used to that size bed, but for my husband and I traveling with a teenage daughter, the bed was too narrow. The two marble bathrooms are nice, the larger bathroom is off the bedroom and has a lovely jacuzzi/soaking tub (not sure which as we didn't use it). This room would be great for a meeting place before a bachelorette party or such as there is a huge dining room table and additional seating for at least 15 people - the room sleeps 4 with maybe 1 on the couch. All the staff are attentive to your needs, and the in and out valet service is excellent. On the other hand, my daughter stayed in a traditional king suite - for her wedding - and I was NOT impressed at all. The carpeting appeared to be the indoor/outdoor type and the bathroom was no better than my bathroom at home. I wished that she had the "luxury" part attached to her room as this type of suite is just a step up from a regular room because it has a small foyer when you walk in and a small living area with a couch, cocktail table and table by a window. I WISH this hotel would update their website and add pictures of the various types of rooms so the customer knows what they are getting.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pagetraveler
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a five day stay at this hotel. Never having been to Chicago before, I wanted a hotel with a central location to the sites and close to restaurants. This Westin fit the bill perfectly. We had a club room at the end of the hall with a fantastic view of the Chicago River, and privileges to use the lounge on the 20th floor for complimentary continental breakfast and evening snacks (mixed drinks and wine were extra). That was a great benefit: the breakfast was ample, and it was nice in the evening to relax before dinner and look out the windows and see all the activity in the city. The staff in the lounge and throughout the hotel were very helpful and responsive. We especially want to thank Lisa at the concierge's desk for her advice on great restaurants, most within walking distance. James, at the bellman's desk, welcomed us each morning. I did not use the workout room (enough walking around the city, nor the lobby restaurant. We were very impressed with this hotel and would stay there again on our next visit to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great fitness staff”
Reviews.Author: Michael G
Reviews.Content: Sam GUIRAGOSSIAN, manager of the fitness center, is one of the primary reasons I stay at the Westin River North in Chicago. His positive attitude and energy start off my day right. It is the same positive experience I have each time I stay. Thanks again, Sam.

Reviews.Title: “An Fancy Hotel At A Fair Price”
Reviews.Author: REVIEWS10161
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed in this hotel last November, and I can't tell you how great this hotel was. The restaurant we ate at for breakfast called the "Ember Grille" was fantastic. The service was great, we had a doorman at night open the door for us and he tipped his hat. The rooms were spacious and clean. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The lobby had beautiful furnishings including believe it or not, a japanese fountain surrounded by stone. The hotel itself is quiet and it's conveniently located near fun attractions such as Navy Pier and it's so close from downtown. If you want a nice hotel, why pass up this one. I liked it and I know you'll love it too.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel and Responsive Staff”
Reviews.Author: Ted B
Reviews.Content: With 20 years of business travel under my belt, I can say that the Westin River North is my favorite hotel in Chicago. The location is perfect whether on business or pleasure with many many wonderful restaurants within three blocks. The staff is incredibly pleasant and always responsive to any need or to any issue that may occur with your room. the rooms are well appointed and very comfortable with some terrific views if you ask. The new workout center has one of the best gyms adn facilities with professional and friendly staff. The lobby restaurant (with sushi bar) and bar are comfortable, warm and open with quality food and a usually fun group of fellow travelers and locals. I highly recommend this hotel to others and return as frequently as possible!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel on the skirts of the main shopping areas”
Reviews.Author: jadewin82
Reviews.Content: This Westin is definitely nicer than most Westins. The staff was nice and helpful, though for a tourist and from NYC I probably would have preferred to stay right in downtown. The hotel is about a 10 min walk from the busier restaurant area and 15 min walk from Millenium Park, Michigan Ave, and downtown. This is probably close enough for most people, being from NYC I'm especially lazy. The blue line is 1.5 blocks away convenient for taking the train to and from the airport. We ordered room service when we got in late, the chicken sandwich and burger is good. Don't order the sushi, it's not terrible but it's not good. Free Starbucks coffee in the room is always a plus. It was nice of them to upgrade us to the club room levels including free internet with free continental breakfast and snacks in the afternoon. Nothing amazing at breakfast, coffee, yogurt, fruit, cereal, some pasteries and bagels, but it was enough for us in the AM. I booked this using points, I would definitely not pay $350/night which was the going rate. Though it was quiet, the bed and pillows were terrible, really unexpected from a Westin hotel and unfortunate. We did not sleep well and woke up with back aches every night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, Perfect for Business & Leisure Travelers”
Reviews.Author: bkl2
Reviews.Content: The River North is centrally located to the main business district and offers nice access to nightlife. It's less than 15 minute walk to downtown and 5 minutes away from a bunch of cool bars and across the street from Harry Caray's steakhouse. This Westin is also a notch above your typical Westin. Rooms are rather large for a major city hotel and nicely appointed. Lots of marble in the baths, for example. This is a great place to stay on business. Only thing missing for a family stay is a pool.

Reviews.Title: “Mid Sized Pension and Retirement Plan Conference”
Reviews.Author: JosephEk
Reviews.Content: Easy access, nice walk from the train station. Very nice rooms, service was excellent, cordial and accomodating. Meeting rooms were comfortable temperature, chairs were nice also.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Jetagain
Reviews.Content: Everyone at the Westin River North was willing to go the extra mile to make our stay great. From the friendly greeting by the parking valet to the desk clerk who had no problem letting us use our room an hour after check out time everyone seemed to want to keep our business. The room itself was average size with a comfortable bed and an updated bath. Everything was very clean. An unexpected bonus was free access to a well equipped fitness center and the services of a personal trainer. Sam, the trainer, had a degree in exercise physiology and limitless enthusiasm for helping me reach my fitness goals. He walked me through an hour's worth of strength training and stretching exercises and then drew up a personalized exercise plan and emailed it to me the next day. The location was very convenient. Close to the shopping on Michigan Avenue and about a mile from the Art Institute. My only complaint was the "mini bar obsession". We weren't in our room 30 minutes when they knocked on our door to restock it. The next morning they knocked on my door while I was in the shower and, when I didn't respond, they started to enter just when I was stepping out of the tub. I told them to leave. They kept coming back the rest of the morning and, when I finally let the restocker in, he admonished me to put the "Do not Disturb" sign out. Really? Can't they wait until I check out?

Reviews.Title: “good location and comfortable quiet room”
Reviews.Author: dustylin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of our holiday and arrived mid morning after travelling for 5 hours on a train . The hotel was only a short taxi ride from Union station.We were allocated a room on arrival and were able to have a late breakfast which we appreciated as we were tired and hungry The room was on the 9th floor with a side view of the river. It was very clean with comfortable bed and bedding and the usual amenities.There was a good sized bathroom with a decent bath and shower over the bath. The hotel location was convenient to the shops and attractions of central Chicago and we were able to walk to most of them.The concierge staff were extremely helpful and gave us lots of good advice, directions etc.We used the bar in the lobby for drinks and to use the free Wi-Fi. We would stay here again and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel combines great service with an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: jhigtiger
Reviews.Content: I recently spent three nights at the Westin River North on business. The lobby is expansive and very attractive. My room was clean and had all the amenities that one would expect for this class of hotel. I appreciate the option of no housekeeping on each day in exchange for Starpoints reward points. The conference utilized hotel meeting rooms on its lower levels and they were very good. While I am generally not a "high maintenance" guest, my encounters with hotel staff were professional and pleasant. I also enjoyed the workout room very much. It was apparently updated recently, and it shows. In total, I had a very good experience at the Westin River North.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent downtown location, lives up to Westin brand promise”
Reviews.Author: PlanninPaula
Reviews.Content: Westin Chicago River North is a great location downtown, walking distance to restaurants, shops, and sightseeing. Direct access to the riverwalk. The rooms were spacious, and adequate. The bathroom was moderately updated. The staff was very attentive. We stayed for Chicago Marathon weekend, and when we returned to the room the night before the marathon, they had left a 'Marathon Care Package' including powerade, bottled water, & a couple energy bars. Parking, as with any downtown hotel, was very expensive at $52 a night + heavy traffic, i would highly recommend public transportation (El was very easy to navigate, and taxis are everywhere). The marketed 'Heavenly beds' were exactly that, the 'Heavenly showers' on the otherhand, were sub-par.

Reviews.Title: “Right on the river”
Reviews.Author: nicholasevans
Reviews.Content: The Westin Chicago River North is in a prime location for touring the city. The hotel has great access to all waterfront activities, Marina City Trump Tower, the boat cruises and wonderful restaurants. It's also a quick drive to most other activities and sites around town. The hotel itself is a pretty standard Westin. The lobby is quite large but is consumed mostly with a restaurant. The river views are blocked in the lobby by a wall and garden. The common spaces and hall ways are dimly lit. We were given a club floor room with a side view of the Chicago River. The room was nice, muted tones and comfortable bed. The bathroom was somewhat outdated (very old wallpaper, a wall phone that had yellowed over time, outdated marble) but met our needs. The club room was nice for breakfast although pretty crowded. Selections included breads, pastries, fruits, cereals and yogurt. They carried typical breakfast beverages but no champagne for mimosas.

Reviews.Title: “Location is key”
Reviews.Author: Paul P
Reviews.Content: The rooms are ok - pretty dark though. The fitness center upgrade is nice! There aren't many hotels in the central loop area and the location of the Westin is close enough to the business districts and lots of river north restaurants/shops, which is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: susiemarshall
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel recently while attending a conference and although the price was a little higher than I would expect to pay for this sort of hotel, I found the location, cleanliness and service were excellent on the whole. Although my colleague and I arrived early the receptionist was kind enough to find us both river view rooms, which were very comfortable. The one let down was having to wait 15 minutes for the valet to bring our car around which, as there is no self-parking facility at the hotel, we would have expected a slightly better service. All in all though, I would definitely recommend this as a good place to stay in downtown Chicago, within easy reach of Navy Pier, Michigan Avenue and Millennium Park.

Reviews.Title: “Canadians 2011”
Reviews.Author: Chris O
Reviews.Content: Excellent visit - the concierge and Sam in the workout room were both great - Sam worked with us for four mornings and really got both of us going again - fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “It was a very nice experience”
Reviews.Author: Gidoc2011
Reviews.Content: They updated the work out room and it was great. They have a trainer who I worked out with for a full hour at no charge! He was really good! The only thing I didn't like was room service food, but the food in the restaurant was really good.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer Service”
Reviews.Author: KYLEAB
Reviews.Content: I was staying there on business for 6 nights and upon arrival the air conditioning was making noise. They quickly send up someone to fix it and also earplugs just in case I wanted to sleep in the meantime. I also have very bad allergies, and didnt sleep great on the pillows. I called down and the night manager was GREAT! He personally delivered hypo-allergenic pillows. The next day I got a follow up phone call from both him and the day manager to see how I slept. I slept great! I like perfection which is hard to get, but when the staff go out of there way to help accommodate, that to me means more. Keep up the great service!

Reviews.Title: “From the beds to the gym: the Westin is the place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: pucklax7
Reviews.Content: The Westin is great: heavenly beds, above average room service, awesome amenities for road warriors. Be sure to chat with Sam at the gym: if every gym had a Sam they'd be better off.

Reviews.Title: “Great Chicago hotel”
Reviews.Author: ads201259
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two weeks for work and I found this hotel to be a real "home away from home". The staff are very friendly and attentive. I had stayed here previously 16 months ago and all the staff remembered me and were exceptionally genuine and friendly. The hotel facilities are great and the gym has had a complete makeover with top of the line exercise machines. My room was a larger than normal corner room overlooking the river so it was very nice. Location wise this hotel is witihin walking distance of great shopping, both north and south side and several excellent bars and restaurants within a 2 to 3 block walking distance. For good neighbourhood bars I recommend O'Callaghans and Fado.

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel close to everything”
Reviews.Author: joylama
Reviews.Content: Visited this hotel on business and found the rooms to be nice, the staff to be very helpful and was impressed with the meeting facilities. The hotel is well located for a family stay as well, though, I am not sure it would be the most cost-effective option for families. Overall a very good choice for the business traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection.”
Reviews.Author: mirandabader
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here once before and was not disappointed either time. This hotel is beautiful, every bit if it. The bar is elegant as well. The location is great. It's hard to write a review, except to say you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: brooklyngurl
Reviews.Content: A colleague recommended this hotel because of it's proximity to major sites and to millennium park. I really do not have any complaints about the hotel. I really liked that we were able to take the train to ohare airport for $2.25! Give yourself 40 minutes for this ride.

Reviews.Title: “Sick of Being OverCharged at the Honor Bar”
Reviews.Author: marasis111
Reviews.Content: Everytime I stay here if I use something out of the honor bar, Ie a box of pringles, I end up getting charged for several items. Their ability to track actual consumption is incredibly frustrating (lacking). I then have to get on the phone and get the charges removed which is a huge waste of my time. Most recently, I drank a bottle of water which is advertised as $5.00. On my bill, I was charged $7.32. 1) The actual charge is $5.50 which is not advertised and 2) there is $1.82 of tax on a $5.50 bottle of water (33%). I'm really not quite sure how this is legal. Either way, I am frustrated and done staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently good. Well located.”
Reviews.Author: lhansen80
Reviews.Content: Over the years I have stayed here several times for different business events. It is right on the river, a short walk from the train, and always ends up being close to wherever my meetings are. Reception folks have always been nice, location always clean and room floors have always been very quiet. On this most recent visit I drove. The 24 hr valet at hotel was 52/night, but there are several parking structures near by. Leaving the hotel on Dearborn, go left on Kinzie and the Sterling self park was only $28 for 24 hours. Handy CVS pharmacy is in the same location if you happen to forget anything.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but Nice”
Reviews.Author: DelicateEssie
Reviews.Content: We were in town for some meetings and our preferred hotel was unavailable so we were able to secure a room here. The location is very convenient and there are lots of nice restaurants within an easy walking distance. As ever, I ordered room service, which was delivered promptly and very courteously. I even treated myself to a sundae which they brought in deconstructed form so you could assemble it yourself when the time came. The food was pretty good, though I do wish there had been more selections offered. The concierge was helpful in selecting restaurants to dine in and all the staff made it a point to serve with a smile. My only disappointment was how expensive the hotel was relative to the quality of the hotel. Were it a less expensive stay I would have been more satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “large room, comfortable bed, good location”
Reviews.Author: FrugalTraveler95
Reviews.Content: We booked a special nonrefundable rate several months in advance. It included an excellent continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “This Westin is always consistent.”
Reviews.Author: MisterOpinion
Reviews.Content: This Westin started out in life as a Nikko as I recall. It used to be a very popular gathering place too - unless I just happened on the hotel during big conferences or something; as it seems very quite now! It's a convenient location for me; and the Westin, like most SPG hotels rates high in the consistency department. Check-in staff very efficient. The hotel - largish, is welll-maintained. The rooms are spacious and the beds/duvets what we've come to expect from Westin. What confuses me, is the large expanse of desserted public areas off the lobby. Is it a lounge, is it a bar, is it a restarant -- or none of these? I am never quite sure. I've kind of given up on poor-overpriced breakfasts in city hotels, so I cannot comment on the F+B offerings but it seems the hotel restaurant has also had several lives. Come to think of it, the lobby lounge used to have a sushi-twist to it. In conclusion? Shop on the internet and if you get a rate that suits you - stay at the Westin! And always watch out for rates in Chicago. They can, as befits a big convention town, fluctuate wildly -- and a $250 hotel one week can be $450 another! I've also stayed at The Rennaissance across the street (approx!) which is also reliable. Breakfast there can be quite good with a light and airy restaurant - though service is often slow - and I just hate oversized coffee mugs - perfectly designed to ensure your berverage gets cold quickly!

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: demiglace62
Reviews.Content: A conundrum for this property. Great location and great staff with an average building. On the river with great views and proximity to everything Chicago. The staff was exceptional from start to finish, friendly and attentive. Our displeasure was the inadequate AC in the middle of summer. For the price, appropriate cooling should be expected. Not a bad choice, but questionable for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Location, Very SPG Friendly but Parking was a Problem”
Reviews.Author: travelingdoc42
Reviews.Content: This Westin had one of the best trained staffs I have ever seen. Kudos to a great manager! The front desk clerks were particularly good, asking all to the right questions and offering the right information before I even asked. Its location was right on the river and conveniently located near theaters, a large number of great restaurants and between two major shopping areas. As a Platinum SPG we had access to the club lounge which was good sized and had a lot or easy to eat at tables...the evening hors d'oeuvres were nothing special but the continental breakfast, while basic, was quite good and fast....even though the lounge seem to have been invaded by a sizable group of (very well behaved)young people who may or may not have belonged there. Our upgraded room really felt like an upgrade, being a larger corner room with a great view of the river. The parking was valet only and the most expensive ($52/24 hours) and slowest ( 25 minutes when expecting < 10minutes at 1:20 pm on a beautiful Sunday afternoon at time there were very few guests checking in or out) I have ever encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, no issues”
Reviews.Author: Seven_Continents
Reviews.Content: The location is great if you plan on doing a lot of running around Chicago. It's walking distance to both Lake El stations which means you have every El line close by and a straight ride from O'hare for $2.25. The lobby is large and a nice place to meet and hang out. They have 3 pay computers to use. I have some status and got probably the best room location, a river view at the end of the hall. The room looked like housekeeping had cleaned it in a hurry, the drawers were all open and a couple of spots needed a sweeping though. The room was a bit larger than normal and the bathroom was large. Between the wide bathtub and curved shower curtain rod I felt like I was showering in a wet room. Sheets and towels were of good quality as was everything else. Everything else was Westin nominal. Definately recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and very convenient if you have business in downtown”
Reviews.Author: nkashyap
Reviews.Content: +tive: - Club level access is very good as you get breakfast in the morning and snacks from 5-7 - Service was exceptional - Noise level was minimal (except for one night when neighboring room got very loud) -tive: Valet service is one of the worst I have encountered and really detracted from the stay. Long wait times, wrong car brought out, almost impossible to reach via telephone from the room. Views are not very good if that is what you are looking for. Only 20 stories tall so even the highest floor gets no view unless you are facing the river (ok view)

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel with great river view”
Reviews.Author: DrVandy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here early August for school business. Meeting rooms were very comfortable, however the escalator died on the way to the rooms. Had to use the broken escalator. Not fun. However the people were very friendly and the concierge was helpful with restaurant recommendations. Centrally located in the heart of the city. Easy walk to many restaurants and pubs. Parking a little expensive - only valet parking available - hope you are on an expense account! Heavenly bed just that - Westin known for that of course. Nice view of the river - next time want to take a water taxi excursion. I'd like to stay here for St. Patty's day and the coloring of the river green.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful property, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: SparkyWI
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Westin Chicago River North last month for a quick couple getaway - we had an excellent experience at the hotel which provided great service, was very clean and we thoroughly enjoyed the complimentary reception and breakfast included with our club level room. Location is within walking distances to many of Chicago's great theaters and directly across the street is one of our favorite wine/cheese bars in Chicago, Bin 36 - I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Treatment”
Reviews.Author: Gordonm1
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to comment on the level of service at this hotel. Nothing but top notch. Specific credit goes to Sam who manages the fitness center. Sam goes way beyond what is expected in a hotel fitness center. He remembers my name each time I visit; offering complementary chair messages and expert advice on general fitness. It is simply very hard to find this level of personal service anymore...anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Staff makes the difference!”
Reviews.Author: toddurkin
Reviews.Content: Jonathon and his team at the front desk made the difference is our visit. This hotel is the best we've found in Chicago. While the location is useful its helpful & friendly staff makes it a great hotel! We will be back and we strongly recommend putting your visit into their capable hands.

Reviews.Title: “Concierge and Club Level personnel impressed”
Reviews.Author: soxfan63
Reviews.Content: Just returned home from a 4 night stay - we had stayed last summer as well. Great location, Heavenly beds, attentive staff, amazing river views. Two staff members stood out - Sam in the fitness room (so many people have mentioned him in reviews, it's no wonder) and Lisa Treacy at Concierge. She went above and beyond - made some terrific restaurant recommendations (Hub 51 and Lou Malnati's), booked reservations on a sunset architecture cruise and smoothly handled any and all inquiries. Sometimes very busy, she was attentive but also was able to multi-task so well to keep waits at a minimum. She greatly enhanced our Chicago experience! I'd highly recommend booking at the Club Level. We did so this year after a complimentary upgrade there last year. The breakfast was delicious - fresh fruit, coffee and tea, bagels, yogurt, etc. Early evenings had appetizers and desserts. Often times we'd bring a little something back to our room to eat late at night. The lounge was staffed with attentive, professional welcoming workers. It was a pleasure to see them each morning or night. I thought the rooms were showing their age a bit, but overall our hotel experience was very positive. I would recommend this hotel to family and friends. My only complaint was about check out - there were 2 small discrepancies with our bill (which were resolved) but the clerk helping me made no eye contact and no apology on behalf of the hotel, or thanks for staying here, have a good trip home. A major blunder - room for improvement there.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: swimmy4
Reviews.Content: I was traveling on business, but it was great to be in a hotel that was within walking distance of good shopping and restaurants. The staff was very helpful, especially the gym attendant. I had a problem with my Internet connection, and the staff went to great lengths to fix it right away. Hub 51 is a wonderful, reasonably priced restaurant that is very close by.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Bethcurt123
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay! The Westin Workout was our favorite part. The free personal training was top notch.

Reviews.Title: “A Detail-Oriented Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Care04
Reviews.Content: This hotel met and exceeded my expectations. The room was spacious, as was the bathroom. The Westin brand impresses me with their heavenly beds and their white sheets and bedcovers. The beds are very clean and inviting. I truly liked the soft lighting in the bathroom. Someone was thinking when they designed this hotel. It's a gem. P.S. The view of the Chicago river and the beautiful Chicago skyline was fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “American Girl Weekend”
Reviews.Author: dudelookslikealady
Reviews.Content: We took the megabus from Cleveland to Chicago, then we took a cab from the Megabus stop to the Westin Chicago river North ($5); The hotel is very nice, modern clean. the rooms are a nice size, beds are very comfortable and the bathrooms are also very nice. Right outside is The House of Blues, and Michigan Ave is a 5-10 min walk. Also, the double decker bus stop has 2 stops nearby. There were 6 girls, and 5 moms/grandma's and we all had a great time! I used cash and points through American Express, so the rooms were quite cheap, thus worth the value for sure. Too bad there's no pool

Reviews.Title: “Great chicago hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hantrevspenc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a wedding and would have stayed longer. Rooms are spacious, beds are comfy and clean. Ask for a room with a view of the river. Fun place to stay in chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location and Nicely Maintained Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Phoenixroby
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay recently. It is the perfect location with many restaurant and entertainment opportunities within walking distance. The room was nicely updated and well maintained. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Barb1045
Reviews.Content: The Westin River North is a very nice hotel, but what really made my stay great was the staff. Sam, the Workout Manager, at the hotel was incredibly encouraging and kept the fitness center very clean and well organized. It was so great to have his welcoming encouragement every morning! He even followed up with me after my stay and provided a customized strength training regimen for me to follow. The hotel is in a great area for restaurants, and the conscierge helped me find a wonderful restaurant for the one free night I had during my stay - she called ahead to make sure they had a table and they gave me a complimentary dessert to thank me for coming over based on her recommendation. Even the housekeeping and bell staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. It's hard for a hotel property to set itself apart from the rest and still keep rates affordable for business travelers. So it really is the hotel staff that make all the difference.

Reviews.Title: “Experience was what I was hoping for”
Reviews.Author: Ray11311
Reviews.Content: Overall quite a positive experience. Service and quality of facilities was high and what I have come to expect at a Westin. Highnote was the fitness center and its manager(?) Sam. He was knowledgeable, personable, exuded energy and had a unique disarming approach in dealing with folks. Lownote was the breakfast experience. Ordered a fruit/yogurt type drink to go and was initially charged 3 times the amount on the menu and it took a bit of time for it to get straightened out.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: TCinSF
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay at this hotel and plan to do it again when we return. Plusses: - Wonderful service - Heavenly bed, of course - Nice gym - Within walking distance to the CTA Clarke/Lake Station, Michigan Mile, West Loop (great restaurants), Millenium Park, Chicago River Minuses: - Wi-fi in our room didn't work, and IT wasn't able to fix the problem. Based on our hotel experience, it often appears that rooms furthest away from the router have the weakest signal. You may want to inquire at the front desk if this is important to you. Tips: - Great restaurants (Girl & The Goat, The Publican) - Great tours (Bucktown/Wicker Park Food Tour, Architecture Foundation Boat Cruise)

Reviews.Title: “Nice relaxing hotel with convenient amenities”
Reviews.Author: CentralLTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin River North for the 4th of July weekend to attend two Cubs-White Sox games. This hotel is just what Westin hotels are cracked up to be. Never disappointed when I stay at a Westin hotel. Very modern theme, friendly staff, and when we arrived, they even let us check in early since we were going to the 3 pm game at Wrigley, and upgraded us to a corner room for no extra charge! NICE! The room was very spacious and clean with a great view of the Chicago river. This hotel sits just across from the House of Blues and Harry Caray's restaurant, which allowed us to walk across the street and enjoy both places. We booked our room online for $20 more than the regular rate, a package that included a breakfast for 2 the next morning - and you could either enjoy the buffet downstairs, or room service! This made it worth the cost of the room! We opted for the room service since we wanted to stay in the room to get ready for the Cub game the next day. Ever get room service for $20 bucks? This was my first time, and I will remember this hotel because of this amenity! Only downside of this hotel is the $52 per night parking fee for your vehicle. However, this is the norm for all downtown Chicago hotels. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. Great job Westin!

Reviews.Title: “My worst hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: VivianW
Reviews.Content: I made an internet reservation for Westin Chicago River North for three nights. I paid over $600 for this non-refundable reservation. I could not make it for the first night but I wanted to check in for the second night. When I called to make sure that my room would be ready when I arrive I was told that my reservation was cancelled because I did not check in on the first day, the hotel has no room for me and I shall receive no refund as this was a non-refundable reservation. I was told that that's how their system "works". The receptionist which I spoked with was plain rude, she eventually told me "you're not here, let it go" and hanged up on me. She also seemed to mock my last name. When I called again a woman named Victoria Marsch who introduced herself as "hotel manager" confirmed that I would have neither room nor refund. My confirmation email which I received from Westin after I made my reservation contained no information that if I do not show up on time then I would have neither room nor refund. Again, it was a prepaid reservation.

Reviews.Title: “very consistent and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: NKM70
Reviews.Content: The primary reason I use this for business travel is the comfort of the rooms, great location and the fitness center. Sam provides the best fitness center service in all my travels...includes over 100 hotels.

Reviews.Title: “It was just okay”
Reviews.Author: Lemondrop68
Reviews.Content: The housekeeping was very friendly and helpful as well as the front desk but the concierge service was terrible; they were not helpful, too busy and unfriendly. We were left to figure things out on our own.

Reviews.Title: “Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: voproductions
Reviews.Content: Stayed over 4 days in July for a conference, hotel is a pure business hotel in a great location, rooms and hotel clean, staff friendly and efficent, had no issue with them. The conference rooms were mostly windowless, this however was not a fault of the hotel only the organisers. Availed of there green room offer, this means that no one enters your room, I would of thought that they would have emptyied the bins and replenish the coffee, however this was not on offer, maybe they should think about this aspect, it is a green room promotion not a dirty room promotion, I understand not changing out the towels and sheets, but the rest could have been looked after. It should be titled the no housekeeping promotion. All in all very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Great, comfortable stay in a nice location”
Reviews.Author: Stadium117
Reviews.Content: We enjoy staying at Westin hotels and picked this location out of the options within the downtown Chicago area. The location can't be beat as it's right by the river with access to the Theatre District, Magnificent Mile, Navy Pier and the Millienium Park. The room was pretty spacious for the standard tier with a nice view of the river and extra furniture. The concierge and front desk staff were also quite helpful when needed. I'd say the only downside is the value. You do pay a nice price for a place like the Westin, so it would be nice to get a value-add such as free Internet throughout the facility. Unfortunately you have to be a Gold or Platinum member of the Starwood Membership Program to receive that. Overall, we were happy with the accommodations and would highly recommend it for quality, location and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: canicetravels
Reviews.Content: This place is always really clean and super accomodating. If I get there early they will always try to find me a room and the front staff desk is always super friendly! It also has great areas to hang out at and relax and the locaiton is awesome around dining and entertainment I highly recommend it!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, excellent Wstin Workout.”
Reviews.Author: Pdx74
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a great stay recently. Was upgraded as a Platinum to a great room. Had a great workout in the gym with the very friendly Westin Workout manager Sam providing assistance.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money...”
Reviews.Author: j75fr
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in the hotel. First of all I did not enjoy the atmosphere as everything is really dark from the reception area to the rooms. After almost 15 min waiting check in was pretty quick. The rooms are as I said missing light, features are nice with a MAC, ipod stations,... We had two reservations and they forgot to inform housekeeping about it, so the room got not cleaned (only on our request) although we checked in for two days. Next day, although they knew we would check out they knocked at our door at 8am. Not really Westin quality. Mentioned turndown service on the website was also not provided The lounge was a joke, always empty buffet and crowded.
