Out of bagels at 9h30.... no comment The fitness equipment was good, no professional trainer as mentioned on their website, dirty, no towels,... Overall disappointing, there are much better hotels in Chicago. If you like Starwood go to the W City Center or Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Not as Wonderful as I Expected . . .”
Reviews.Author: lopo
Reviews.Content: Firstly, let me clarify: the hotel is in a nice location (nearby shopping, restaurants, entertainment, etc.), but service is not consistent & guests are nickel and dimed throughout their stay. I stayed here because I was attending a business meeting over several days. The lobby is large and dark (not especially welcoming.) There were 100s of us staying at the hotel, but the nightly rate was certainly not a bargain. The room I received looked out at another tall building so, as a result, even though the sun was shining, it always looked dark out the window. The room was 'OK": nice size, closet with safe, both an upholstered chair and a lounge chair. desk & chair, dresser, nightstands, and a bar. Bathroom was lovely! Nice marble floor, well lit, excellent shower (2 heads, good water pressure), quality products. The TV needs to be either lifted (on top of the dresser) or hung on the wall since it is in front of the bed and not easy to watch from the bed. Water bottle in room is exorbitant (one could pick up a case of water around the corner from the hotel for less $); Internet in room is also pricey ($10+ daily.) At $200+ a night for the room, Internet should be provided! When I left the tip for the housekeeper daily, I asked her to leave a shower cap & another bar of soap. Got the soap but no cap. (Called guest services & one was delivered.) Since I forgot something, I ordered item online & had it delivered to the hotel. When I went to the front desk to pick up, I was shocked to see that the hotel charged me $10. REALLY?! By the way, I am a 'preferred guest'. I did receive one benefit as such: a late check out since my flight was scheduled for late afternoon. Overall, I didn't think that the staff was service-oriented, but there were a couple of staff I found to be exceptional. Kwasi A., one of the attendants in the Executive Club, was the perfect host: courteous, pleasant, knowledgeable, friendly, accommodating. Also, Sandra, the person I only spoke with on the phone several times, was efficient and friendly. It was always a pleasure to speak with her when I had to call to arrange for a wake-up call, etc. If I return to Chicago, I probably would select another hotel (since there are so many to choose from) unless I found a much better nightly rate here. This hotel wasn't bad overall, it just was not exceptional or any better than good.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem! Great location, facilities, and PEOPLE...and good price!”
Reviews.Author: Stewprop
Reviews.Content: Eric, who helps with your luggage knew ALL the new restaurant spots..and was VERY helpful...that guy should get a promotion to concierage at this or a very good hotel. He couldn't have been nicer or more knowlegeable..and Jordan at the front desk was wonderful. Very professional. This guy will be a hotel GM one day soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, pretty nice”
Reviews.Author: bebegd
Reviews.Content: Well, we had a deluxe room (a step up from the entry level room) that had a wonderful river view. Highly recommend getting a river view. The location in the River North neighborhood is wonderful- great restaurants all around (across from the House of Blues too). The hotel was nice. I'm sure we'll stay there again, since we are able to get a pretty good corporate discount on it (around 220/night) but I will say that I think the hotel room was showing its age just a little. Nothing extreme, like nothing broken or anything, but for example, the drain in the sink was rusted. Some soap scum in the tub/shower (shower heads looked like they could use a good cleaning as well). You could definitely hear outside sounds (not just emergency sirens, but cars/trucks going over the bridge). It's a very nice hotel, just missing some of the shininess of a newer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with an awesome view”
Reviews.Author: Srikg
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for a week on business. Centrally located with great views. One may checkout the lake by taking a quick walk. Restaurants are good and the staff is warm and courteous. Concierge services are very good.

Reviews.Title: “Gouge the guest”
Reviews.Author: Dangleburt
Reviews.Content: Stayed nearly a week. Rooms are nothing special, but fine. But man, does this place gouge its guests. $10 for the internet, $52 to park a car (which is more than I paid to rent it), $7.50 for a bottle of water (I found out only because they charged me for this, I didn't drink it, and when I called to get the bill fixed they actually argued with me about it -- "Are you sure you didn't drink it? Do you know which bottle we are talking about? Did someone else perhaps drink it?"). You can find better places with better attitudes toward their guests all over Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: AMM5226
Reviews.Content: This is a good business hotel. The rooms are just fine and good for the business traveller. Concierge is helpful. Check in and out is efficient. I don't know that I would stay in this location for a personal trip but for business it works.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed in Westin”
Reviews.Author: cl2003
Reviews.Content: I checked into this hotel very late at night. I was exhausted and wanted to get to my room. Well the front desk person was friendly, check-in took forever and I was the only person there. When I got to the room, none of the outlets worked and two of the lamps were out. When I told them about this problem, all they said was they would fix it before the next person got there. I just recently switched over my business travel from Hilton to SPG and this experience along with a few other recent experiences is making me reconsider. The brand is too inconsistent.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed it and will definitely look into staying again my next time in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: design2011
Reviews.Content: The customer service, cleanliness, aesthetic and amenities were awesome! I especially enjoyed and got the most value from the one on one personal training session with Sam at the Westin Spa. He was very professional and gave thorough advice and training instruction.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Jeffwhatever
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about what you'd expect for a 4-star hotel in this area. Rooms sizes are about average to large and very clean. I've stayed at a few 4-star hotels in the area and I would say that there is anything in particular about these rooms that make them any better than the other 4-star hotels, but they do live up to what is expected. Bathrooms are average for this price level. All marble with ample sink and counter space. Nice, overall. The location is River North, which means you're a short walk from great restaurants and nightlife. Public parking is also nearby. Overall, this is a fine hotel that lives up to it's 4-star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot for weekend getaway in Chicago - Theater District Access”
Reviews.Author: swaynewilson
Reviews.Content: This hotel serves as a fabulous hub to get to your favorite downtown Chicago locations. My wife and I chose to stay here for a quick weekend get-away. You are within walking distance to most downtown attractions. We walked to the Ford/Oriental Theater to see a touring version of the musical - "Chicago". 3 blocks from the hotel. Then on to Catch 35 - great seafood restaurant - 1 block from hotel, river cruise - 1 block, shopping - 2 blocks. Waited for bell-staff to valet our car - ended up going inside to get him. After that minor glitch, staff was delightful and extremely helpful. Desk staff was extremely nice. I have had several recent run-ins and problems with other Westin Hotels. This hotel restored a bit of my faith in the brand. Room well-appointed with a beautiful peek-a-boo view of the river. Room was in good repair and clean. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheBayou
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel at least 100 nights over the past 5 years. This is your typical Westin hotel: good location for business, decent workout facilities, ok but expensive room service and good bar in the lobby to have a couple of drinks and socialize. The rooms are always clean and are turned over efficiently. The hotel is also very good at allowing early check-ins. The rates are reasonable but can skyrocket if there is a convention being held at the hotel. The hotel is located on the river and is easy walking distance from Michigan Ave. There are great restaurants within walking distance and there are restaurants that deliver to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Poor”
Reviews.Author: dr_v_page
Reviews.Content: In my opinion, the veneer of a 4 star hotel but scratch the surface and it fails to deliver, almost cheapskate. For instance, nice coffee in the room but no choice of ceramic cups or cardboard - just cardboard (home away from home? see more below) and if you would like extra you pay. For 1-800 numbers $2 plus tax, not the case in the previous hotel I stayed at in Indianapolis. Internet $9.95 for 24 hours - (try the Omni, join their partnership scheme, free and immediate effect for free internet and water.) I arrived back half 3 to find my room in the same way I had left it that morning. Turns out housekeeping goes on up until 5. I think this inadequate and say so - reception, manager apologise for the inconvenience with very sincere bobs of their heads but agree yes that is how it works. Basically your room may not be comfortable until gone 5 on any given day. Wanted to use a phone downstairs for a 1-800 - response from reception "your room will be ready in a few minutes" (I didn't ask; a waitress wanted to on my behalf, I was fed up with the ineffectual sincerity and not surprised with the response). Luggage assistance, one guy on (don't expect any of those valet services I'm used to in this class hotel) - he gave poor service, didn't get a tip, gave the heavily ironic "thank you for allowing me to be of service to you" as he turned his back. Mind, I did make my thoughts on that clear to him at the time. Add in the stale identifiable smell in the bathroom and the fact that in order to have the safe, which was in a locked position but open, so it could be used you had to be in the room. My advice to travellers is don't stay here unless you are a very undemanding business man who will be out all day and on expenses. My advice to Westin is forget the in room exercise programmes, maybe employ more minimum wage staff, maybe give them more than minimum wage if you have problem staffing, to mop bathroom floors and deal with luggage. And empty apologies, however sincerely and quick to be given are not what the customer wants - there needs to be some substance behind them. (I did get offered a free breakfast after the manager had spent about half an hour figuring it might be warranted) On the plus side the lounge staff were excellent and the sashimi was great.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel that Works”
Reviews.Author: BrownStreet
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a get-away weekend at Westin Chicago River North. Great first impressions as we could not expect more professional and courteous service from the doorman, front desk and bellman. Throughout our stay every staff member made us feel welcome. We stayed in the standard king room which was very roomy and included a sofa, chair and large desk. The room had a limited view of the Chicago River. The bathroom was large and can easily accommodate two people, loved the â€œHeavenly Showerâ€�. We did not have any noise issues and their â€œHeavenly Bedâ€� is very comfortable. As stated in all of the previous posts, the location is great. Negatives: two of the treadmills in the fitness room were not working, extended wait for our car from the valet service and why do they have to charge for internet usage. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Walk to everything from this wonderful hotel with an amazing staff.”
Reviews.Author: sunnyangel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the NRA convention May 20-24. The hotel is in the middle of all you want to see, eat and do. The rooms are nicely appointed and cleanliness and service are at the top of this Westin's priority list. I must mention a few staff members that went above and beyond to make our stay so wonderful. Diana at the executive lounge, Diane at the concierge desk, Keith, David, and really all of the front door staff were fantastic. However, Alan the bellman really stole the show, making us feel so welcome and taken care of. His passion for his job and for people really shines through. I commend Westin for employing such exceptional staff members and for their outstanding hotel. This was our first trip to Chicago, it will not be our last and we will never stay anywhere but here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property - Love that Sam in the Gym!”
Reviews.Author: JudySeid
Reviews.Content: Wanted to compliment the entire staff at the hotel and point out 2 in particular that I came into contact with. First of all there was a bellman, I think his name was James and I would like to say thanks for the great attitude and nice smile! As it is so important for me to workout during business travel, I have to say that they gym itself was quite small and I wasn't too excited about it until I met Sam. Sam was great from the minute I entered the gym and then luckily I found out that he is also a trainer, so I met him the following morning and did a training session with him. He worked up a routine just for me and followed up with and email to me with the workout all in 3 documents/spreadsheets. I would come back just to see Sam! He goes above and beyond and is a great asset to your hotel. Now just give him a bigger gym to work with! Sincerely Judy Seid

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel,great location.great conceirge”
Reviews.Author: MARKPerthAustralia
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in May while my husband attended a conference.The hotel is in a great location for shopping ,museums,sightseeing ,wonderful restaurants (give Keefers a try) and the conference center The beds are comfortable ,the rooms quiet and we had a great river view on the 16th floor.Loved the breakfast at the hotel,too But my stay will be memorable because of one person,Lisa ,the concierge.Never in all my stays at many many hotels have I come across such a charming helpful person.It was like having a new friend in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near Chicago river”
Reviews.Author: ssr77
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Chicago River North Hotel during Mother's day weekend with my wife and 1 year old boy. First, check-in. Tee at front desk was so curtious and helpful and met all my requests and went beyond. Being Starwood gold member, I requested an upgrade to club floor level room. I knew this was a long shot as I have seen many other Westin hotel properties only give upgrade to Deluxe rooms. But Tee gave me the upgrade to a club floor room that included access to executive club lounge on 20th floor and in-room WIFI. Thanks again for your help Tee! The access to the club ounge helped us so much with our little boy on meal times. Second, room. The room was spacious and clean with a good size bathroom. I've stayed a lot at the Westin Chicago in Michigan avenue becuase of the location (Gold Coast area). However, the rooms here at Westin River North are a lot more better compared to Michigan Ave. The room had a good view of Chicago river which made it nice. One thing that I did not like was that there was no "change to new sheets" card that you see in other Starwood hotel properties. While I understand that reusing the sheets is a "green policy" that Starwood hotels are doing right now. I still think it should be the guest's choice to participate or not. I am not sure if this is a hotel policy or if my room just did not have the card. Overall it was a pleasant stay and I would most definately be returning to the hotel for my next visit to Chicago. I would probably use this hotel during Summer/Fall time when the weather is nice and probably use the Westin at Michigan Ave during colder winter times when it is harder to walk around as it is right on magnificant mile shopping area.

Reviews.Title: “Light is dim...so don't fall into the lounge area”
Reviews.Author: TommyBoy94
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel in a great area of Toddlin' town. Good service, elegant and clean and overlooking the Chicago River in downtown. So now that I have praised this Westin, I'm allowed to quibble. The theme of the hotel is "calm...refresh...sooth...relax in health" etc. I think this theme is a little self-serving. For example, the good-looking woman on the TV tells you to take a deep breath...so I figure maybe they pipe in some Oxygen to the lobby and rooms...but no....she is just telling you that after extensive "research" they have decided that it is healthy if the hotel is non-smoking...like...duh...a non-smoking hotel these days...what a concept. Ok...so then to "soothe" you the lights are very dim in the lobby. Is that in keeping with the "soothe and calm and relax" theme or is it just to save electricity? Whatever, the shiny black tile floors are identical with the shiny tile black stairs leading down into the recessed lounge/bar area. So, bathed in this eerie, dim light, you need to be really careful descending into the lounge area, even long before you've had your first drink. Of course, there are plenty of staff greeters and concierges hanging in the lobby to be at your attention. Though perhaps they are there to just dust you off after you've plunged unceremoniasly into the bar area. The hotel is expensive and so is the braekfast buffet which costs $17 . There are a lot of fruity dishes at the buffet and healthy cereals (Again, I guess, in keeping with the "healthy, soothing theme"), but for that price the only eggs are scrambled and whether they are hot depends on how well the servers replenish those eggs. (one morning they did and one morning they didn't). Anyway, the sausages and bacon are great and the coffee is terrific. As I said, this area of the loop in Chicago is a great place to be with restaurants, bars and shops filled with really nice mid-western people. So, depsite my quibbles, you have fine service, elegance and location. It is hard to beat that!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, trendy hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: happy_riad_fan
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here before, nearly 10 years ago! It's still a nice, smart place, with a slick dark wood lobby and sushi bar downstairs (which we've never tried - maybe next time). Rooms are spacious and bathrooms all glossy black marble. The usual comfy Westin beds and double showers are featured in the rooms, although the TV doesn't have the ability to play HDMI input from a laptop and there's a charge for wifi, which is a shame as most other hotels of this calibre that we've seen recently (including other Westins) have free wifi. The location's great - there's a direct train to O'Hare which stops about 150 metres from the hotel ($2.25 per trip to the airport). It's 2 blocks from the Magnificent Mile for shopping, a few minutes from clusters of great Italian Chicago pizza restaurants and theatres and a 20 minute walk to the Hancock Tower. If you can get a good rate then it's definitely a recommended spot :-)

Reviews.Title: “A Class Act.”
Reviews.Author: Traveller1111
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were very happy with our four day stay. Centrally located hotel. Beautifully appointed. Extremely clean. Staff could not be more helpful, yet unobtrusive. Of special interest: Lisa Treacy, concierge is a member of the ClÃ©fs D'Or (Golden Keys), a highly prestigious world-wide professional association of concierges -- you can recognize them by the crossed keys on their lapels. She class act in itself and of excellent advice and help.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Friendly but poor quality food”
Reviews.Author: Tilings
Reviews.Content: Whenever I go to Chicago, I usually stay at this hotel, which I've found to be convenient, comfortable and welcoming. I've never eaten at the hotel except for my most recent trip, and I'm afraid it did not meet standards I've come to expect. By all means stay here, but eat elsewhere if you can.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel for business travel”
Reviews.Author: Gfreytag
Reviews.Content: A great hotel. Very responsive but unobtrusive staff. Business meeting rooms are comfortable and well appointed. I have been coming there every year for over a decade.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: jnb2375
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location; close to trains, shopping, dining, and sights. I was quite happy with the locale. While there are some small items in the guest rooms that could use a facelift (discolored spots on door mirror, chipped bathroom sink knob, running toilet), I was very happy given the price that I paid. I will note that the concierge always seems to be unavailable; she was either on the phone or away from the desk. The doormen more than made up for her absence. They gave great advice and service.

Reviews.Title: “No cpmplaints”
Reviews.Author: Dogfish60min
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference and was upgraded to a deluxe room with a river view. Very nicely appointed rooms that were clean. A few things showed their age a little in the room (closet door wouldn't quite shut right, etc.), but overall nothing that was truly an issue. Service was very friendly and it is only a short walk across the river to most anything. If the price is right, I'd definitely go here again.

Reviews.Title: “Sam from the Fitness Center delivers Premier Service and this hotel get my business because of his personal training assistance.”
Reviews.Author: MplsRoadie
Reviews.Content: I travel every week of the year (almost) and I am always Starwood. I have NEVER had the level of service and friendliness that Sam delivers. Just when you think service is lost in today's world people like Sam come along and give you hope. Starwood is lucky to have an Sam.

Reviews.Title: “Westin...What Happened??”
Reviews.Author: ceegee3
Reviews.Content: The Westin has long been one of my favorite hotels. I rarely travel without considering the Westin in my plans...so quite naturally when going to Chicago for St Patricks Day I thought what better hotel with a view of the river than the Westin River North...I was wrong. The morning of our arrival date I called to request a refrigerator and spoke with a kind hostess who assured me that we would have a "complimentary" refrigerator in our room upon arrival. But, that was about as kind as the weekend turned out. The problems began as soon as we entered the hotel. First, though we booked a room with a king bed. Upon arrival, we were told there were no more left for the night and we would have two queen beds, but we could be moved the following morning. This was not that big of a problem, but a little annoying. Then, our credit card kept declining, which wouldnt be a problem with the hotel except we could walk directly down the street and get money from the ATM machine to pay for the room. Then, the hotel said they would only be preauthorizing $200.00 for the stay, but turned out to be at least 4 separate preauth charges (2 for 200, 1 for 150, and 1 for around 75). Needless to say, when we finally got into our room, there was no refrigerator besides the wet bar of course...and i didnt feel like requesting since we were switching rooms the next day anyway. We booked a rate in which included access to the executive lounge and free breakfast. Initially, we did not have this access though the next morning and had to go back down 20 flights to get it. This would just be another accident except I basically "argued" with the host at the time behind the counter to look up the reservation deal because he did not believe we should have access. After finding out that we should, we received a simple "oh thats new....ive never seen that before". After breakfast, the Westin accommodated us into another room, which was better than the first room. But, then, we had a couple noisy neighbors that continued on throughout the night. When I think of vacation, I think of relaxation and ease. Ive already spent many hours working to make money, now I want to just sit back and enjoy it. If I'm going to spend more money in 2 days at the Westin of Chicago than a month's rent at home then the whole experience should be as smooth and possibly more convenient than a night at home. This was not the customer service I am used to expecting from the Westin, and there was just a lot of unfortunate events at this hotel. I wouldnt want to stay here ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view of the river!”
Reviews.Author: joe-tricia
Reviews.Content: Our stay was perfert for our St Patricks Day girls weekend. Walking distance to most everything we needed. Loved the view & location.

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate in comfort, luxury and convenience.”
Reviews.Author: joewmis
Reviews.Content: From being greeted upon arrival to the outstanding service of the housekeeping department, and one housekeeper in particular (Irene Mendoza), we were totally satisfied. Had business meetings on the 12th floor which were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Nessam
Reviews.Content: This was a very impressive hotel. As a SPG Gold member, I was afforded very luxurious accommodations and treated like a queen from the time that I arrived at the front entrance until I left the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Westin Location”
Reviews.Author: AlastairScott
Reviews.Content: Westin delivers in this hotel, located on N Dearborn St in the River North neighbourhood. A great location, close to many great restaurants but also only a 5-10 walk to the Loop or N Michigan Ave. Room felt fresh, clean and modern - very comfortable bed and noise was at a minimum which we always appreciate! Staff at check-in were very helpful, friendly & provided a list of recommended dining establishments. Although there was a planned power outage on the Sunday of our visit, this was clearly indicated to guests & we did not notice any issues, in fact the candles that were lit in the reception area made it all the more intimate! Would not hesitate to stay here again when in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: cscallahan40
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the Westin River North each week for the past two months. It is a great property right on the river in Downtown. I would highly recommend this hotel to any business or leisure traveler that is wanting to stay downtown. They have a great Club Level lounge and a great health club. Sam, who runs the health club, and the girls who run the Club Lounge are especially service oriented. They always make you feel at home!

Reviews.Title: “Very good - definitely worth staying here”
Reviews.Author: joandtina
Reviews.Content: Everything pretty much just right about this hotel. Friendly staff, clean rooms with good facilities, and all at a reasonable price. Location is good too, with views of the river.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Asaptraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at this perfectly located property. The staff here were very accomodating and professional. This hotel is in a great location to fantastic restaurants, the Michigan Mile, and other city landmarks with great views of the Chicago river. Also, it has great access to the train which was a plus for us coming in from O'Hare. Rooms were very clean and had a great bathroom. Chicago is a great city with lots to do. This Westin does NOT dissappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service was outstanding”
Reviews.Author: chitraveler1
Reviews.Content: Great hotel staff was awesome did a great job. Rooms were large and very comfortable would highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: CTKOHIO
Reviews.Content: I travel to Chicago frequently and after this stay I'm making the Westin River North my official hotel. The common areas and rooms are great, but the really great thing about this hotel is the staff. Everyone was outstanding - especially Sam in the workout facility. I'm definitely going back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Great Fitness Center”
Reviews.Author: RoadWarrior077
Reviews.Content: Being a road warrior who averages 40 weeks on the road every year, I've had my share of good hotels and not-so-good hotels. In Chicago, this is by far my favorite hotel. One of the things I miss during my road trips is regular visits to the Gym since most hotels don't have a lot to offer. However, the Gym at this Westin in on par or better than most Professional Gyms. Sam - the manager of the Gym (and a really nice fitness instructor) - put together a workout regimen for me and I've managed to stay on the program as I get plenty of encouragement from the Gym staff (particularly Sam). They have recently updated the Sauna (located next to the locker) which is a really nice place to relax after a good workout. Being a Platinum starwood member also gets you access to the Executive lounge where they serve free breakfast and evening snacks.The lobby also has a good Sushi restaurant and bar which several nice meal choices. The Rooms are well maintained and clean with fairly large marble bathrooms. The lobby and the staff are also really nice. During a recent blizzard, Scott (who works in the main lobby) went out in the bilzzard to locate a cab for me so I wouldn't have to brave the snowstorm. At another time during a particularly busy week, the hotel was overbooked and the Manager on my request still managed to arrange for a reservation. I have my choice of hotels in Chicago and I've stayed in a dozen different hotels during my visits to the Windy City, but going forward, I've booked all my future stays here and it will take a lot to make me change my decision.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: LAtotheWorld
Reviews.Content: My reservation was for a suite with 2 queen beds, at my arrival I was told that the suite with double queens had been booked for a wedding party so we were switched to a suite with a king. They offered to put in a rollaway in the room for no additional charge. Even though I had preferred the 2 queens, it wasn't a big deal that we got the other suite. The room was on the executive floor with access to the executive lounge where they served breakfast in the mornings for those with access to the executive lounge. The room also had free internet and even had an Apple computer for use at no extra cost. The bed was the Westin Heavenly Bed and very comfortable. I had great views of the river from my room. Both the bedroom and the living room had a flat screen TV and were very spacious. The bathroom was very spacious as well with a seperate shower and tub. The room was also very clean. Hotel staff was very friendly from the folks at the check-in counter to the concierge and the doormen. The hotel had a nice spacious lobby and a bar area. Overall my experience at this hotel was fantastic and I would definitely stay here again when I'm back in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ladybug1330
Reviews.Content: This hotel far exceeded my expectations. I have stayed at everything from the Red Roof Inn to five start in Mexico/Caribbean and this place was wonderful. The staff and service were second to none! Every accommodation was made and staff will bend over backwards to assist. The gym manager, Sam, was AWESOME (he opened early so I could fit my workout in before my morning conference) and gym was well-equipped with weights and aerobic equipment. Room were clean, well-kept lobby with a great sushi bar. Bathrooms were very nice and had all the amenities (and anything you forgot could be acquired at the front desk). The hotel had overbooked single king beds when I got there so they upgraded my room for free. Also, it was very close to a lot of good restaurants. Overall a VERY pleasant hotel experience that helped make a not-so-fun business trip more tolerable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service!”
Reviews.Author: NamingConvention
Reviews.Content: How wonderful to find such a customer friendly atmosphere in Chicago. Also good selection of tapa type dishes in lounge and great breakfasts on the menu. I'll be back again!

Reviews.Title: “A downtown hotel close to the train, Chicago highlights with the best hotel food”
Reviews.Author: YvonneDeF
Reviews.Content: The gym was clean and large for a hotel and they had a knowledgeable staff who gave free chairs massages as many times as you wanted. The hotel restaurant had healthy delicious menu choices with Starbucks coffee. Our room was a good size along with the bathroom. Take the train from the airport and walk a few blocks to save on a car rental.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Grows a tad Tired”
Reviews.Author: Scott-NYC-12
Reviews.Content: I must say the Westin has been home for me in Chicago for the last four years. And the pluses do outweigh the minuses. But let's do the math anyway. The staff is awesome. Cluldnt be a more available, friendly group of people from the front desk to the bell guys to the wonderful folks ithe preferred guest lounge. They have mde my stays special each and every time. What cai say about the dream beds--ia word--awesome. That bed has changed the way i sleep forever All that being said--while the rooms are still quite nice--they are growing a tad tired. The marble ithe bathrooms does not shine like it used to. The furnitur shows nicks more easily and the dark carpet is a tad outdated. It's time to cycle the note and make it just a tad more updated. The city has lots of hotel choices and i am loyal to this one. It is fine and friendly and comfortable. But a year or two Dow the road it will be less so. Yes i recommend it but i hope it will make the necessary upgrades every hotel has to to stay competitive.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Break”
Reviews.Author: Cabool1
Reviews.Content: We needed a brake from the hustle of the Christmas Holiday, booked a night at the Westin River North and could not have asked for more. The location is ideal for everything, the room was clean and the with the Heavely Bed, who could say more.

Reviews.Title: “Great service up to the Westin name”
Reviews.Author: nbtravel
Reviews.Content: After quite a few bad hotel stays I was happy to have a good spg stay at the westin river north. The staff was great and the manager responded very well after I made a small comment about the bed. Very pleased to be happy with Westin again.

Reviews.Title: “The Westin River North is always a nice and pleasant stay.”
Reviews.Author: PRogers33
Reviews.Content: Although your hotel always has been friendly and wonderful to me over the years, I do think Sam is a gem. He consistently greets me with professionalism and incredible friendliness everytime I walk into the fitness center. As a Starwoods platinum member, I stay at many Westin's and W's throughout the country. Sam is the best I've seen, period! I would strongly suggest understanding what makes him so good and model the rest of your organization around him.

Reviews.Title: “Celebrity Status, Wow!”
Reviews.Author: Bellazaza
Reviews.Content: It was my 30th B-day and we just celebrated in Chicago.Three girls and I stayed in a Luxury Suite at Westin River North, it was amazing. The room was absolutely first class and we should've checked in earlier. The suite was large, had very comfortable beds, 2 Flat Screens, a computer station, great view and pretty much everything that you could ask for and more. I would definitely reccomend this room if your planning a nice trip to Chicago. The location of the hotel was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Loved loved the Westin!”
Reviews.Author: sammyisabigbrat
Reviews.Content: First off.. Not sure why there are any negatives reviews here.. This hotel is updated, very nice lobby and the service was exceptional!! The location was wonderful. The view from our room was breath taking! Bathroom was very spacious!! Marble was very high end.. Had a wonderful stay and cant say enough good things about this hotel and our stay! Thanks to all of the hotel employees that made our stay fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Westin River North was a pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: birdeeking
Reviews.Content: I think this is one of those things wherein you come in with lower expectations and your pleasantly surprised. To start with, I travel to Chicago alot and take advantage of hot wire and its rating system. I know it well enough to and seem to stay at the Intercontinental alot, wihich I love because of its location on Mich Ave... If I cant stay there, I love the Hyatt on whacker for its price and nice rooms.... I honestly thougth I was staying at the Hyatt when I used hot wire for this recent trip... to my surprise it was the Westin on river north. I had never stayed there so I immediately read the reviews .. The negative reviews had me thinking that this hotel was old and in need of alot of updating... That was far from the truth.. Hotel lobby is really big and impressive. The staff was nice upon arrival and checked me in early.... The room was great..... a nice view of the river, heavenly bed that was awesome.; the lcd tv was nice but some chanels were snowy. The bathroom was very good......not small and updated with nice marble.. Im not sure if I got an updated room, but it was really nice... so if the other rooms are similar, I think you would agree its a 4 star chicago hotel.... The location is also perfect.... short walk to mag mile and my favorite water hole, O callahans... so enjoy...

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: Daybright
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated just on the north side of the river, and it is closely located to all of our business meetings, and at the same time, the location was perfect walking distance to tourist shopping areas (not too close, and not too far), as well as various restaurants, and even Trader Joe's. The hotel's breakfast buffet is tasty and a great deal. The clientele is mostly business professionals. The beds are very comfortable. This is the hotel for us from now on, whenever we visit Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Traveler Hotel”
Reviews.Author: joawhite48
Reviews.Content: I am a big Starwood and Westin fan and this hotel continues the tradition. Westins almost always have clean, comfortable rooms and this one is no exception. As I am a preferred Starwood member I get free access to the concierge lounge and gym - both of which are my favorite in Chicago. Sam, who runs the Westin workout in the morning is friendly, helpful, and a great source of knowledge. The concierge lounge is staffed with friendly people, with an excellent breakfast and good source of hors d'ovors in the evening. All in all a great hotel for those of us Road Warriors, with a great location near the loop and Michigan Ave.

Reviews.Title: “loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: leoon43
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Westin River North for 4 nights. We enjoyed our stay and thought the hotel was excellent...the room was clean and spacious, hotel lobby excellent and all staff welcoming. Our only gripe was that we thought the buffet breakfast was only average ..not enough variety, fresh vegetables, cheeses etc that we expect in such a hotel. In a great position , close to Macys and museums

Reviews.Title: “Pleasurable”
Reviews.Author: jriley36
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to acknowledge Sam in the healthclub at the Westin River North. I travel frequently workout first thing in the mornings. I was there and was able to see first hand Sam's efforts upon signing in. Sam should serve as a model to all new hires on his engaging, up beat spirit and attention to detail. It was really refreshing...

Reviews.Title: “Noisy & dismal”
Reviews.Author: Mjb2354
Reviews.Content: We had a club room on a high floor. The window was small & the consequently the room was dark & dismal. As with most hotels there was too much external noise & it sounded like there was a generator continually running outside our window. Why are hotels not fitted with secondary glazing which would nullify much of this nuisance. Do hotel architects & designers not stay in their hotels or are they all deaf? If any of them would care to explain my e-mail is Mjb2354@btinternet.com. Housekeeping was also strange at the Westin. On the first night we used a wine glass and instead of this being replaced it was left outside our room. It was still there the following day, when I mentioned this to front desk when we checked out they did not seem unduly concerned.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: likesabitofluxury
Reviews.Content: The room might be a 4 star room, but the bathroom is definitely only 3 stars. I can see pipe sticking out of the wall in the tub and the water control looks like it's about to fall apart. I'm disappointed--I was looking for a more obviously 4-star experience.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Workout - the hidden gem at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: amolbargaje
Reviews.Content: I can't stop raving over the fact that the Westin Workout at his hotel is entirely free, including the services of Sam (personal trainer) who is phenomenal and so passionate about what he does. There is even a free chair massage that you can avail of. The fitness center was never crowded and has enough equipment so that you won't have to wait for long even if there were a lot of people. I had the pleasure of working with Sam, who was very patient understanding my needs and making a comprehensive plan to train me over the next 3 days. This is one of the few Westin hotels where the fitness center and its additional services are absolutely free. I think this is a great move and shows that they truly care about the customer's health and overall well-being.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel with pristine rooms and spa like bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: leahbates1212
Reviews.Content: We loved staying in this hotel! The reception and sitting area is awesome, with a gorgeous view of the water. Our room was beautiful and the bathroom was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional staff -- everyone was attentive, personable and accommodating.”
Reviews.Author: WestinInWindyCity
Reviews.Content: The highlight of my trip was meeting Sam, Westin's personal trainer who oversees the workout facilities. Sam is, without a doubt, the most personable, positive, genuinely caring, gregarious and motivating coach/staff member. Within a matter of days, he inspired me to get back into shape and adopt a very doable workout program. Other staff members encountered were equally helpful and friendly. The location was quite convenient to the theatre as well as to the main shopping district. $10 taxi ride to the convention center. I look forward to returning once I have a window to enjoy the city vs. being primarily focused on business.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay...love the Gym...Sam is an awesome gym manager”
Reviews.Author: bobtev
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - location is awsome, gym and training are awesome

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: ehrenfelder
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in OK shape, a bit aged and the shower was cold one morning, which was not pleasant at all. Working with Sam in der Gym however was excellent and a truly rewarding experience. This service is totally amazing and banchmark to all hotels I have been to so far. Location is good in the middle of downtown surrounded by the city's best staekhouses and right next to all the shopping places

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: lowmaintenance89
Reviews.Content: Wow, if you've stayed at a nice Westin before, don't expect the same things at this one. I must say reading the other reviews I had to double check that they were the same place I just stayed. There weren't many 'heavenly' things at this place. This is the first time I've even felt compelled to write a review on this website because things were so bad. First off, the bathroom was disgusting. They make everything black to hide the filth and it works fairly well but don't look at the tile grout while you're showering or you're likely to become ill. Second, the room was very dark. Even with the drapes open, they still cover about 1/4 of the window. Kinda ruined the view of the Sears Tower. Third, I was booked on the "preferred guest" floor which supposedly had free water. Yeah, the reason it's free is because after you drink the water bottle, they NEVER return to re-stock. I was there for three nights. Fourth, Isn't a hotel supposed to replace the shampoo and conditioner after you use them. The second day, I thought it was strange that they hadn't left me new bottles (since I had used half of the current ones). I didn't think anything of it until the last morning when I jumped in the shower before work, only to find that there were no shampoo or conditioner bottles at all. Fifth, the shower was almost impossible to use. The water dribbled out of the showerhead. I'm sure that I could have gotten a better shower at a Super 8. In the interest of fairness, the bed was comfortable and they provided a power strip next to the bed so you don't have to break your neck trying find a plug for your charger. The power strip didn't look great but served its purpose. I was there for a work conference and not to add insult to injury with this place, the food was horrible. The breakfast buffet (eggs, bacon, potatoes, etc.) was almost inedible. I don't even know how to describe the taste of the eggs. If you go, don't expect a heavenly experience at this place.

Reviews.Title: “Restaurant meals are fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Buckorino
Reviews.Content: I arrived from O'Hare Airport and walked into the restaurant for lunch. Service was fast, but the salmon salad was incredible. I eat fish and veggies exclusively. I live in Baltimore, MD, area where you can get the best seafood anywhere. The salmon filet was absolutely the most delicious I've ever tasted. Chef Gilda Owen's preparation was amazing. I hope I get to sample other dishes she prepares. Worth the price of admission.

Reviews.Title: “Great Fitness Center and Service”
Reviews.Author: Nico66Albi
Reviews.Content: I stay at the hotel every week. Sam Guiragossian, the fitness center coach has developed a few workout routines for me. They are great for a business traveler who wants to stay in shape. Sam has also spend 1-1 time with me showing me the routines and motivating to continue with the program. Great Service and attention to detailed

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: mls_oh
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Chicago ridiculously early for reasons that aren't relevant to this review, and yet they still let us check in VERY early on a Saturday. The most I had expected was to have my luggage held. Just for that convenience we were very happy! Bellmen, doorman, valets were great! Check-in staff mostly disinterested but not at all rude. And while I've read lots of great comments about the concierge staff, I didn't have the best experience w/them. It could have been the fact that we were a family in jeans and casual attire compared to all the business travelers in expensive suits... I don't know. They seemed annoyed by our questions and if there is anyone in a hotel that shouldn't seem annoyed by questions, it's the concierge, imo. (not that they shouldn't *feel* it, just that they shouldn't *show* it til they are home having drinks with friends) Room was great. Even though we booked through Hotwire and our River View room was the lowest floor possible with a limited view we really enjoyed it and loved the room. Beds were great, bathroom was nice, room was clean. Location was great - there were lots of things to see within walking distance. Valet parking was uber-expensive and internet wasn't free, but I don't even really feel like that's a problem because I kind of expected to pay for the location, convenience and experience. I am just throwing that out there for others who might care more about that sort of thing. I mostly enjoyed my experience at the Westin and really liked the location, but I don't know that I'd recommend it to other travelers in my group - middle class families traveling with teenagers for leisure. This REALLY seemed to be more suited to business travelers and if you are a business traveler I would highly recommend it. Great hotel - I'm just not the demographic they are going for, I don't believe.

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful hotel at a walking distance to the sights and magic mile”
Reviews.Author: kauniit
Reviews.Content: After the long flight from Europe, the first night in the USA ( this time, been many times), and so important a good nightÂ´s sleep. The right adress, the Westin, peace and quiet, good beds, nice bath and in the morning a nice view to the River. The breakfast very good, took the continental with lots of fresh fruit and very good coffee (good service). The staff was friendly, the bell man, the check in and the bar personnel (had a small meal at the bar after arriving). An extra mentioning worth is the concierge, on both days (different ladies) very professional, helpfull an nice to talk to. The information was very good, the concierge was really very good indeed. Would love to come back, to the "windy city" (we had wonderful sunny days at the beginning of September), loved it, and to stay at the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Best Chicago Hotel for a Fitness Minded Traveller”
Reviews.Author: RoadWarrior077
Reviews.Content: In terms of fitness equipment and especially the people who work at the fitness center, make no mistake - this property is second to none. The Gym instructors are always there to help achieve your fitness goals and the Gym features showers, a sauna and plenty of cardio and strength equipment to power your workout. I would highly recommend this property for a fitness minded traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: batgirl113
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, and Sam in the fitness area was amazing. First Class service. 5 stars!

Reviews.Title: “Best staff around!”
Reviews.Author: dinakaye
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel are amazing. I stay here every time I'm in Chicago because of the staff. They always remember my name and seem truly happy to see me. I've been seeing the same people there (bellmen, room service staff, fitness center staff, bartenders) for over 10 years, which is also a big plus. They make my trip great every time. The hotel also has a great fitness center, staffed by very friendly and knowledgeable people. It's far better than fitness centers at most hotels. On top of that, the hotel is in an awesome local in the River North area and also very close to the Loop.

Reviews.Title: “They exceeded our expectations on every level!”
Reviews.Author: DDGross
Reviews.Content: We got great service from this hotel before we even got there. Prior to our arrival I had a few conversations over the phone with the concierge. She recommended several great places to eat and she was right about all of them. When we checked in we were treated to a drink in the 10 minutes that we waited for our room to become available. The front desk staff, along with all other staff, were super friendly. We were visiting Chicago from Orange County, CA to celebrate my husband's 40th birthday. The manager even sent up a special birthday a dessert. This hotel didn't miss an opportunity to make our trip fantastic. In addition to the service, the location of the hotel is superb. We woke up every morning to a view of the Chicago River. We were within walking distance to almost everywhere we wanted to go. We will definitely be back to the Westin Chicago River North!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, comfortable hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: ClareBerr
Reviews.Content: Check-in was slow but all good after that, or if it wasn't staff made corrections promptly. Was in town for a meetings Wed thru Friday.. stayed Sat/Sun and part of Monday to enjoy the city - first time visiting. Of course the architecture is phenomenal, historic and energizing. Had a great time! Some aspects of this hotel are exceptional: Sam, who runs the fitness center, is simply a terrific personal trainer! His services were complimentary with my weekly access fee. He made very targeted suggestions, helped me understand the what as well as the why of what he suggested, and has offered to stay in touch to be sure I reach my goals. Pretty special! We also found the concierge staff, especially Lisa, top notch. Lisa's tips were, like Sam's, targeted and most helpful after listening carefully to my goals for my time in Chicago. The 90-minute boat tour by the Architecture Foundation was amazing, and the Chicago Trolley Co., with the red double-decker buses, made it very easy to get on and off. We enjoyed the commentary of most of the 3 guides we had as we toured the city. Food was excellent - as well as creatively prepared and just plain pretty! I enjoyed the room - very nicely furnished, with a nice view of the Chicago River, a busy place. I'd stay hear again, gladly!

Reviews.Title: “True to the Westin brand”
Reviews.Author: canunion
Reviews.Content: Like all Westins, this hotel was in a very convenient location and the rooms/amenities were great. The people and staff were extremely friendly - I chatted with multiple staff members in the club lounge and they were always looking to make sure I was comfortable. My favorite was Sam, the manager at the gym - he knew every guest's name and always greeted you with an enthusiastic smile and made sure you had what you needed. Great way to start the day.

Reviews.Title: “Inspired by Sam Guiragossi! Hotel Spa Review”
Reviews.Author: Rickibobby
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity during my recent stay at the Westin Chicago to meet Sam Guiragossi. I travel on a regular basis with my job and I always try to book at hotels that have a health facility. I would have to say without question, the personal attention Sam provided me during my morning workouts exceeded all expectations and easily was the best experience I have every had working out at a hotel health and fitness facility. Not only did Sam take the time offer his assistance helping me navigate the facility, he also spent time with me personalizing my workout and provided me some great pointers regarding how I could improve my workouts. Sam demonstrated those characteristics indicative of great staff members but also of great individuals. It was a pleasure meeting Sam and I hope to see him during my next stay at your hotel. Thanks! --Robert

Reviews.Title: “The Gym at the Westin Chicago River North is superb.”
Reviews.Author: NGradia
Reviews.Content: I have many great things to say about the hotel. The location is fantastic. The staff is very very helpful. I needed a cot for one night and, when I asked for it to be removed, it was removed immediately the next day. The restaurant is okay - it might be nice to have another restaurant like the Palm or one of those chains at the hotel. Just a thought.... My very favorite thing about the hotel is the gentleman who manages the Westin Workout facility, Sam Guiragossi. He is, simply put, "the best!" I stayed there last year and he sent me home with a work out routine. Although I have been excercising for insulin-dep. diabetes for nearly 30 years each day, I knew that I needed more weight and strength training. I was under pressure to finish a thesis last year and used his recommendations from last year's routine throughout the year some. This year, however, with my thesis behind me, I was happy to meet with him again. And, once again, he listened to what I needed to change in order to become more toned and fit. He measured my body fat and bmi (which incidentally was fine on today's chart, but I'd rather they be fine on yesterday's chart) and helped me to begin a program that would affect areas that need to be tightened as well as work with the pain that I have because I have not been stretching nor drinking enough water for ,really, years. Now that I am home, I have been doing his work out routines far more regularly than last year and hope to see improvements. By far, the gym is SO MUCH BETTER because of Sam and his energy and spirit in helping others who want to help themselves. He is cordial to everyone who walks through the door and takes his work seriously. I can't wait to come back and have an appointment with Sam!!! I wish the hotel and the rooms were not so dark. I think the rooms could be more pleasingly appointed. I think brighter walls might help, but the bedding is luxurious and very comfortable. We stayed on the Club Level.

Reviews.Title: “what great helpful service in a spectacular setting”
Reviews.Author: girlzpower
Reviews.Content: georgeous setting in chicago! too much to offer and list..utilize concierge to focus on activities.food abounds in the near neighborhoods in all price ranges. safe for walking at all hours. rooms lovely

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic atmosphere, clean rooms, beautiful location on the river.”
Reviews.Author: renee018
Reviews.Content: We appreciated such a beautiful clean room. This hotel is in a beautiful location with a trendy atmosphere about it. Located in a somewhat quiet location right on the chicago river. We were able to walk 3-4 blocks to Merchandise Mart on Lasalle and also to Fogo de Chau's Brazilian steakhouse. Loved the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Ambience”
Reviews.Author: prakdora
Reviews.Content: I have there in August, 2010.Our travel agent booked in Sofitel water tower but this hotel in turn accomodated in westin river north. Very good hotel right by the side of thecanal. Clean and relaxed atmosphere. Highly irritating was that they keep you on waiting for ages for check in. In stead of an requested early check in they do a very very late check in and we had to wait for almost five hours for check in!!! Could you believe it?

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: travelchiks
Reviews.Content: Overall a very nice hotel. We really enjoyed the location and will plan on staying here again. If you plan on seeing a broadway show while you're in town this location is ideal. It's a quick/easy walk to the theater district. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Looking forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “sam at fitness club is bonus reason to stay here”
Reviews.Author: Canadian-hotel-guru
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and if you like to workout go to the fitness club and see Sam. He is very knowledgeable and will give you private attention and advice at no charge (you will want to tip him as he is great). From an Insanity workout guy !!!

Reviews.Title: “The Westin provides excellent service and would highly recommend staying here while vacationing.”
Reviews.Author: LadyTraveler2010_10
Reviews.Content: I have been traveling to Chicago for at least 16 years (several times a year) and enjoy staying at The Westin Chicago River North. Accomodations are wonderful - love the heavenly beds. The staff are exceptional! Always friendly and knowledgeable two staff that stand out as star employees are the concierge Lisa and bellman Allen. Lisa provides excellent insight as to activities and restaurants and Allen is always welcoming with a smile and kind word. My favorite place to stay in all of Chicago. Highly recommend - it feels like home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “The Westin supplies a real home away from home for the long-stay business traveller.”
Reviews.Author: GrahameNanson
Reviews.Content: A particulat standout from any time at the Westin is the friendliness of the Staff, and in particular Sam Guiragossian. Sam provided me with free personal training sessions, which, given the longevity of my stay was greatly appreciated. He was encouraging and helped devise me a personal fitness regime I have continued.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: brianandmaria
Reviews.Content: The Westin was very clean and everyone was very helpful. The Concierge were all very professional and ready to help. We exercised everyday and the gym at the Westin is very clean and professional. Sam Guiragossian, the manager of the Westin Workout and a trainer was very helpful answering questions and even designing a workout for me. I was very happy with the stay and will definitely stay here anytime I am in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sandyj83
Reviews.Content: We initially thought we booked for the Westin on Michigan Ave (I'm still trying to figure out how I got that one wrong), but ended up the W.R.N. and I'm sure glad we did. The location is perfect. You really don't have to be right on Michgan Ave to be near all the action. If anything, the location of the WRN, which is right across from Hotel Sax and House of Blues is even better and with walking distance from everything. The rooms were very spacious. We were 4 girls who stayed comfortably in 1 room w/ a king size bed. We asked for a rollaway and the room has a chaise lounge which was used a bed. Even with all that in the room, you could comfortably walk around and w/out feeling cramped. The bathroom is large and nice, the bed was comfortable. The lobby was nice, with in room starbucks and a starbucks stand in the lobby. My only complaint and I had to really think of one, was that I needed to print something off the internet and I had to pay $5 to log onto guest computers, which included printers, they had in the lobby for people to use. They could've just printed the item out for me, instead of me having to cough up $5 bucks for 1 sheet of paper and 2 minutes of internet usage. Oh, and there is a parking structure right on Kenzie Street (next to the CVS) that charges super cheap for parking. All in all, this is a great hotel and will def. stay here again on my next trip to wonderful Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel to stay at during business travel”
Reviews.Author: ditucci
Reviews.Content: The Westin River North is my favorite hotel to stay at when I travel to Chicago on business. The gym & trainer are excellent. The location is perfect as I can walk to work, go to great restaurants and bars, or hit Michigan ave for shopping. The rooms are clean and quiet (a must) and I've never had anything but exceptional customer service from the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: walls2009
Reviews.Content: Optimal location makes trips to meetings and lunches/dinners/drinks extremely easy. Most of my clients are pretty centrally located in this area...Also close to convenient shopping on the Magnificent Mile. Hotel offers what you'd expect out of an urban Westin, including a sleek lobby bar/lounge. Even on 14th or 15th floor still got a little bit of street noise but didn't mind. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: franklin75
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean, employees were courteous, but the best part was the location. Great for a long or short stay. My only complaint is that the wifi is extremely slow so don't even bother paying for it if you really don't need it and I wish they had a pool.

Reviews.Title: “Our 1st visit to Chicago - so glad we chose the Westin River North!”
Reviews.Author: soxfan63
Reviews.Content: Loved our 3 night stay at the Westin River North. Travelled with my teenage son for a baseball weekend. Outstanding staff. Large rooms and bathrooms - so much bigger than NYC hotel rooms. Incredibly comfy beds! Cleanliness, comfort and location (as well as value) are very important to us. The Westin exceeded all our exoectations in these categories. We took a cab to/from O'Hare ($35 plus tax) and then depended on trains (an easy 4 block walk) as well as walking and cabs for our stay. Great location on the river. Honestly, we could not have been happier with the location or the hotel. Concierge staff helped with directions, booking river cruise, restaurant suggestions. Would stay here again and highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but nothing great”
Reviews.Author: kph7295
Reviews.Content: The location was very good and in walking distance to most things in the city including areas surrounding the Chicago River as well as the Magnificent Mile. The service was also great , as all the staff was very helpful and nice. The rooms were also fairly nice especially because of the famous heavenly beds. However, the lack of amenities offered in this hotel was extremely disappointing. Wifi was offered for free in the lobby but there was a charge of $9.99 a day to have Wifi in the room. In addition, not only was there no pool within the vicinity, but it also cost money in order to use the health center. Even though the overall stay was fairly good, there are several other hotels where you can do better.

Reviews.Title: “great visit”
Reviews.Author: codytucker
Reviews.Content: i bought this stay on priceline and at first was disappointed that we were several blocks from Michigan Ave. STill on arrival the checkin was smooth and they had upgraded our rooms and put our two room beside each other. overall it was a great stay the beds were so comfortable and the view was also very nice. Our only complaint was the high price to store our car, which we never used the whole weekend. They have you there since the lots nearby were similar in price. Location was fine were walked everywhere

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: MikeSpivey
Reviews.Content: This hotel is easy to get to relative to others in Chicago, is often quiet and relaxing, and has superior staff. Sam in the health club is great, if you are working out I would highly recommend talking with him.

Reviews.Title: “Oh, what it used to be!”
Reviews.Author: barbadiantraveler
Reviews.Content: If Westin standards are still in force, someone at Corporate needs to visit River North. Time has worn away at the facility that once was so stellar. All I'm looking for is that expected Heavenly Bed and faucets that don't leak. Instead, the bedding is mismatched, bathrooms need work, lighting is dim and depressing. Staff turns out en force when you let them know there's a problem, but who wants room maintenance during a weekend stay? Also, no rooftop pool or spa here. However, if you can deal with the above, ask for a Chicago River View room, and you get the best view of Chicago architecture that money could buy. It's a several block hike from here to the Lake, but you're very much in the center of the entertainment areas of Chicago - the Loop and Michigan Ave and all of River North. Try to book it as a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: PJMumie
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Westin Chicago River North and the staff is very seasoned and professional. The location can't be beat! Carrie in the business center is absolutely wonderful. I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Gym”
Reviews.Author: Nicoalbi
Reviews.Content: When I travel for business, I always stay in hotels with good quality gyms. The Westin at River North not only has great facility, but their staff are very attentive and helpful. They built a workout program for me that was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Friedly Staff”
Reviews.Author: travel34567
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently for work and the staff at this hotel is far and away the best. From the front desk to Sam the personal trainer on staff in the hotel gym, the staff of this hotel keeps my business coming back as a frequent guest. For anyone looking for a friendly environment in a great city this is the hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “What a Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: luckystrike
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for four nights in July 2010, having booked through Trailfinders in the UK as we found this to be the best deal. The Westin is so well located in Chicago â€“ right between the two main centres of The Loop and River North. Everything that we wanted to see was within walking distance and we didnâ€™t use any transport apart from taxis to and from Oâ€™Hare Airport. Our room was a decent size and the bed was really comfortable, with high class linen. The bathroom, like the bedroom, was modern and spotlessly clean. There was complementary tea and coffee and a flat screen TV. Check-in was quick and easy, and the staff members were helpful by giving us advice about where to eat and drink in the vicinity. Equally so, the concierge was friendly and informative, particularly about the 4th of July celebrations that coincided with our stay. There are three or four private internet terminals in the lobby but this is a paid service apart from checking in for flights and printing boarding passes, which is complimentary. We didnâ€™t eat in the hotel as we were out so much, so unfortunately I canâ€™t comment on the bars or restaurants apart from to say that they looked extremely good. Nearby thereâ€™s a great spot for breakfast at the junction of Dearborn Street and Kinzie Street called Einstein Brothers Bagels, and directly opposite this is Harry Careyâ€™s Steakhouse where we ate perfect steaks and loved the huge wine list. Both are only two minutes walk from the front door of the hotel. If youâ€™re looking for a fun night out I thoroughly recommend Rockit on Hubbard Street between Dearborn Street and State Street. Itâ€™s only three minutes walk from the hotel and is without question one of the liveliest and fun bars in the city, with a superb team of staff. We both loved Chicago and its people. In particular we really enjoyed a river and Lake Michigan boat tour to see the fantastic downtown architecture and spectacular skyline; going to the viewing deck of the Sears (Willis) Tower; and sampling delicious foods at â€˜Taste of Chicagoâ€™. We also loved taking â€˜artyâ€™ photographs of the Bean at Millennium Park; spending a relaxing 4th July at Navy Pier; and shopping on Michigan Avenue. I highly recommend The Westin River North, and would definitely stay here again should we be fortunate enough to have the chance to return to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Very Special Hotel”
Reviews.Author: steve20
Reviews.Content: Once again this hotel exceeded my expectations. We were due in for 1 night using points as I had a very early appointment the following morning. When I realized they were filming Transformers very near to the hotel and there were going to be multiple road closures on the day of our arrival it became clear we needed to try to get in for 2 nights. I was told the city was "suppressed" because of everything that was going on and the Hotel was closed to new reservations. I worked very closely with the front desk staff for about 16 hours to try to secure a room with points. Due to the exemplary service this chain provides we were able to get in early. Thank you to Jonathon, Justin and to Greg for "opening the house" and then closing it to secure a room for us. Then to our delight they sent a gift and a note to the room that night welcoming us. My absolute favorite Hotel in Chicago for good reason! Have been staying here for 10 years plus......they just keep outdoing themselves!!

Reviews.Title: “not impressed”
Reviews.Author: lexy506
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many starwoods hotels and resorts all over the world, and must say that this was one of my most disappointing.. To be fair, i must include that the hotel was supposidly at capacity.. The good: The heavenly beds are really heavenly the bad: Poor service, room was a bit dirty, housekeeping arrived to clean the room at 8:30 am and woke us up!!!, service was not good: the so called "manager" was very rude, when i asked to extend my stay, explaining my circumstances that i came from rome italy to spend a wknd in chicago with my sister, she was not at all accomodating, and didnt even check my room number or look into the computer or take my name to see if she could help us. When we asked to be on a waiting list they said we should just keep calling every 1/2 hour to see if there were cancellations-- however when you call the front desk they put you on hold for hours... Service definitly was not up to par with other Westin and starwood hotels. Also, regarding parking: their valet is 52 dollars, but they also have a self park lot directly across the street for 34-- when i called they didnt advise me of this option and we ended up parking a bit farther down, it would have been nice to have been informed about the self park option..

Reviews.Title: “Westin is my kinda hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sandiPoconos
Reviews.Content: A great location on the river. Close to subway and within walking distance to great restaurants and shopping! Great service. We stayed on the 17th floor in a roomy and comfortable room with free coffee breakfast, midday snacks, complimentary health club, a computer in the room with free wifi, and even a 10 min massage after my workout! The staff was friendly and helpful. They gave us a late checkout to accommodate our later flight home. This place would be perfect if it had a pool on the roof for those hot summer after shopping days!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, fantastic service.”
Reviews.Author: familyfuninmd
Reviews.Content: We were traveling to the midwest and planned a side trip to Chicago. The hotel was conveniently located, the service was excellent and the room very comfortable for this family of 4. The bellman and the concierge went out of their way to recommend restaurants and places of interest for our kids. We were even surprised by a complimentary dessert at a nearby restaurant, thanks to our concierge Lisa Ann. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence in Personal Trainer Experience”
Reviews.Author: traveler60795
Reviews.Content: One of the pleasant surprises of my trip was the time I spent in the physical fitness center. The trainer, Sam was so pleasant and helpful. I had two great workouts and was encouraged through the process. Sam provided extra information on workouts too. I was so impressed and am already changing behavior and habits around exercise. What can I say, this stay might be a Life Changing Experience!

Reviews.Title: “Confort and elegance”
Reviews.Author: aujrsu
Reviews.Content: sam guiragossian , is a wonderful asset to your hotel. He is personable and greeted everyone who came into the fitness center. He made sure that my sister and I (and everyone else who walked in) knew what was available and asked if we had any questions and how he could make our workout more efficient. Sam really listened and took the time to put together a workout that I will be able to implement on a daily basis as well as when I travel for business. He offered a massage and it really loosened up my back so I could walk better. Sam's motto on his name tag is very fitting. You can tell that all people are his passion and he has a genuine interest in sharing the gifts he has. What a gift you have in Sam. Westin should be proud to have someone so skilled in teh employment.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for Neocon but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: SusieJue
Reviews.Content: Head to Chicago every June for the Neocon trade show at the Merchandise Mart and I usually stay at the Sheraton, but they were booked. Since I am loyal to Starwood brand, I chose the Westin River North. The Mart is only 2 blocks away so the location is fantastic! As a Starwood Platinum member, I emailed the general manager, Peter Simoncelli, in advance, to inquire about an upgraded room and of course, they always say "upon check-in" you will receive the best room available and he also, offered a room on the Executive Club Level for additional $40, which I decline. I shared a cab from Midway Airport for flat $16. + tip and checked in. I was given a Executive Deluxe room on 16th floor with river view and it was small. I know the hotel was probably booked for Neocon, but it's very rare, as a lifetime Platinum member, that I don't get a suite and I checked on the web prior to my departure and suites were available. Oh well, the room was tiny, but a bit larger than the standard room and the view was amazing! Heavenly bed, desk, chaise lounge, flat 32" panel TV, Starbucks coffee, Tazo tea and maker, mini bar, marble bathroom with combo shower/tub. Closet with in room safe and I had to request a robe and a mini refrigerator...I have to say the service is very speedy and efficient. I did not hear any noise when I was in my room and able to sleep very well. Platinum members have access to the Westin Executive Club on the 20th floor which is open from 6 am to 10 pm and serves a nice continental breakfast 6-10 am weekdays and 7-11 am weekends. You'll find oatmeal, cereal, fruit, toast, coffee, tea, orange juice, small pastries, boiled eggs. Access is for 2 people and additional guests are $15. plus tax and gratuity. The Executive Club Happy Hour hors d'oeuvres are 5 - 7 pm and offered a good selection of nibbles. Beverage service is sodas, water, pretzels, trail mix, etc. The staff in the Executive Club were very friendly and welcoming. There is an Apple iMac computer in the lounge, which was really great and I hear that they are in all the Club Floor rooms. There are three computers on the lobby level for a fee. Westin WORKOUT on mezzanine is complimentary to Executive Club floor guests and in-room wireless internet. There is no pool, but you can use the one at the Sheraton, just show your room key. I did not eat at any of the hotel restaurants, Ember Grill, Hana Lounge or Kamehachi Sushi. Chicago is a foodie's heaven, but the Atwood Cafe that the concierge helped us get a reservation at, was terrible! Cabs are very easy to get and a short ride will run $8. with tip. The Westin is very close to the Mart and is in an excellent location for my needs, but I like the Sheraton better, as the rooms are bigger. You have to check out the new Barneys NY and Hermes store on Oak St. Things have changed since I was there last... I love Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Westin Wins Again!”
Reviews.Author: Tripfantastic
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a meeting at a hotel in the same vicinity as Westin Chicago River North and made sure that I secured a reservation at my favorite Westin brand. I guess I do have a case of brand loyalty as Westin never lets me down. This hotel was no exception. From the moment they gave me my wonderful, quiet room (as I had requested), to each night of blissful quiet sleep, I again affirmed my belief that Westin is the best. Unfortunately, didn't have time to check out the workout area as others suggested but did use the hotel to explore the Magnificent Mile and the Loop when I was able. There are many excellent restaurants nearby (Havana, Brasserie Jo, Bin 36), so the hungry traveler can't go wrong. Thanks, Westin, for being there!

Reviews.Title: “We will defintely be coming back to the Westin!”
Reviews.Author: biggAlamo
Reviews.Content: My husband comes every year to the Neocon Convention, so the location is great. he also has an early morning breakfast meeting with 25-30 people at your hotel(Woodtech). Your service was very accomendating. I visited your workout room twice and Sam was the best.
