He not only helped me with my work out but encouraged, inspired and created a personal training workout just for me to take home. His passion to be heathy is contigous. I have bought my equipment and started my program.Thank You! We look forward to next year or earlier for a vacation get away.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay here while in town for business -- Close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: MShanNYC
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from Saturday, June 12 - Wednesday, June 16th. I was in town for the NeoCon tradefair at the Merchandise Mart, which about 3-4 blocks away from the hotel. Check-in was easy, no problems there. Although the lady who checked us in never gave us any sort of info about the hotel (the gym, restaurant, bar, etc...) so it was up to us to venture and find out. There was no breakfast included, and I think it was about $22 in the restaurant on site. I never ate there. There are plenty of dining options in the area within walking distance. The room was a king size bed non-smoking and was very clean and comfortable. The entire hotel is non-smoking. The showers were amazing, with double head faucets! There was a large desk, flat screen tv, and small fridge which was pre-filled with goodies (for a fee). There was also a lounge chair with ottoman and a chaise lounge chair near the window. There was a large closet, with a safe and ironing board w/ iron as well. The hotel is very energy conscience and every time housekeeping came to clean up, they would turn off all the lights that we had left on, and also unplug any chargers we had left plugged into the wall, being unused. They left my laptop plugged in for me though! I left it out on the desk the entire stay and never had a problem with anything being touched, moved, or stolen. The doorman, concierge, and staff were all very friendly. The girl at check-out helped me enroll in their rewards program, and gave me a coupon for tickets to a concert! There were plenty of cabs waiting on the side street if you needed, and the doorman would whistle for one. The O'Hare Airport took about 30-45 mins to get to, depending on traffic, by cab and/or GO Shuttle. There are all the subway lines close by, and we walked everywhere! The only negative things were: no free breakfast, not even continental. For the price you would at least expect coffee, juice, and muffins/bagels. You could also hear all the slamming doors from other hotel guests, not really the hotels fault though, but it did wake me quite a few times. I also couldn't get the internet connection to work with my laptop in the room. There is no wireless in the rooms, but there is a cable connection. I never contacted the Front Desk with help with this, so not sure if it was fixable or not. I've never had problems in other hotels though. The only outlet(s) for charging electronics was at the desk -- I would have liked one under the nightstand so I didn't need to have my cell phone/alarm plugged clear across the room, and so I could sit in bed with my laptop. I would stay here again if I were going to Chicago, and would recommend it to everyone else. I can't really comment on any hotel amenities, as I didn't use them. There was an ATM ($4 fee) and a small gift shop in the lobby -- they sold souvenirs, snacks, and toiletries.

Reviews.Title: “A most rewarding experience!”
Reviews.Author: kaganmd
Reviews.Content: Sam in the health club is the best advertisement for the Westin. The hotel is tops. Exception being the rooms were dark. He is the abolute professional besides being a natural host, making one feel welcome and special at once.

Reviews.Title: “Westin - Wows”
Reviews.Author: CMFM
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a busy but very pleasant stay at the Westin Chicago River North. Fantastic location on the river and convenient to restaurants, theatres, transportation and shopping. In fulfilling my requst for a quiet room I was located in a corner room with an amazing view of the river and the city - and best of all it was quiet!! I didn't hear any city /traffic noise or noise from other rooms. Room was spacious, bathroom large, and everything was very clean. Bed and bedding super comfortable. All staff members were friendly and helpful. I was there for a conference and the meeting planners and attendees were also VERY happy with the accomodations, hotel staff and other aspects of putting together the conference. The hotel had several events going on while I was there (the conference I was attending,other meetings, a prom one night, a wedding the next day) but the place did not seem rushed or crowded. Did not eat at hotel restaurants or get the opportunity to eat anything at the meeting, but the coffee was good : ). Highly recommend this hotel for a Chicago stay and hope to return sometime soon.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Dr-D-101
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with two colleagues as a stopover en route to a conference in Michigan. The rooms are beautifully furnished, the beds are ridiculously comfortable, the staff is both friendly and professional, and the cocktails are great. Two of us got stranded by volcano ash on the way home after the conference, and decided to console ourselves by booking back into the Westin. Crystal, Gavin, and Justin at reception were fantastic, and Diane, the concierge, was also great, and recommended an amazing nearby restaurant. We're booking in again next year.

Reviews.Title: “What a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JKTraveler11
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked into the lobby, the Westin oozed class. We were treated courteously and attentively. The room was clearn and well-appointed. The location is ideal and the view of the river was spectacular. Special kudos to night manager/guest relations specialist Greg. He went above and beyond in making sure we were well cared for.

Reviews.Title: “CENTRAL TO EVERYTHING, GREAT STAFF”
Reviews.Author: TorontoDean
Reviews.Content: Personal trainer Sam great people skills and training skills; concierge Dianne and Lisa very helpful, housekeeping lady very nice - complemented us on our room

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-But I've Stayed in Better Westins”
Reviews.Author: pia_traveler519
Reviews.Content: I'll start by saying the room was spacious, very clean, and the "heavenly bed", as usual, did not disappoint. But I have stayed in Westin hotels that were nicer (particularly in St. Louis & Key West). Even the Chicago Westin Michigan Ave. seemed a bit nicer when I was there a few years ago. Although I was only visiting my parents who were staying at that hotel and not actually staying there myself. The Chicago Westin Michigan Ave. was all booked so I chose this one instead. Figuring since it got a better rating on Tripavisor it must be as good or better. Maybe I've just been spoiled by some really great experiences at other Westin hotels but the room seemed relatively unspectacular and not what I usually see at a Westin hotel. We didn't have a nice river view as some reviewers have described but we didn't care too much about that as we weren't in town to hang out in our hotel room. I guess my main complaints were that there seemed to be a good deal of street noise (we were on the eighth floor) and the roomed seemed a bit warm even on cool nights. I like it very cool when I sleep (so does my fiance) so we turned down the thermostat as far as it would go (65F, no choice between heat or AC). We also turned the fan on high, partly to try to drown out some of that street noise, and keep the room as cool as possible. The nightly lows were around 50For below outside so you wouldn't think the room should be warm at all. I woke up a few times during the night sweaty and uncomfortable. The location was perfect for us as we were enjoying the great number of restaurants in the area L stops are a short walk away as well ( we took the red-line to a Cubs game on Sat.). The service was fine in getting us cabs, the car, etc. in a timely manner. Overall I guess I can't say I wouldn't recommend this hotel but I have definitely experienced better and got better sleep at Westin hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for all the right reasons”
Reviews.Author: NathAus
Reviews.Content: The Westin Chicago River North is in a great location, just a 5min walk to the Chicago Theatre, the Loop El trains and the start of the Miracle Mile, and about a 10min walk to Millenium Park. We stayed in the Deluxe River View Room on the 20th floor and opted to spend extra for the complimentary continental breakfast buffet at the Executive Lounge down the hall each morning, which was worth it. There are a variety of bagels and jam spreads, cream cheese, boiled eggs, fresh fruit and berries, cereals, muesli and yogurts, and orange juice, tea and coffee. The staff were friendly and helpful. Also available are hor d'oeuvres between 5pm and 7pm which was great and complimentary water, soft drinks and fruit are available anytime. The Deluxe Room includes free wi-fi via an in-room Mac computer which was great. Most importantly, the room was very clean, as was the bathroom. The "heavenly bed" really is heavenly. The only negative experience we had was a noisy wedding party in the room next door to us. Accordingly, I would recommend not staying in a room with a connecting door since it made the noise all the louder. We had this occur two nights in a row and after we raised the issue with the front desk, they handled the situation very professionally by immediately offering us complimentary wine and cheese plate and adding points to our Starwood account for the inconvenience. The only other complaint was that the complimentary water that is offered as part of the Deluxe Room was not delivered two days in a row, even after we rang for it. Despite these isolated incidents though, I would recommend a stay at this hotel for its courteous staff, convenient location, cleanliness, heavenly bed and breakfast - all the things that should make a hotel stay-worthy.

Reviews.Title: “Best Starwood property we have ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: tamara321
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic! The people were consistently wonderful over the 10 days I was there. The business center was also a big plus and they were very accommodating with helping me to prepare for conference activities (which were at another hotel). The best experience was the gym, which was one of the best hotel gyms I have encountered, and Sam who manages the gym is an amazing personal trainer! He helped me kick up my work outs to a new level and this was all included as staying at the hotel. I can't recommend this place highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Chicago River North is a perfect location for Art Chicago & Galleries”
Reviews.Author: craigpainter
Reviews.Content: We were invited to Art Chicago at the Mart and decided to stay close. Even though a few other hotels were recommended, we felt the Westin was placed right in the middle of all the activities. The rooms were very comfortable, especially the window seat looking out over the River. The lounge was a great place to relax and/or meet people. We used it several times. the drinks and small dishes were just what we needed. Of course nothing tops the heavenly beds! Wow, what a great nights sleep! But the service does come a close second!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, just a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ads201259
Reviews.Content: The Westin Chicago is a fantastic hotel to stay in when you are in Chicago. Very centrally located right on the river it is within 5 minutes walk of numerous bars and restaurants, and 5 to 10 minutes walk from fantastic shopping including the Magnificent Mile. All the staff are incredibly friendly and helpful with none of the "New York:" attitude of expecting a tip (which for Aussies travelling abroad is always difficult to work out anyway). I had to stay there for 3 weeks for work and unlike numerous other hotels that I have stayed in the Westin was truely a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Best workout!”
Reviews.Author: Lillyann004
Reviews.Content: Best workout ever - Sam (the Westin Workout Manager) is the best - gives you personal training tips from as early as 5AM! Overall: Good hotel with nice amenities - rooms could do with some more light.

Reviews.Title: “My home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Peter60878
Reviews.Content: I have spent the past five weeks traveliing for business throughout the US and did over 4 months last year. Of this time most has been spent in Chicago where i have stayed at the Westin River North. When travelling for business particularly I like to have things at my fingertips and not have to worry about anything other than work since more often than not I am working to strict deadlines on each trip. I also like to have access to a good health club at the hotel where I stay and for the staff to treat you as an individual rather than just another paying guest. Westin River North has met these expectations and as such I will have no hesitation in re-visting there on my next business trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms, service, food & amenities...all superb!”
Reviews.Author: geroprof
Reviews.Content: Exceptional staff, spacious, luxurious rooms, delicious food and all you need to conduct your business (or pleasure)! I will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, well located property. Sam the gym trainer is the icing on the fat free cake.”
Reviews.Author: lskrocki
Reviews.Content: Well decorated, clean rooms. The property is in a great location. The gym is well equiped. Sam the gym trainer is incredibly friendly & helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Workout Facility In The World”
Reviews.Author: ducksrule3
Reviews.Content: For all of you workout fanatics - have a great hotel gym for you if you are ever in Chicago. The Westin Chicago River North has a gem of an employee in the gym - Sam. One of the friendliest and knowledgeable people you will ever meet and the gym is fully loaded, super clean and new equipment. Say they open at 5:30 - but was able to get in every day at 4:30. Free chair massages also. Could tell lots of people were coming back to this hotel just to use the gym and because of Sam. Know when I am back in Chicago - I'll definitely stay at this hotel again. Rest of the staff at the hotel - super friendly too. Great find and we have traveled everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Super Service”
Reviews.Author: NiigataTravelLover
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel per my boss's recommendation with 8 other colleagues from Tokyo. We arrived very early in the morning from the airport and was not sure if we could check in much before the official check-in time. The front staff was so kind that everyone could check in and take good rests after the long flight from Tokyo. It was Easter Sunday and most restaurants were closed for lunch and dinner. Again the front staff called several restaurants, gave me a couple of choices, and finally booked a very good one for us all. The hotel staff was very responsive in any matter and did everything they could do to make our stay comfortable. I would definitely come back to this hotel and recommend my friends and colleagues to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis by the river”
Reviews.Author: DublinDave247
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a three day conference, flew 3,500 mile and the stay in the hotel could not have been any better. Staff were excellent from check in to check out, their was no issue they could not handle. We held our conference in the hotel, facilities and food, no other word for it excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kobekeith
Reviews.Content: I missed my third flight across the USA and was "stuck" in Chicago for a night and day and opted to stay here instead of a crappy airport hotel. I was very happy with my choice. The staff was very helpful and kind. The room and bathroom were tidy. And the location was good. I'll stay here again the next time when the airline messes up my connection to/from Japan.

Reviews.Title: “We have stayed at this hotel on and off for many years.”
Reviews.Author: RES52
Reviews.Content: We have always found the hotel to be a welcoming and pleasant visit. We will stay at the Westin whenever given the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “It is so relaxing & refreshing”
Reviews.Author: GemK027
Reviews.Content: I love staying at Westin's! It feels luxiourious and comfortable. It smells wonderful, and I alway sleep WELL.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, good club floor”
Reviews.Author: bc2mc3
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights while visiting my daughter. The club floors were very nice with free wifi and a nice place for breakfast even on the weekend. My one complaint was that being on the 18th floor my room was VERY hot. However, I talked to the front desk and they sent up 2 fans. From then on the room was cool enough to sleep in. The staff was excellent anytime I had an issue or a question. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Sleep and Business”
Reviews.Author: rgraham
Reviews.Content: Needed a place to sleep between tough business days involving hard-hitting negotiations. Each night it was a pleasure to return and relax in this quiet business district hotel. Service was excellent and non-interfering. Slept great. Woke up refreshed. Had some in-room snacks and all the necessities to prepare oneself were included. Recommend Harry Carrie's steakhouse nearby.

Reviews.Title: “would definitely come back again”
Reviews.Author: skora3956
Reviews.Content: great hotel, service, location, and value. staff was friendly and room was perfect. especially liked breakfast in the executive club overlooking the river and downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Service Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cityandtownlover
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago for 4 days for a trade show. I was very happy that I staying at the Weston Hotel because it was not only convenient, but the quality of services offered at the Weston was top notch. I was especially impressed with the Health Club which was the best hotel gym I have stayed at. There was even a helpful fitness instructor named Sam who was so friendly and polite to all the guests who were working out. The continental breakfast in the Executive Room was also first rate and the views from this hotel, especially from the South Side are spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at the Westin”
Reviews.Author: cmtravels
Reviews.Content: We spent a night at the Westin for our 30th wedding anniversary. We arrived at 3:30 and check in was 3:00 and our "deluxe" room was not ready to do a lot of late check outs from the morning. We were told this with so much regret by the the front desk and they offered us 2 drink coupons to have a drink while we waited. That was pretty refreshing I must say. It's the first time (of many times I regret to say) that we have been treated with such respect when being told our room wasn't ready yet. We waited about 30 minutes and our room was ready and the front desk asked if they could give us some champagne and strawberries to make up for not having the room ready and also for our anniversary. Whaaaat? Hotels still do this???? Got to our room and it was spotless!!! We had a deluxe king rm that overlooked the river and the view was wonderful..the Chicago river and the city lights were gorgeous! The bathroom is good sized and so clean. Spend the extra for this room. You won't be sorry. The "heavenly" bed lived up to its name. Not only was it comfortable but all of the bed linens and quilt are white and spotless. When we returned from dinner we found a bottle of champagne and a beautiful bowl of strawberries with a hand written note of anniversary congratulations from the Westin. I am very discerning and a clean freak and I have to say that this hotel did not disappoint us on any level. It is by far the best hotel we've ever stayed at while in Chicago and it is the only one we will stay at in the future. These folks are doing things right. They truly make their guests feel welcome and appreciated and I have to admit it was a bit shocking (in a good way) to be treated like that. Another thing I'll mention is that the location rocks!!! Excellent restaurants within walking distance and a very safe feeling area.

Reviews.Title: “Happy overall, but one or two issues...”
Reviews.Author: Barmag
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 5 night stay at the Westin on our first visit to Chicago, We liked: 1. Really friendly and helpful staff at the concierge and on the front door. 2. Great location by the river - easy walk to the Loop, various restaurants, Magnificent Mile etc.. 3. Good size comfortable room, with faultless housekeeping. 4. Quiet at night. We disliked: 1. Absence of help with baggage on arrival (other reviews mention this). 2. Miserable flow of water from the shower in our bathroom (even when the second of two showerheads was engaged). 3. Main restaurant had a disappointing and expensive breakfast offering, and was closed in the evening. 4. Main public areas were dark and unattractive, with little seating outside the lounge bar area (the decor generally was reminiscent of the hotel's previous Japanese identity, and needs brightening up). 5. The bedroom had no masterswitch, and turning out all the lights was not as easy as it should have been. 6. No visible security as regards access to the room floors (no card access requirement for the elevators, no chains on the room doors) - though I should add that we felt very safe walking in Chicago, day and night, throughout our stay. 7. They charge $10 a day for WiFi access, and free access to the desktops in the lobby is limited to airline check-ins. Your fellow guests are likely to be chattering conference attendees. If you don't mind that, and can get a reasonable room rate, don't hesitate (In spite of the reservations listed above).

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding....way above my expectations and one of the best hotel experiences I've had!”
Reviews.Author: AllisonGG
Reviews.Content: I never write reviews but this was something I couldnt pass up. My stay at the Chicago Westin River North was fantastic! The service was really the most rewarding aspect to my stay, the gym - Sam was wonderful; my maid - Anja...room was always spotless; F&B team were all wonderful and efficient (this is so unusual it seems at other hotels) etc etc. My stay was comparable to my experiences at Four Seasons, in fact better! I really cannot wait to return and I should also mention that I live out of a hotels since I run national sales!

Reviews.Title: “Quite time in a busy city”
Reviews.Author: OmahaTourist
Reviews.Content: One of the best part of this hotel was walking in and having a sense of calm take over in contrast to the pace of downtown Chicago. The staff always welcomed us back and were generous with there help without the sense of constant expectation for gratuities, which made it more pleasant ot tip.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel in the heart of Downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: priceisright
Reviews.Content: I've been a regular customer at the Westin River North for years -- I think I've stayed there 20 times in the past 12 months. The hotel is very convenient to many businesses located in the loop, as well as "the Miracle Mile" The hotel is clean and well run. * The rooms are very nice, and feature Westin's signature Heavenly Bed. * The gym in particular is great -- not overly large, but well resourced, and Sam, who staffs fitness center in the morning -- is always amazingly friendly (even when folks are walking groggy-eyed at 6:00 AM). As a certified trainer, he is more than willing to help folks improve their workout routines * The lobby restaurant/bar are fine, but the one disappointment (The Hanna Lounge, I think it's called). Food quality is good, but service is spotty. All in all, a very nice option particularly for business travelers who like Starwood.

Reviews.Title: “none”
Reviews.Author: laobx
Reviews.Content: great location,good area of town. Shopping and food area is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Gym”
Reviews.Author: SalTrav
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Westin RN for the first time after normally staying at the W in Chicago, the rooms are large and light and it's in a great location. In particular the Westin Workout facility was excellent with free personal training provided by Sam, an excellent PT. I would definitely choose this as my hotel of choice for Chicago in future.

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable beds ever”
Reviews.Author: JeremiahB4
Reviews.Content: I loved the room...I loved all of it. Parking was steep, but that's Chicago and we got a deal on the room so who cares. A walk or cab away from everything. Great service.

Reviews.Title: “An "average" Westing, consistently nice experience for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: SFTraveler555
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here many times and the staff is very nice. It a fine Westin, very good for business travel. Gym is very good. They need to solve the diffcult nature of their boarding pass printing facility - this is a known solution and not one you should have to pay for. Not sure I'd recommend for leisure - a bit out of the way from anything that really matters in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Solid choice in river North”
Reviews.Author: LumpyVt
Reviews.Content: The bathrooms are outstanding, and the beds the always reliable Heavenly Sleeper. Most rooms have nice views as well. Staff is uniformly excellent. The lobby bar is well run, if somewhat noisy. Good value is available.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, Great Beds, Cool view, stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Friday13th_9
Reviews.Content: I am a Gold member to several different hotels including Hilton, Marriot so to say the least I spend a lot of times in hotels. I would rank this much higher than the top 25 in Chicago. If you are lucky enough to get a river view you will be treated to a great room with a view, I am sure the other sides are good. The service is fantastic! From the front desk to the concierge each of the staff act as if they own the hotel and want you to enjoy your stay. I cannot wait to get back and spend another night. Also be sure to look for deals as this hotel does offer some specials from time to time. But even at their regular rates the hotel is worth it. Give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Amazing Beds, Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: outdoorfungirl
Reviews.Content: The parking was super easy and the valet directed me to the parking garage which was super easy to find and $36 total for two night compared to $48 per day valet... It was nice because they had a drive up area and the streets surrounding were two-way, I usually hate driving in downtown because of all the one way streets surrounding the hotels. The lobby is very dim and romantic (although it was a business trip) the staff is super helpful in every way. The beds were beyond AMAZING! Starbucks coffee in-room was fantastic so were the double shower heads. I just wished they had more cable tv stations....The place is well kept and the decor is fabulous!!! We will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Lobby/Exterior Very Nice, Beds not heavenly at all”
Reviews.Author: cajzu
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this Westin for three nights last week. We were there for a trade show and the location was good. We got a good conference rate and generally LOVE Westin hotels. The $99 rate was great. Parking for $48 a night seemed excessive, but overall, $150 a night still seemed reasonable with parking factored in. The front desk was very good and check-in was quick. The outside of the hotel and the lobby were nice. When you walk in there is a lounge and that looks way cool. We ate at the lounge and the food was good, but the service was terrible. Very snotty, cold and unhelpful. Try the sliders appetizer ($9) and delish. Upon first glance, the room is pretty. That is until you notice rust in the tub and around bathroom fixtures. The catch to get the shower going required help to get on and I had to beat it with my conditioner bottle to turn it off. The first night we spent the night in a bed so uncomfortable we considered checking out. Can you believe that? It's a HEAVENLY BED. We called the front desk and they promised to switch our room once one was available. They moved our bags for us as well. The second bed was much better, but not fabulous. The beds didn't have all the heavenly bed "features" = there were not the 10 layers of pure comfort as stated on the site. The bed was a sheet, a top sheet, a blanket and a comforter. The comforter was so heavy you felt like a person was laying on you and not in a good way. It actually looked nothing like the heavenly beds we have had in the past and go out of our way to stay in. A nice hotel, but the worst Westin we have stayed at. If you want a decent downtown place, this is good. If you're looking for fabulous comfort, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Servicecreator
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in January in order to spend some quality time together and discover Chicago. We could not have stayed at a better place; outstanding facilities, beautiful rooms, top location in order to have easy access to all "must sees" in Chicago. We actually did evertyhing by foot, becasue we love walking and believe that this is a good way to discover a City. However, the best part of the hotel is for sure the staff friendliness and eagerness to make sure that the guests feel good and regret that they have to leave in the end! I would certainly come back to this nice place with these great personalities.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, comfortable, but unspectacular lodgings”
Reviews.Author: otberbur
Reviews.Content: The Westin Chicago River North is a well-run chain establishment centrally located in downtown Chicago. Our room, with a view of the Chicago River, was by no means over-the-top luxurious, but it was well-designed and spacious, with good lighting and comfortable seating. A quiet room and the Westin "Heavenly Bed" made for excellent sleeping conditions for someone who often does not sleep well even in better hotels. Service in the hotel was polite and efficient. What keeps this hotel from receiving a top rating: (1) lack of any "wow" factor: the room, while comfortable, was also generic; (2) no free wi-fi; (3) the food we were served in the banquet rooms (for a wedding) was fairly indifferent in quality, even for banquet food. Still, if the price is right, this hotel can offer a very good deal.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: NYerUWS
Reviews.Content: Loved, loved loved this hotel. Beautiful soothing decor, enormous rooms and bathrooms with great views. Terrific location no matter what you are doing. Staff very accomodating and room service was very good, as were the restaurant and lobby sushi bar. Fabulously comfortable bed. This hotel will be my first choice from now on. One recommendation - a surge protector on the desk. I had to crawl under the desk to plug in laptops, chargers etc.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Kaye50
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference. I was on my own. It was easy to find and a great location. Near shopping and restuarants. The service was great and the room very comfortable. A little on the expensive side for accomodation, however when in a large city on your own I think its worth the extra.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Experience”
Reviews.Author: Louielori
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Loved the executive lounge. It was a GREAT experience.

Reviews.Title: “Chic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lucaska
Reviews.Content: We stayed over Valentine's Day weekend and got an awesome rate of just $129 a month. Sign up for the e-mail blasts and they will send you notices of special rates. You cannot get a better hotel in the heart of Chicago for that price anywhere. The hotel is located along the river and across the street from House of Blues and a great wine bar called Bin 36. You are also just a short walk to Michigan Ave. and a lot of the major Chicago attractions. The L is not too far either. We stay here all the time!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice in the heart of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: allenandstef
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend after placing a bid on Priceline to find a hotel in downtown Chicago. We were presently surprised after we discovered the Westin River North would be our home for the weekend. The location is right on the Chicago River, overlooking Wacker Drive and downtown Chicago. It is very easy walking distance to the Loop, the El trains and Michigan Avenue. The River North neighborhood is home to many great restaurants and seems to have better nightlife than the Loop. All in all, it really was a very convenient location for exploring the city. It seems to cater primarily to business travelers, but is also a very comfortable and accomodating property for leisure travelers as well. The room was large and comfortable, with a very nice chaise lounge (fainting couch?) right by the floor-to-ceiling window. A great place to sit and watch boats sail along on the river down below. The bathroom was also very large, lots of counter space, large mirrors, etc. The style was somewhat Asian, with dark marble tiles and sleek lines. (I think this property was previously a Hotel Nikko, or something like that. The architecture and some of the furnishings are definitely a hold-over from that, although still very nice.) The only drawback I have about this property is their unwillingness to place us in a different room. Three of us (adults) had purchased the room using Priceline. (Yes, I know the fine print at Priceline tells us that the reservation is technically only for two people.) When we checked in, we requested a room with two beds but were told they had us in a room with one king bed. We asked for a different room but was told they were "sold out" for 2nd night of our stay and they wouldn't be able to move us. Even though two of us are Starwood members, we were still refused on our request to get a room with 2 beds. I find it hard to believe the hotel was sold out -- especially since they kept saying it was sold out the next night. I feel like we were somewhat given the shaft because we were Priceline customers. I, of course, have no way of verifying this. We tried calling down to the front desk later in the evening, and even stopped by there in person the next morning and were still met with resistance. Even though the room was very comfortable, the front desk staff and their service left me with a somewhat bitter taste in my mouth. They were not accommodating and were not sympathetic to our request for a different room.

Reviews.Title: “Rock Star Quality”
Reviews.Author: Stretch710
Reviews.Content: You will feel high class staying here! The #1 benefit I had staying here was the unimaginably comfortable beds here. By far the best night sleep and makes u wake up with a smile!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...excellent service”
Reviews.Author: zoomtraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at this hotel before while in Chicago. The second time we checked in the agent behind the desk told us "Welcome back, welcome home". I thought that was a nice touch coming off of the JFK Epway and dealing with the downtown traffic. The beds is what keeps us coming back. They are so heavenly. We love this hotel and will stay there again. Sure it's expensive but when my husband and I go out on vacation we like the special touches and will spend the money to feel pampered. For thoes who do not want to spend too much check in the wintertime for some great rates. The first time we stayed there was in the dead of winter on a special rate that included parking. Sure who wants to go to Chicago when it's cold, but that is where you can find great deals.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, but overpriced especially for the extras”
Reviews.Author: Amy24
Reviews.Content: We love Westin hotels. So much so that we have a Heavenly bed in our home. Our kids loved watching the boats on the river from our riverview room. This location is fantastic, the lobby is luxurious, and all in all the rooms, decor, etc. was everything I expect from a Westin, even down to the smells. The free use of a computer and iternet in the room was a nice touch for the club level rooms. However, we paid extra to be on the club level. So why is it that every time we went to the club, the employees hinted at charging us extra money? Apparently, what they do not tell you when you pay extra for the club level is that they only expect two people in your party to enjoy it. If you have two young children staying in your room, the club employees make it very clear that they should be charging you $12/person for each snack time that you bring more than 2 people there. Therefore, even though we paid extra for the club amenities, we found ourselves tipping the club employees the equivalent of a decent breakfast at the Panera. While I would recommend this hotel to a friend, I do not recommend the club experience. It is not worth the extra expense.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Nurn
Reviews.Content: The Westin Hotel could not have been more accommodating. They allowed us both early check in and late check out. We were there for a wedding and they helped with several requests for things we needed and made great suggestions for things to do and where to eat. The room was extra clean and spacious, very comfortable with a lovely view of the river. The only criticism is that the lobby is a lilttle dark. They need a little better lighting. Would definitely stay there again as well as recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: jim_rr
Reviews.Content: Spent a Saturday night here free as part of a promo for staying at Starwood properties. They gave us a better than average room, and also gave us access to the club floor, which was a nice surprise. The room was very quiet, with an excellent ventilation system. It was also clean and has a very comfortable bed. Staff here is very friendly. On the minus side, there appears to be a significant charge for everything, even a bottle of water in the room. There is a charge for using a computer in the lobby as well, so this is not a hotel for those on a tight budget. There is an bagel place across the street for a simple food cheap. The location of the hotel is excellent, just a couple blocks to the train for the airport. The club floor usually costs another $30 for the room, which is probably not a good value, since the continental breakfast and evening snacks are not generous. One thing to note: the hotel is very very in the public spaces, such that you could walk into a column or trip easily. We tried the room service - sushi, which was fine. We would definitely stay here again, if the price were right.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel near Magnificent Mile”
Reviews.Author: Pangia
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Westin on Dearborn Ave for one night last week and was very happy. The hotel was in a great location, short walking distance to the Magnificent Mile and the main shopping drag of the city. The room was a good size, with king bed, chaise lounge, flat screen, computer setup, and nice view of a river. Good central location, nice lobby, and helpful staff. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not so Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Gizmojen
Reviews.Content: We used Priceline and got a great deal on the Westin River North over a long weekend in August. For the price, I really have no complaints. But, for a Westin, I expected better. We are Starwood Members and have stayed at many of the Starwood properties and this one did not feel up to par. I called and requested a King size bed, river view, a fridge in our room, and a crib as we were traveling with our 2 year old. I was told no problem on any of this. When we got to the hotel we had to wait a LONG time to check in. There was a very long line and only two people working the desk, and one of them was only assisting Starwood Gold members. They gave us our room and we went upstairs. We DID get a King size bed, but there was no riverview, no fridge and no crib in the room. On our way out we stopped by the desk and asked for the crib and the fridge and we were told they would be brought right up. We went out to visit with friends and go back four hours later and there was still no crib in our room. At this point we had a cranky toddler who needed to sleep! I called and requested the crib AGAIN and finally they brought it to us. I don't understand why I had to request the crib three times! We did end up getting the fridge also. Other than that, we had no other issues with the hotel except that we just didn't feel like guests at a Starwood. We are used to friendly staff and people going out of their way to make your stay more comfortable and we didn't get that impression here. It seems like there was a lot going on at the hotel that weekend- at least two weddings were happening on Saturday night- and the staff seemed preoccupied. For the price, we got a great deal on a nice hotel. But to be honest, I always expect more out of a Starwood property and I just didn't get that feeling at this hotel. Also, we were VERY surprised that this property has no pool!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful service, comfortable and clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: WDCglobaltraveler
Reviews.Content: Good value for the money -- rooms are clean, quiet and hotel is well-situated. Concierge is very helpful -- got us tickets for the CAF boat tours that we were told were sold out. Everyone very friendly and pleasant. Location is terrific -- within walking distance of the Magnificent Mile, and some great restaurants. This is the place to stay in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: nycmom2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here this past weekend with a baby and found it to be a very relaxing hotel. The building is old, but the room was big. The location was also fantastic. We walked to the Navy Pier which was beautiful and also to Millenium Park and Buckingham Fountain and to the Magnificent Mile and everything was all very close. There are lots of restaurants to choose from within walking distance and the area felt safe. We also saw lots of other families with strollers so it's definitely a baby friendly city. We didn't have much time to hang out at the hotel so can't comment on the facilities there, but I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Chi-town”
Reviews.Author: stantsy
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 2 night stay at the Westin Chicago River North. Booked through expedia and was not at all disappointed. Location is 'top-drawer', staff were very friendly. Room was really nice and cleaned up very well daily. I did not eat on-site so cannot comment on that but there is a lot within very close walking distance as to anything you want to do in Chicago. Lawry's prime rib-awesome, architectural boat tour-awesome, Sears/Willis tower-awesome (get the fast pass ahead of time). Overall, very happy with the WCRN, did not have a river-view which was disappointing but just meant to actually get out and enjoy everything Chicago has to offer in person. As a note, if you like a little attitude, go to Dick's last resort across the street, the staff there are rude and they do it on purpose so if you like a little rudeness/attitude, that is the place for you, I went, great view of the river, great drinks and you can give it back to them and it only feeds the fire more.....all in good fun so take note of that.....enjoy....

Reviews.Title: “Just "ok" hotel but convenient to great food!”
Reviews.Author: cwberry
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just spent 4 nights at the Westin River North during my ABA Conference. Bottom line is that I would NOT stay here again. First, however, I will mention the few positive aspects of this hotel. It is in a great location for food and nightlife (short walk to tons of amazing restaurants and cool bars). We tried Vong's Thai Kitchen, Frontera Grill for Mexican, Sushi Samba, and Lou Malnati's (pizza/pasta)...all of which were AWESOME. Also loved the Rockit Bar for drinks! All those places were just a short walk away from the Westin, so we were happy about that. Now for the negative. Before we even got to Chicago, I had issues with the reservations department. I booked through the ABA's travel people and was supposed to have a "Deluxe" river view room, but when I called to confirm, the reservations lady was beyond rude and told me I was only booked for a standard room and there was nothing she could do for me. I then emailed the Westin customer service people and was IMMEDIATELY notified that my room had been upgraded and that everything was taken care of...So I felt better. Then, when we get there (just about 45 minutes before check-in), our room was ready - which was fine - but when I asked the guy at the front desk how long it would be, he said he had no idea and couldn't even guarantee it would be ready by normal check-in time...I was already frustrated because of my long trip and my problems with reservations beforehand, so this wasn't the perfect way to start off our stay. The room: outdated, very disappointing for a "corner riverview room" - especially considering the rate we paid. We even walked over to the Renaissance across the street (we LOVE Renaissance hotels btw) to see if we could switch rooms, but they were booked solid -- so we decided to try and stick it out. I will admit the bed was comfortable and the shower was nice...definitely nothing fancy though. Concierge service: had to wait several times for the concierge to even be at their desk...have mixed emotions about this, as one lady was really great and the other didn't seem to care much about helping us out. Did get a good list of restaurants though. :) Overall - I wouldn't recommend this for the price. Way too high for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mnk2406
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in Chicago and a great stay at the Westin. The hotel was within walking distance from everything. The only time I took a cab was when I went to the Museum of Science. Our room was large and clean. We had a view of the river which was gorgeous. They don't serve breakfast which is disappointing since many 3-star hotels include it for free. There is an Einstein's about a block a way. Also, in-room internet is expensive (another amenity that many 3-star hotels include for free) but you can get free wi-fi in the lobby. The only disappointment was the elevator lobby on the 7th floor where our room was located. I think someone may have vomited on the carpets in that area. The smell was absolutely terrible. I was lucky not to have a room nearby the lobby - I can't imagine how the people near the lobby dealt with it! I could tell that the maids worked every morning to clear the smell by using some sort of citrus cleaner. It only masked the smell and the citrus scent dissipated within 2 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and a fantastic city”
Reviews.Author: sgeddie
Reviews.Content: We really enjoy staying at Westin Hotels and this was no exception. So why didn't we give it a five? Two things, One they only leave one type of each coffee in the room (one decaf and one regular), we both drink regular. The first morning my husband called and requested an additional regular coffee to be brought up...45 minutes later, we were ready to go, without the coffee. Saying that, when I filled in the comment card upon our departure, I had an email before the end of the day. Needless to say I was very impressed. Second reason, we were on the Executive Club floor, with included breakfast. At other hotels you get a bit of a variety, not here. Cantaloupe, watermelon, bagels, and hard boiled eggs. Needless to say we ate out for breakfast for the other two mornings. Now Chicago. What a fantastic city!!!! We had such a great time and met some fantastic people. The wine bar next to the InterContinental has great wines and great service. We ate at Two of the restaurants they recommended. The one I loved I can't remember the name of was truly a locals place, buzzing with people who all knew each other. It's Italian and literially right behind the wine bar, down a flight of stairs. The food was fantastic would highly recommend. On our last night we went to Spring about a 10-15 minute taxi ride out of the center of Chicago. Again great food, but it was lifeless on a Sunday night. I would try again on a busier night. Again great service.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but nothing special amenity wise”
Reviews.Author: BobandCec
Reviews.Content: The location was convenient to everything - we did a whole lot of walking because we could. The room itself was nothing special, although I will say the bed was very comfortable (albeit a double was a bit small for us). The cable channel selection was very limited - we wound up watching a DVD on my laptop. The lack of free internet, the posted charging of $1.50 for local calls and $8 bottled water created what seemed like an "out to get you" brand damaging atmosphere. Granted none of this is horrible, but there's other hotels as nice looking to please you rather than nickel and dimeing you. I highly recommend visiting the Art Institute and Millennium Park. Blue line from the airport was a breeze to use.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in every way!”
Reviews.Author: matticat
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel room for $89 through Priceline. Couldn't be more pleased. It was close to all the activities and provided all the services that we needed during our stay. We paid $48 each day with in and out privileges at the hotel, although we never took the car out. Taxi's were convenient and for about $10.00 each way to places like Field Museum and Navy Pier it made more sense to leave the car. Our room was absolutely wonderful. Couldn't find a fault and I am picky. Clean, very comfortable beds, and a large bathroom with a giant tub and shower. Our room had chairs arranged for easy conversations by the window viewing the river, a very large desk and a large hospitality refrigerator stuff full of all kinds of items. The items were pricey but that is expected for the convenience. It was a beautifully decorated room and we would definitely stay there again. The front desk was easy in and easy out. I can honestly say I have never had a better experience and we have traveled the world. They thought and planned for anything you need.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but has a few issues..”
Reviews.Author: ko_mommy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin for my sister's bachelorette party. We got a great deal off of Priceline for $80/night per room which was awesome compared to everything else in the area. Despite the good deal, there were a few issues we had with the hotel. For starters, when we checked in they asked for an ID and a credit card. They did not say anything about charging the card but before we knew it, she was handing the card back to us saying it went thru for the first room but was denied on the second.. We had prepaid online and she did not say anything about charging the card so my sister then got a little rude and asked why the card was even charged. They said it was a $200 charge PER ROOM for incidentals. Now we don't stay in hotels that often and this may be a common practice but she should have at least told us she was charging the card! Upon arriving to our room we realized that we were given king beds when we requested double beds. They did say they would try to accomidate requests but I find it hard to believe every double bed room was taken 3 weeks prior to our arrival when we made that request. When we got back to the hotel later that night (Very late - abt 2:30 in the morn) we asked the front desk for an extra blanket for the one person who was going to have to sleep on the chaise. An hour and a half later the blanket arrived... There was no way the front desk was that busy that late at night for it to take an hour and a half. Our last complaint was getting woken up to room service "knocking" with their key twice then before we could even answer the door, COMING IN our room while we were getting ready and my sister was in the shower!! Overall I gave this hotel 3 stars. It was nicely decorated and clean but there are some major issues for a hotel of this class. I wouldn't want to be one of those that paid full price for this hotel and had these kind of problems. ** We found that parking a block and a half away at a Self Park garage saved us A LOT of money. (between Clark & LaSalle on Kinzie) It was $42 for valet at the hotel and the parking garage only cost us $16. (Night & weekend special)

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Genesis803
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on the 4th of July. The hotel was very nice, clean, and comfortable. It was everything I expected from a Westin. The only negative was that the maids knocked on our door twice trying to clean the room despite the "do not disturb" sign being on the door. The hotel was a little off the beaten path. Most CTA buses were about two blocks away. We didn't mind the walk as the weather was excellent. I would definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worth Seeing If You Can Get A Deal With The Hotel”
Reviews.Author: billyboy07
Reviews.Content: This is based on a stay on a river view room. XX25 will secure you such a view, and is apparantly a little bigger than the other traditional rooms. The hotel's in a great place to explore the City. Nice property, exceptionally clean, although the hotel seemed just a little gloomy when entering the lobby from the street - it's all the darkened glass windows. It's the same with the rooms. They also have privacy blinds at the windows, as well as curtains. Can't really believe the other rooms offer too much in the way of views as it seemed the Westin's now towered over by other properties nearby. Some roadnoise from the Dearborn Street bridge, but in a way, quite mesmerising. Room minibar had extortionate prices - plenty of convenience stores a short distance away though, so too was the blue E station Clark and Lake - just over the bridge a 5 minute walk and a direct line from O'Hare Airport - only $2.20 and a 40 minute ride. It's the only hotel I've been to, where you're charged a daily rate ($10 per person) to use the gym. That was disappointing. There were also charges for internet access in rooms and in the business centre, although a discrete sign in reception said that there was free wifi in the lobby and the lounge. Offered a room rate on the day of $217 per night which was around $100 less than best price booking in advance on Westin's own website. Pity we'd already prepaid through a travel agent. Obviously, if you like to take a gamble, you can get a better price.

Reviews.Title: “A great business hotel that really goes that extra mile.”
Reviews.Author: Darlox
Reviews.Content: The Westin Chicago River North is a posh business hotel with a great location and great amenities. The rooms were top-notch and everything about our visit went smoothly. Read on for details: LOCATION: The Westin Chicago River North is located just outside the northern end of the Loop, on the river, between Dearborn and Clark streets. It is about a 5 minute walk from the Magnificent Mile, about 10 minutes from Millennium Park, and maybe 15-20 to the Art Institute and museum district. Driving, the hotel is completely subject to the vagaries of Chicago traffic, but it's in the neighborhood of 45 minutes to O'Hare airport with typical traffic, and about 10 minutes from McCormick Place. Cab fare from O'Hare was $42 excluding tip. PROPERTY: The Westin has a nice lobby bar, which also has a Sushi Bar attached. There is a full-service restaurant off the lobby. There are available computer terminals that form a sort of mini-business-center just next to registration. The main entrance of the hotel is actually on the 2nd physical floor, and the two levels leading down to River level are meeting rooms and ballrooms, all of which are in excellent condition. There is a fitness center on the Mezanine level. Guest rooms are between floors 3 and 20, with the top two floors being the Westin Executive Club -- generally reserved for suites, top room rates, and high-level Starwood Preferred Guest members. There is a Club Suite on the 20th floor serving complimentary breakfast in the morning, and complimentary hors d'oeuvres in the afternoon, available to guests staying on the Club floors. The Club also offers an executive Business Center which is slightly more functional than the computer cubicles in the lobby. ROOMS: The rooms in the Westin are exceptional. All rooms were fully equipped with the Westin package, including their Heavenly Beds (they are!) and their dual-head showers. As a Starwood Gold guest, I received a complimentary upgrade to a Club-level room upon check-in. The westward-facing rooms have a great view down to the river, and all rooms have large nearly floor-to-ceiling windows, with both a privacy shade and a black-out curtain. Not certain if all rooms have all of the other amenities, but our club-level room also had a clock/radio with included iPod dock, a POD-type coffee brewer, complimentary wireless Internet, a flat-panel TV and in-room electronic safe. STAFF: The staff at the hotel were wonderful. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful, the bellmen and guest services crew went out of their way to assist with plans both inside and outside of the hotel, and the lobby bar crew are experts at serving business groups -- attentive but not overbearing. OTHER: Anyone driving here should beware that on-site parking at the hotel is criminally expensive -- a whopping $42 per night for valet parking with in/out privileges! While it's definitely convenient to park on-site, there is a lot about two blocks away at (I believe) Kinzie and LaSalle Streets, with an overnight rate of $22. The hotel staff actually told us about this alternative lot, so I suspect many guests elect to self-park there. In general, our stay at the Westin was exceptionally smooth and productive. Our meetings in their river-level rooms went smoothly, the rooms themselves were comfortable and well-appointed, and the staff did their jobs well. I would recommend this hotel to any business group, but also to any tourist if you can get a decent rate. The hotel's convenient location to many popular downtown Chicago spots makes this a fantastic option for just about anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Best Westin in Chicagoland!”
Reviews.Author: MCohen
Reviews.Content: I stayed hear when my apartment was being painted after moving to Chicago for work. When I got to the front desk (SPG Gold member) they automatically upgraded me to a corner river view room on a high floor. I also had access to their club upstairs. Great hor' dourves and free softdrinks. It was basically my dinner by the time I left. I had a lovely night watching 4th of July fireworks from my window. Slept great and left with late check out. The next year I went their to find a quiet place to talk on the phone and they let me borrow a conference room. AMAZING!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, View, and Location”
Reviews.Author: msu17
Reviews.Content: I booked this Westin through Hotwire for only $81...a fabulous deal for mid-May. After booking, I called the hotel and kindly requested a King bed room with a river view. What we received at check-in was room 626, a large corner room with three huge windows that overlook the Chicago River! (It seems that rooms ending in x24-x27 are river view rooms). This hotel is beautiful from top to bottom. The location is perfect, right between river north and the loop. It is easy to walk anywhere you want downtown. The room was beautiful and very comfortable. The bed is outstanding, and the chaise lounge is a nice touch. Great LCD TV with HD channels. Huge workstation. Only complaint is that everything is extra $. They charge for internet, fitness center, and a ton for valet parking. Many downtown hotels charge for these also, which is why we still give the WRN 5 stars. Plus, at $81 (regular $250) there isn't much to complain about really. Tip: if you drive in, park your car at the Sterling garage on Kinzie, between Clark and LaSalle. Much cheaper than valet.

Reviews.Title: “great view, spacious room, but need to clean the bathroom - yuck!”
Reviews.Author: AccomodationsQueen
Reviews.Content: I just returned from 2 nights and it is a very nice hotel, esp the deluxe rooms facing the river - there are 2 beveled floor to ceiling windows that offer a panorama of a beautiful view. The bed is comfy. However, the air (and some staff) are stuffy. The bathroom had an acrid smell - a combo of urine & moldy shower curtain. I had to keep the bathroom door shut. The room itself was clean enough, but they do need to deal with the lack of fresh air and really scrub down the floor. My other complaint is the way they nickle and dime you for every silly thing - NOTHING is free, not the Interent, a bottle of water is $7.00, and a $.75 Kit Kat candy bar is $5.60. This is a turn off - they are not thinking of guest comfort as much as making as much $$$ off you as they can.. The overall ambience is a bit high-end sterile, but otherwise this is fine for a night or two. It is close to everything and very safe.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Westin but very business oriented”
Reviews.Author: jdjhughes
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on a "staycation". From the outside it doesn't offer much and feels more like a business tower than a hotel. The rooms and public spaces however are comfortable and elegant. The rooms are typical Westin but it you can secure a room on the south side of the tower overlooking the river you will have a great view and a larger room. Bathrooms nice as well. Great location right on the river and close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant. Heavenly!”
Reviews.Author: GlobeHop2006
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. It's elegant, efficient, spacious, clean, modern, and very well located just across the Chicago River from the Loop. The staff are exceptionally nice, the lobby restaurant/sushi-bar is cozy and reasonably priced, the rooms are tastefully decorated and clean, and of course the beds are great. For a mid-size business hotel, it really feels boutique-ish. Expect nice-size rooms and bathrooms, nice touches everywhere (like a personal computer in the room, oversize room safes, pleasant colors), and generally feeling very much at home. Even the hallways are warm and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: shaiks
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel with exceptional rooms. We were upgraded to the presidential floor for free. Kids really enjoyed the stay with TV,great room service and happy hour. The view of Chicago river was beautiful from your room. Close to everything Chicago stands for. Walking distance to Mag Mile, State St and a lot of well known restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Westin”
Reviews.Author: derrygerry
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights after getting a good deal on lastminute.com and honestly could not fault it in anyway, The staff were pleasent and courteous( the concierge in particular was helpful in booking us a river cruise), with check in swift and hassle free, we had a spacious partial river view room with an extremely comfortable bed and an excellent power shower , We were room only so cannot comment on the hotel food but Einstiens Bagels is only a block away and was very reasonable for breakfast. In terms of location we got a blue line train from terminal 3 at O'Hare straight into Park and Lake (about 45mins) and the hotel was only a 5minute walk away, about 10 minutes walks you to the mag mile one way and to the shops of North State Street the other ( Filenes, Old Navy, Macys etc ). The house of blues was just across the road which is a must see and there are plenty of bars and restaurants in close proximity

Reviews.Title: “LOVE this Westin!”
Reviews.Author: leetlesasa
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Westin for one night while tagging along on my boyfriends business meeting. We usually stay at Westins at this is definitely one of the nicer ones we have stayed at. The location can be pretty easy to miss due to construction but its fantastic (great for shopping) I forgot a pair of heels and the concierge directed us to Nordstrom just a few blocks away (and mapped it out for us) She said there was a Macy's and Filene's Basement in the opposite direction but I believe that was a few blocks further. The concierge also made a recommendation for a great Italian restaurant within walking distance (Coco Pazo) and made reservations for us as well. She's friendly but a little too chatty... The lobby is open to the restaurant/bar but the entire area gives off a trendy vibe. Check-in was quick, everyone was friendly and within just a few minutes we were in our suite. The suite (I forget which kind) was large - a wetbar area, living room/office, with seperate bedroom, and a huge bathroom. The entry way/wetbar had a wall of mirrors that led into the living room. There was ample seating (3 person couch, chair) flat panel tv, desk with Mac desktop and the room was so large it didnt feel cramped. The bedroom had a Kind bed, flat panel tv, seperate sitting area with chaise lounge and was still very roomy. The bedroom closet had more than enough hangers (I'm a stickler about this) The bathroom was HUGE - seperate stand shower, tub, but i do with there was a bit more counter space. There was more than enough towels in the bathroom and two bathrobes too. I absolutely love this Westin and hope we stay here again next time we're in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “True to Westin theme.”
Reviews.Author: purdueek
Reviews.Content: This is the second Westin we have stayed at, and I have been impressed so far. Got a great rate for the weekend, so the value was worth what we paid this time. Our room was on the 14th floor, lots of space (especially good for pack-in-play!), decent view, and quiet, clean room. Service was spot-on. While the location is within walking distance (about 12 minutes) to Michigan Ave, and other downtown shopping (and subway), businesses in immediate neighborhood do close early. Hotel restaurant kind of pricey (but aren't they all?), but good diversity, and even contains healthy food options. Parking pricey ($42 per 24 hours) - but not unexpected for a downtown location Would stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “was less than expected”
Reviews.Author: mmmaymo
Reviews.Content: the location is very good for shopping and dinner, don't expect a great reception, the executive lounge charge you for drinks-expensive is small, but is good for breakfast,

Reviews.Title: “Good central location and smart business hotel”
Reviews.Author: CharlieLouth
Reviews.Content: Good hotel - easy check-in, but when checking out there was only one receptionist who couldn't get away from the customer she was helping. Was there no-one she could have asked to come and assist on the desk? And the concierge and door man had disappeared when I went to find my driver. Room was very spacious, with a very comfortable bed. Water pressure in shower ok, but have known better. Not much choice on TV. The room and hotel were quiet, but the Chicago Fire and Ambulance service do like their sirens. Good central location next to the river and only a couple of minutes' walk from the metro from OHare. Only 20 minutes by car from (Saturday 6.30pm) or to (Monday 11am) the airport. Close to theatres, but a surprising lack of choice for diners nearby on a Saturday night. Even Arby's was shut. As for Sunday ...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect service, outstanding rooms”
Reviews.Author: RichB89600
Reviews.Content: We've been here before -- once for a conference, a few times on business. Now, we have our son living in Chicago, and, although he is a fair bit away, we still stay here. The people in this hotel are extremely accommodating, helpful and friendly. The location is great. The rooms are very clean and spacious. The beds are great.

Reviews.Title: “elegant beyond words!!”
Reviews.Author: meanny28
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here over valentine's weekend and were just amazed with the whole experience! The lobby was gorgeous, the front desk was very friendly, and I can't say enough about the room!! We stayed in a room with a "heavenly" bed (king-size), it was so comfortable! The bathroom was huge with a dual shower head and tub. Our view was directly in front of HOB's and the rivver was slightly to the right. The restaurants and nightlife around the area had great variety and within walking distance. I can't wait to come back!!

Reviews.Title: “Looks more 5 star than 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Jarno
Reviews.Content: I used to stay in Chicago pretty often on business, so I've seen many of the downtown hotels. I really thought I had stayed at a 5-star hotel when I stayed at the Westin. The room was really really nice, much larger than the Intercontinental or the Marriott that are nearby. I think I paid as much or more than I have at the Marriott or IC, but this time I thought I got more value for money. There really was nothing to complain about and my room had a wonderful view of the river. This place is still within very close distance of the theater district as well as the northern part of Michigan avenue.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! Best kept secret in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: mountainportal
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. It used to be the Nikko operated by Japan Airways and although it is redone it still has some of the high tech Oriental flair. The rooms overlook the city, river or both. The windows are glass walls with panoramic wide vistas of the city action below. The rooms are large,quiet with large bathrooms and magnificent showers. Breakfast is great. You can opt for a traditional American breakfast or order healthy spa selections. The staff and bellmen are friendly and helpful. Starwood hotels that now owns this property runs this place very well. They have special deals ,shopping and corporate rate specials. We found this place a great bargain in Chicago. The location is a 10 minute walk to Michigan Ave. shopping. A short taxi ride to Rush street, Soldier Field and Field Museum, The Art Institute. All of these places can be walked to if you are prone to enjoying long and interesting walks in the city. There are many fabulous restaurants in this part of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Rooms and Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: dublinlad25
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel in Chicago in a great location. Stayed there with my partner in April on our USA trip and definately would stay again. Location is downtown Chicago and close to all major sightseeing and shopping. The hotel facilities are excellent, clean, rooms are spacious, beds are just plain heaven, bathrooms and showers are just amazing and the staff is very friendly and helpful. Had a great room overlooking the river. Only let down was the breakfast. 40 dollars for two people is quite steep considering you get brekki in a lovley cafe just near to the hotel for half the price. Apart from this everything was just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! (Except for the breakfast)”
Reviews.Author: KandyKane056
Reviews.Content: It is in a very good location, close to Sears tower (about a mile), the Navy Pier (1/12 mile) close by the free trolley which you can take to go to the Navy Pier or to museums :) TClose to the business district and a quick ride to Old Town. The hotel is beautiful, super modern and sleek. We had a room on the 10th floor with an awesome view of the River. The bed was super comfy! I'm thinking to buy the mattress from the site. Big plasma TV, a nice longe chair to read by the window. The bathroom double shower, immaculate. The personnel was really nice and help us get orientated in Chicago. Since I was there for a conference I was not impressed with the continental breakfast they provided. Blah! But I went to their sushi bar, excellent! :) Probably the restaurant is better for breakfast. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Karch72
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after attending a wedding in the hotel. Overall, a positive experience. The rooms were fairly large, clean, and we were given a prime view of the Chicago River. The hotel's location is one of it's best assets. We were in walking distance of Millennium Park, Michigan Ave., and right across the street from the House of Blues. My only complaints are the $42 charge for overnight parking (I know it's downtown Chicago, but c'mon ... that's very high) and the not-so-heavenly bed (I've stayed at other Westins, and somehow this bed wasn't quite up to snuff).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Specials, Best way to see Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: mandjj
Reviews.Content: After searching for hours online for different hotels, the Westin made the most sense. So I called up the hotel directly instead of buying online, and wound up getting a great deal. Just ask about their specials... The woman that helped me book was wonderful, and made a note to upgrade my wife and I and treat us with VIP service... Sure enough when we arrived they did. We were upgraded to club member status, and were given a top level club suite. The view was slightly blocked by Marina City Towers (just across the street), but looking out the bedroom we could look down upon the Chicago River that banks on the hotel. The room was huge. It was a suite, so it was a combination of 2 rooms: a living room and a door into the bedroom on the other side. The living room was spacious with a couch and flat-panel TV, along with a bar and a desk/office area with a iMac computer with internet access (which was helpful in finding things to do). The bedroom was in the next room with a sexy chase lounge, a very comfortable bed, and a huge bathroom. The bed was so comfortable that I am now looking into buying one of them - which i believe the Westin claims to sell - or they just slap their name on them, anyway they are fantastic. The location, is probably one of the best features of this hotel, if your familiar with Chicago - this is right in the heart of the River North area, across the street from the House of Blues and Marina City Towers. Within walking to everything, you won't need to waive any taxis down, just pack a comfortable pair of shoes and enjoy the city!

Reviews.Title: “Overall Quite Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: CPT_DirtyPHIL
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 nights for business meetings. Overall Hotel was very nice. Only complaint was the meeting rooms downstairs for our company were very hot. After NUMEROUS complaints they finally managed to use the A.C. Stayed at Embassy Suites Downtown Lakefront for 3 additional nights...WESTIN was much nicer and elegant. Very good location also

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sheslyon
Reviews.Content: Very nice, classy hotel. All of the staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean, large and comfortable. Nice location. You must eat at Sullivan's when here - it is only a block away. I would stay here again in an instant.

Reviews.Title: “Am I being fired?”
Reviews.Author: Zista
Reviews.Content: I stay at Starwood properties constantly. I used to love the service, and I am one of those model customers - stay 30+ times per year, never complain, etc., but things are progressively deteriorating. My recent problems at the Westin River North are small, but continue the downward trend. 1. After staying at Starwood properties for close to 30 nights, I tried to use my points to book a personal stay - only to discover I had none. According to "customer service" all of my points were going to an airline, and they claimed I had authorized this. I asked for proof - a signed paper, an email form, anything - but they refused to provide any, and refused to give me my points back. 2. I originally was upgraded to a concierge level at every stay - once I corrected their mistake on the airline and began collecting actual Starwood points for real, those upgrades stopped. At the West River North, I was dropped down to the preferred level, and then to the regular level. For some reason, I stopped receiving the benefits that I had supposedly earned as a regular customer - free water, free internet, free health club access - all gone. 3. When I went to Westin's front desk to let them know about minor housekeeping issues - i.e., I didn't get a bottle of water, the soap was thrown away each night, and someone's used hair tie went from the floor into my back of hair supplies (ick). I was pretty nice about it - just "here's an FYI for your housekeeping staff." The attendant's response was to roll her eyes, tell me the water was the mini-bar's responsibility, and ask why I was complaining about the soap being thrown away. I had to ask whether they had ever heard of the environment in Chicago For those of you who wonder, take 100 rooms * 2 bars of soap per night * 365 days per year * the number of hotels in Chicago, and ask yourself if you want that in your water supply. I've stayed in hotels (including the Westin) enough to know they usually don't throw away the soap if the same person stays in the room. These aren't huge, and wouldn't be worth noting for a $100/night place. But given the obscene prices, and given the competition for valuable regular customers - surely they can do better?

Reviews.Title: “Great location, overall good”
Reviews.Author: jvspence
Reviews.Content: We were there in July on business. Room was well appointed being on the club level. While non-smoking I did notice a faint smell obviously from the previous visitor. Great location on the river and a very good breakfast served each day in the restaurant. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice downtown hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Mercedesbenz
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel alot. It was decorated very simply and elegantly. We were on the 3rd floor and did not have any special view, except for an office building across the street. There is alot of construction going on around the hotel and downtown in general. We had an issue with our shower but we didn't bother complaining about it. It was leaking and squirting out the sides. The shower head was also coming away from the wall. The caulking around the bathtub had some mold on it. It was difficult to see at first because the caulk was infact a black color (matched the black marble tiles). The only thing I did not like about this place was that it was extremely dark. The lobby area had very dim lighting and so did the rooms. But that is the style of the hotel. Our beds were very comfortable. I used the gym twice (there's a $10 fee). There was a good selection of equipment and it was clean. We had some drinks at the bar and some sushi one night. I wouldn't recommend eating/drinking at the hotel as they charge around 15% tax on any food/drink at the hotel, which would be the same in any hotel in Chicago. We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel either. There's an Einstein Bagel outside the hotel where we ate breakfast. There are lots of restaurants within a few minutes walk of the hotel. Room Service and Mini Bar was very expensive so we didn't use it. The front desk staff were friendly and even took off a charge for WI FI that my teenage son signed up for using his PSP without asking me. I appreciated that.
