The concierge staff were helpful with directions and helping us with dinner arrangements. Overall, we had a very pleasant stay at the Westin and would stay here again. If construction bothers you, check with the hotel beforehand because there was alot of construction going on right outside the hotel when we were there in July.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: picard8427
Reviews.Content: Check in was smooth, no PL mentioned. Even honoured my reqeust of a king size room without any questions. Got one facing north at the corner, so no river view. It's a problem as there is a new condo/building going up now, so there are tons of construction worker looking right into the room...so if that's not your thing then you will need to close the drapes often. Room itself is newly renovated (think most if not all rooms are). Tons of space, nice chaise and chairs (more than the usual 1 in other hotels), and a good desk/chair to work on. Of course, the heavenly bed and the works. Bathroom was also fantastic, marble everywhere, extra large soaker tub, double shower head, quiet Kohler toilet, shaving mirror with light, and large counter space and shelves for storage. Only down side to the room was 1)lotion is more runny than water, 2) dark hallway so the minibar was hard to use since you are in the dark, 3)terrbile corkscrew (buy one if you are going to drink wine often), and outrageous minibar charges ($5 for water). Service of everyone was great, even gave me late checkout. Concierge was a bit cold. Sushi bar in the lobby was good and reasonably priced. Free wireless internet also in the lobby so don't pay in the room. They try to sell you a drink but just politely refuse and surf away. Location is amazing, tons of (albeit pricey) restaurants around, 7-11 and Einsteins Bagel just up the street, and short walk to Brown/Red line and Michigan Ave and Blue line from O'Hare. It was also a very quiet hotel given it's size and business nature (even on weekedays). So if you get this hotel on your bid, start smiling

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Westin”
Reviews.Author: linc82
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin over 4th of July weekend for an anniversary trip/babymoon. I've traveled all over but never stayed at the Westin, and would highly recommend this property. We arrived around 11, checked in and were upgraded to a room with club level access (free continental breakfast, evening appetizers, and gym). The woman at the counter was lovely and really friendly. The room was great - the bed was indeed Heavenly, though I've seen more impressive bathrooms. We had a computer with free wireless in the room, but it didn't work, and I was charged for a call to the help desk. Small inconvenience, really, because there was also a computer in the club lounge. Breakfast was great- espresso machine, assorted juices, milk, cereal, hardboiled eggs, salted meats and cheeses, pastries and bagels, and fruit. The appetizers in the evening were less impressive, but still nice. The hotel has a great location right on the river - there are tons of great restaurants within a few blocks. We used the concierge George for restaurant reservations and architecture tour booking, and both were great. Overall, great room, excellent location, great staff. Would absolutely return.

Reviews.Title: “Will not return”
Reviews.Author: mcog
Reviews.Content: We are loyal Westin fans and Starwood members, but were terribly disappointed with this hotel. We booked online through hotel website and were asked if we cared to upgrade to Executive accommodation that included continental breakfast, internet, health club, etc. Foolishly, we did. When we arrived there was no valet to open doors or help with luggage. Nor was any other staff member willing to do more than watch us struggle in through revolving door,. The front desk staff informed us that they found two rooms in our name and were insistent that we pay for 2nd room since it was not canceled within the deadline. After much discussion we asked to speak with manager and they promised a call when he/she was available. Next they told us our room was not available and none on that level were cleaned as yet (3:30 PM). By 5:00 PM we settled for a 2-double bed instead of king room so we could change in time for dinner reservations. Never heard from manager. For the following two days endured terrible service and were happy to leave. At check out we again inquired about extra room charge and were told it was taken care of, but we'll see. Definitely not up to Westin standards.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Krissy31
Reviews.Content: My husband and I live in the Chicago burbs and wanted to book a weekend to get away downtown. We've stayed in several Chicago hotels over the years, the Westin River North is at the top of the list. Next time we stay downtown, this will be the first hotel we will try to book. We used our Starwood points, so our 2-night stay was free. So I can't really comment on the price. However, here's a good tip: Don't valet. It's $41 a night (plus tip). There are parking garages all over the place in that area. We kept our car at a garage a half block away - it was $35 for 2 nights. Other comments on the hotel: - The location was stellar. There are so many restaurants/attractions you can walk to that I can't begin to list them. Anytime we wanted to get a cab, the bell staff just waved and it was there waiting for us. - The lobby is beautiful and very inviting for drinks. There is an onsite sushi bar in the bar - you can just order up some sushi with your drinks - very nice. - The room service was very speedy (dinner [sushi] took 25 mins, breakfast 20 mins) and delicious. There is 24 hour room service. - Check-in was fast and the staff was very friendly. We used the concierge as well as the bell staff and everyone seemed happy and was very helpful. - As other Westin hotels, the "heavenly bed" was a real treat - as was the deluxe shower. - We didn't pay for or ask for a River view, but got a partial River view that was delightful. The only negative thing I could think of was our TV was a bit on the fritz. We ordered a movie one night and the movie kept turning off and returning us to regular television. This was really aggravating, but we were credited for the movie. This hotel is highly recommended, you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings!”
Reviews.Author: na07950
Reviews.Content: I'm just back from a four night stay at the Westin, as part of a conference, and have mixed feelings about the hotel. The room itself was nice; usual size, comfortable bed, flat screen tv. As others have mentioned, they charge to use the fitness center, which seems over the top for their usual rates. The room service dinner I had one night was fine (but it was just a chicken caesar salad) and it arrived very quickly. I had breakfast in their restaurant one morning and it was ok .... and around $20. This is definitely not the place to stay if you're in Chicago on vacation. It's a bit of a walk to Michigan Avenue and while there are some restaurants in the area, nothing is very close. It was fine for the conference since the shuttle bus picked us up every morning and brought us to the convention center. The staff was inconsistent. Sometimes there were too many bellman in the front, and other times none (yesterday when we left, nobody was there for about 10 minutes and we got our own cab to the airport). The maid service was very inconsistent. I guess I'd recommend it if you had business in the area or are in town for a conference.

Reviews.Title: “Only thing going is location”
Reviews.Author: taveler1234
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a prime location, but the hotel does not add up to the quality of the location, the room was just O.K. the restaurant was not good at all for the money, the food was sub par, the flavors on the dishes did not work well and not taste good, the waitstaff is horrible, did not see any management to discuss it with, this is probably a hotel that I see is poorly managed, to give this kind of food.This happens a lot in hotels, that is why hotel restaurants have a bad name, I also attende a banquet here and the food tasted badly, it was like they do not care.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay at the Westin River North!”
Reviews.Author: Lifefabric
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I were very impressed with the room, staff, and lobby at the Westin River North. Our room was very spacious, had a great view with a chase lounger to enjoy it, had a very nice bathroom (the dual shower heads in the bath were a definitely plus), and the flat-panel TV was great too. Also, our check-in experience was quick and the woman was friendly and professional. Finally, the location was perfect for us as tourists! Very nice walks along the river, and we ambled over to a great place for dinner, Shaw's Crab House. Our great experience at the Westin was in stark contrast to the terrible experience at the Palmer House Hilton the night before (we switched hotels b/c of bad planning, but now we're glad we did make the move to the Westin!).

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: DocmomBoston_MA
Reviews.Content: A colleague and I stayed for 4 nights at the Westin River North for a meeting at the convention center. For comparison, I stayed at the Hyatt McCormick Place last year for a similar convention and promised myself that I wouldn't do that again--the convention center is in the middle of nowhere in Chicago. The Westin River North is very conveniently located by the river--less than 20 minutes by shuttle to the convention center and a 5 minute walk to the Magnificent Mile. Had a nice partial view of the river. If you're in Chicago primarily for shopping, though, it's probably a better idea to stay on or right off the Magnificent Mile. Pros: Heavenly Bed and Bath. Wow. Even if the hotel room were in an alley, I would happily stay there. Smoke-free hotel is nice. Wireless internet free in the lobby. Cons: Use of the fitness center requires an extra fee. If the price is almost $400 a night, this should be included. Also, no free internet in the rooms. Also--the toiletries were average. The W has Bliss products and the nearby Hotel James offered Kiehl's products Overall: based on the location, cleanliness and the Heavenly Bed and Bath, I would definitely stay here again while in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best SPG Property In Town!”
Reviews.Author: Doraemon79
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this lovely property during the memorial day weekend. The hotel occupency rates were low so got upgraded to a nice 1 BR Suite upon arrival. The room is spacious, clean, and comfortable. The hotel is situated right next to the river so some of the rooms will have a view of the river. The hotel has 20 floors where the top 4 floors are the executive floors where they have free Wired internet access and iMac to use in room (this is one of the coolest thing I found at this property, not even W offers that). The room features typical Westin Heavenly Bed, Heavenly Shower and 37" LCD TV. The hotel has an executive lounge located on the 20th floor for guests staying at the club level. I think it is worth to stay at the club level if you are trying to save few bucks on breakfast n etc. They do have a nice selection of contiental breakfast & evening cocktails and I do love the way they decorate their lounge. You can just sit there and enjoy the river view on a quiet day., very nice! The hotel has a fully equipped gym (very nice), no swimming pool (oh wells), and they have a nice japanese restaurant on site (hana lounge) where you can order it from your room as well. The check in agents were friendly and eager to help, so does bell desk and concierge desk lady provided lots ideas on where to go/eat/shop..etc. Very helpful! The hotel is 5 minutes easy walk to the nearest subway station ( Clark / Lake) and its right across from the house of blues and Harry Carrey (sp?) restaurant which serves great steak, close to the Michigan Ave for those who likes to shop. I just have too many great things to say for this property, I would definitely refer and stay at this property again when I go back to Chicago

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dash1_98
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at The Westin Chicago River North May 23-26 for the long Memorial Day Weekend. We got a great rate of $152.00 per night. The Hotel upgraded us to a river-view room becasue it was our wedding anniversary. The location was ideal -- a few blocks from the Michigan Ave shopping, the Loop shopping, right on the river. Subway is three blocks away. Buses are nearby. Bin 36 across the street was great for breakfast, drinks and a light dinner. Conceirage was great. Overall great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Room, & Service”
Reviews.Author: carolineee77
Reviews.Content: Booked a king room with Starwood Points (16K/night) and asked for a room with a river view at check in. They put us in a corner, river view king on the 9th floor - spectacular view, bed, bath, the whole works! I really like that they fine anyone who even attempts to smoke in a room - you know you're getting a comfortable and clean room at Westin. Lobby is elegant but we did not take advantage of either the bar or the restaurant. The concierge was not available in the evening, but the front desk staff did their best to help w/ restaurant recommendations and directions. Hotel is only 2 blocks from the Magnificent Mile - we cabbed to our restaurant (Coco Pazzo Cafe - so-so food and ambiance), then walked back to the hotel to take in the sights. Only downside was $41/night valet parking - don't know what any alternatives for that are.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms, great service and location!”
Reviews.Author: SallyGirl81
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin just for the weekend, and found that the hotel served its purpose for a weekend getaway. I arrived early, at 10:30am, and front desk checked me in right away even though check in was around 3:00! Awesome overall service, valet brought our car quickly at check out, and even allowed us to keep our car in the garage a couple of extra hours after checking out. The rooms and bathrooms were big and really comfortable (dual shower heads in bath, down comforters, flat screen tvs) and offered great views of the river. Safety deposit box was in the closet, free of charge. Lobby was super modern and spacious. I didn't really spend any time at the hotel to see what else was on the property, but I did see a business center available to guests, most likely for a fee. Getting a cab from the front entrance was not a problem at all. Breakfast was available for around $19, which I did not purchase because I went out to eat, but there was an in-room mini bar with snacks and coffee. I've stayed at the Hyatt and Crowne Plaza in downtown, and if the prices were the same, I'd probably stay at them or Westin on Michigan Ave ONLY for the sake of saving a couple blocks walking distance to the Magnificent Mile.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: KGM77
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin River North for a long weekend in April 2008. Booked via Expedia for a very reasonable price and thoroughly enjoyed the hotel and Chicago. Room was standard for a Westin with the excellent Heavenly bed. Had a partial River view. The location, whilst probably not as good as the other Westin at the top of the Magnificent Mile is still very good and on the Chicago River. Hotel staff from bellhops to the concierge were excellent (managed to find me reasonable tickets to the Cubs at 1 hr notice) and the bar was nice, although we didn't get a chance to try the in-house sushi chef. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased With This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PAQ
Reviews.Content: First time staying at this hotel, although I stay at Westins regularly. Very pleased with location, check in, concierge, lobby, fast elevators, fitness center, and view of the river. Club loung was large with excellent selection of breakfast food. Room was average size but nicely decorated. Limited tv station selection. $275 per night was reasonable. Will stay here again rather than the Westin on Michigan Ave. or the Sheraton on the river.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: BartD
Reviews.Content: As a frequent Chicago visitor our weekend visit was made better by great accommodations. When checking in I asked for a room at the end of the hall with a river view. We were given a great room, with a great view as requested. It was quiet and oh so comfortable with the special Westin beds. Please note North facing rooms have new high rise construction and should expect noise. I'd return to this hotel again. Breakfast in the hotel is very good and a relative value compared to other hotels and neighborhood options. We saw no children at this hotel during our stay, if that matters. Safe, clean and fairly convenient self-parking is available a short walk away at State and Kenzie, w/ a Hertz agency at street level.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Philch1
Reviews.Content: There are 2 Westin hotels in Chicago. Both are in good locations, but I think the River North is better if you are a tourist because it is more central. You can easily get to the Magnificent Mile and the shops by the Wrigley building and NBC studio. We had a large room on the 15th floor with views of the river. The room and bathroom were very clean, and in good condition. The beds were comfortable and the room was nicely decorated. The bathroom was huge - one of the biggest I have ever seen in a hotel. No problems with noise - either from traffic outside or guests in other rooms. You do have to pay for the gym, and it looked quite basic - I would have expected it to be free. There is free wireless internet in the lobby, but the staff said it only worked with Windows XP - not Vista. I complained about this, and they gave me free internet in my room instead. The hotel is walking distance from public transport (bus stops and trains).

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Westin!”
Reviews.Author: Bigtings
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin River North for 3 days the first week of April. The hotel itself is top-notch - every single staff member we encountered from front desk, concierge, doorman, valet, housekeeping was courteous and friendly. The hotel is beautiful, trendy and well-maintained. On receiving our room with a view of the city, we requested a room with a river view. Almost immediately, the change was made. The Westin is walking distance/short taxi ride away from so many attractions - Millenium Park, Michigan Ave, Grant Park, John Hancock, Lakeshore Drive - we walked to all these places and because of the scenic routes and streets, it didn't matter that there were maybe 12-15 blocks away. The hotel overlooks the Chicago river and on ground level, you can take great shots of the skyline and surrounding buildings. A pleasurable experience for a romantic getaway making the trip to Chicago all the more memorable. Highly recommend the Westin!

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jbnb00
Reviews.Content: My husband and I syated at the Westin river north for my birthday over Easter weekend. We took a taxi from the airport which was $35.00. We were allowed to check in early. We had a great room on the 5th floor that overlooked the river and downtown Chicago. Many restaurants and bars right down the street. We definitely didn't need a car. We went to see "Wicked " which was a 5 minute walk from the hotel. House of Blues also right across the street. The hotel staff was very friendly and professional. The concierge, George, was very helpful and made our trip to Chicago even more enjoyable. We really liked it here and are planning a summer trip back to this Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Chicago River North is Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: ChicagolandKari
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location close to several upscale restaurants and across the street from the House of Blues. It was professionally run, extremely clean, and very comfortable. Feather pillows and duvay, lighted magnifying mirror in the bathroom, and a nice chaise lounge chair in front of the window to take in the view. Several self-parking garages nearby that were reasonably priced for a Saturday night stay. Had a great visit. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: blondie7197
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin River North over President's weekend. The hotel is in an excellent location - about 2 blocks off Michigan Ave. I got a great deal on Westin's website - $159 a night with parking included. Parking was $41 every 24 hours and this is something you cannot avoid if you drive to Chicago. Several of the hotels I looked at had the same type of deal. When I checked in, the gentleman at the front desk said that I had only booked the parking package for one night (which I didn't!) I showed him my confirmation and he assured me he would fix it in the computer. Unfortunately, when we checked out, our bill was $200 more than it should have been! No worries though, they immediately fixed it...just make sure you check your bill. The hotel itself is lovely and we had a really nice view. I would stay here again if and when we return to Chicago. The bed was comfy and the room was clean. We had our small dog with us and they were very accomodating. We usually prefer Starwood properties because many are pet friendly. All in all a great weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, but not very well run”
Reviews.Author: astronomer-at-large
Reviews.Content: First Westin I've used in the US. We had a few Starwood points to use but not enough for our whole stay, so had to make 2 bookings for consecutive periods; we emailed the hotel to tell them we were combining them to make a continuous stay. All a waste of effort: they had not linked the reservations, and we had to change keys at the change-over point after 3 days, and we also got an unwanted bill under the door on that day. Receptionists were friendly whereas I would have preferred competent. Room was fairly good, but maintenance poor: basin waste annoyingly slow to empty, one room light not working throughout our stay. Phone calls ridiculously expensive, even $2 for each call to a 1-800 number. Wifi worked, but not free. TV remote had terrible user interface, designed to make free TV channels extremely hard to find. Obviously designed for those on an expense account, not ideal for tourists. On the other hand, good location, 2 blocks from elevated railway and underground trains. Bin36 restaurant across the street is good, we didn't try meals in the Westin except for breakfasts, which were fairly good and reasonable value at $13 for continental buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Best Westin”
Reviews.Author: SBCCA
Reviews.Content: This is the best Westin I've stayed in in the US. Everything has been professional. Room was ready early. Front desk quick and responsive. Upgraded to deluxe room on 12th floor overlooking the Chicago River. Hors d'oeuvres were tasty. Excellent croissants and fresh fruit in Executive Lounge for breakfast. Concierge friendly, responsive, and most helpful...researched a question and got back to me in my room. Everything works. Just the kind of experience I wanted for my overnight in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here, if you want to feel like a King/Queen”
Reviews.Author: NYTraveler05
Reviews.Content: I just came back from Chicago, and I had a great time. I am a female single traveler, who always looks for things to do around or near the hotel. Can I just be honest, when you step out of the hotel to the right or left there are several restaruants, clubs, shops, malls, and even if you have to travel, a cab fare is not bad. The hotel had comfortable beds, clean bathroom, the room is quite spacious, and to top it off the view was not bad. I ordered room service, and I thought I was in heaven when I had breakfast. But please go out to dine, for you will get to experience Chicago for its jazz, southern, and steak/ribs. I have nothing bad to say, but I will greatly book a room on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Update since my last stay”
Reviews.Author: emdoc
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 5 night stay while attending a conference at this hotel. I had also stayed here about a year ago so it gave me a chance to compare my two stays. Like last year, the staff was pleasant and my room was clean. I only have 2 complaints: 1. The hot water in the morning was sporadic. Getting blasts of cold water followed by warm water was not my idea of a good shower but it certainly woke me up. 2. Despite hangin the "Peace" sign on my door, the cleaning staff came in to my room twice. I appreciate the service but I didn't want it. Except for the above 2 complaints, my overall stay was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations by far”
Reviews.Author: PigsEar1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here between Xmas & New Year in an Executive Floor Room. This room represented excellent value for money as we got a reasonable continental breakfast every morning, canapes from 5 - 7pm and soft drinks available all day until 9pm at night. The room itself was modern and clean with a view of the Sears Tower and down the river. There were some small but quirky nice touches such as chocs at turndown with some kind of orange essential oil to aid sleep and on New years Eve, we came back in the afternoon to two bottles of water by the bed with two packets of Alka Seltzer (fortunately we didn't need them!). The staff in Exec Lounge, Reception and Concierge were friendly, polite, professional and helpful without being over the top. We ate in the Ember Grille (hotel restaurant) one night. The food was good but the portions were huge which was a bit offputting if you're a small eater. It was empty so the ambience was a bit weird but the service great. The location of the hotel is great - 5 mins walk from the El, 10 - 15 mins walk from the Magnificent Mile, 15 mins walk from Sears Tower, 40mins walk from the Shedd Aquarium & Field Museum (you can get the El too but we wanted to walk through Millennium Park which is definitely worth a look). There are lots of good places to eat close by, particularly if you like meat, however, if you are veggie, the choices are limited (fairly common in US). Bin 36 which is right next door to the hotel was so good we went twice and you MUST try a cheese flight which is fab as a starter. We also ate at an Italian called Maggianos which was 5 mins walk away and was also amazing. The atmosphere was good and the food even better. the portions are massive again so prob best to get a whole serving between 2 (Half serving's available too). Their home baked lemon cookies are lovely also. It's prob best to book as it was packed every night. We would ddefinitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Stay in a comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: PAOPAOFlorida
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Westin River North quite a bit. This hotel is very comfortable and quiet and in a great location. The hotel itself doesn't offer much in the way of dining, but the lobby lounge is large and comfortable. Within 1 block, you've got Harry Caray's, Sullivan's, and Bin 36 for drinking/dining. The Hotel Sax is across the street, and it has a new lounge, Crimson, that's worth a look. Within easy walking distance you've got excellent restaurants, including Frontera Grill. Also within relatively easy walking distance to Nordstrom and Michigan Ave. shopping. Like most Westin hotels, the rooms are modern, attractive, and comfortable. Ask for a River view room. The concierge is usually very helpful, and they have running maps.

Reviews.Title: “Nice to stay at during a snowstorm”
Reviews.Author: lilacs109
Reviews.Content: We booked this through priceline and were very happy with our stay. We came during a snowstorm and chicago is just beautiful and gorgeous at that time of the year. We explored chicago and saw the blues (Blue Chicago), the museums, Navy pier, etc. Hotel is luxury class for us and worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for a modern big city stay”
Reviews.Author: happytracks
Reviews.Content: We found everything to be true that the last two reviewers stated. The concierges in particular were very helpful, printing out info on places outside the city to explore. In fact I noticed that everyone we met in Chicago seemed to be so very friendly and helpful. We were upgrade when we checked in (at 12:30 am) to a "Club Privleges" room on the 20th floor and so we got the free continental breakfast and snacks. Very good! Our room was spacious and up-to-date. Very sleek. We had a great view of the marina building and the river. We loved it! We got the stay 2 nights, get the third night free deal, so the cost for a 4 star was the same as other lesser hotels. We moved to the Comfort Inn and Suites after three nights since the cost of our room would jump to $400-$500 a night (convention demand). That was quite a let down! We loved the restaurant across the street from the Westin...Bin 36. It was really reasonable relative to dinner houses in Chicago. We splurged at Smith and Wollensky, which is also next to the Marina. It was just okay...but pretty pricey. The Westin River North is worth the splurge, if you're not accustomed to spending loads on a hotel. And if you can get a good price, definately book it!

Reviews.Title: “Westin Experience”
Reviews.Author: gnolect
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for our anniversary. SPG Gold got us upgraded to"executive level" on the 23rd floor. Room was everything I would expect from Westin, clean, comfortable, modern, but not plushy. Room decor is simple, and plain but very nice. Bathroom was oversized and easy to work in. There was a Mac on the desk pre-configured to open to a Chicago Travel site though you could surf without restriction, check email, run AIM, etc. I liked that! Executive level offered free morning breakfast and afternoon snacks but drinks were expensive so it worked out even and that's fine. Location was great. Easy walk to everything. It is next door to the famous Marina City condos and it is across from more steakhouses than you can shake a cow at!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bobie
Reviews.Content: Girls getaway weekend - everything was excellent. Staff went out of their way to assist us with everything - shopping, dining, directions, etc. Rooms were clean, well appointed and we enjoyed nightly chocolates and having the beds turned down. Computer in the room helped us to locate attractions and also book tickets for boat cruise and show. Manuel even took pictures of us all for a birthday celebration. Executive lounge lovely, breakfast perfect, fresh fruit daily, fresh squeezed orange juice, etc. staff, in particular Kwasi, were very helpful and pleasant. The 5 Canadian Shopping Bags

Reviews.Title: “beware the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: mark_the_chocky_guy
Reviews.Content: i had to be in chicago for business and the whole city was booked out. Having left my booking till late, i found the prices were out of control! i searched pricline and found two choices - a 2 star hotel and the westin north river - for the same price! i chose the westin, but i was very concerned because of the bad reviews i read - especially highlighting poor service the reviewers had received. I can only say that those people must have picked the one day of the year that the service was less than exemplary. The location was fantastic, the room excellent and the service peerless. Upon checkin i was automatically upgrade and given complementary breakfast the concierge organised a tour for me and followed up to see if i enjoyed it. The only downside was that i found out that all Westins in North America are now non-smoking, but that too was a good thing as i had a great stay AND cut down at the same time. i mentioned the poor reviews to the staff as i was leaving and told them how wrong the reviews were - they were really upset that some guests had not enjoyed the hotel. While the price at the time was high (but still the same as a two star property was advertising) i will definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent property with two issues”
Reviews.Author: upintheair-OMA
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times and agree with other reviews regarding the excellent location and quality of the hotel property. I have only two negative comments regarding my most recent stay (ending today): As far as breakfast in the hotel is concerned you have the option of a limited pastry and fruit buffet or ordering from the menu. My first morning there I ordered from the menu and had a nice breakfast (four moderately sized slices of French toast, two sausage links, hash browns, juice and coffee) but it cost me $30. One has to leave the hotel to find other options which, given the great location, isn't a problem..one just needs to know that this is the situation. Secondly, and more irritating, is the fact that the hotel has no readily available kiosk for advance online airline check-in and printing of boarding passes. There are several "booths" where one can access the internet 24-7 but this is charged to your credit card at 50 cents a minute. This morning I walked to a another nearby hotel where I easily found a kiosk and printed out my travel documents. Beyond these issues this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A flawless stay”
Reviews.Author: brianhh
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Westin Chicago River North for 5 nights and thoroughly enjoyed it. The concierge was very helpful, the room was very nice and as expected, the Heavenly Bed and Heavenly Shower were excellent. I can't comment on the quality of food from room service or the on-site restaurants because we never partook. This Westin is located in the heart of the River North area of Chicago, which is home to a number of fantastic restaurants. It's a foodie's paradise. The location was perfect for our sight-seeing, we were able to comfortably walk to the Magnificent Mile, Navy Pier, the Art Institute, and the Sears Tower. We will definitely stay there again the next time we're in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: cliff_rock
Reviews.Content: Very much enjoyed a stay in a 16th floor river view room. Great views of pleasure boats along the river as well as sailboats in the lake to the south and east. The room is great, what you'd expect from Westin. Decent size, comfortable layout. Great bedding, towels, and bath products. Did not have a separate tub and shower. Nice HD flat screen TV. Apple computer in the room. The lobby is warm and comfortable. Excellent location. Had good service all around, I would not hesitate to recommend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Egregious Front Desk Staff”
Reviews.Author: KimberlyQ
Reviews.Content: OK, let me warn you--this is a bit of a rant. I am a Starwood Platinum member who travels a lot. Typically I stay at W's, Westins and Sheratons. Geographically, this hotel is well-located and some of the rooms have nice views of the river. However , I digress . . . Usually, when in Chicago, I stay at the W Lakeshore, but I tried out the Westin Chicago River North because of the high ratings on this site as well as its proximity to the Chicago office of the company I joined a couple of months ago. Upon arrival, the person who was checking me in at reception answered the phone and, after a moment, actually rolled his eyes (not to me in a wink-wink conspiratorial way, just in general pissed off) while he was speaking to the guest who was calling. (I figured my front desk friend was just having a bad day.) Later, I found out that my flustered friend only programmed one of my two cardkeys, so I had to go back to reception after going to dinner. Since I was there, I thought I would do the hotel a favor and mention the incident that occurred earlier, as I'd think most hotels would want their staff members to be polite when working the front desk. Thus, I waited for the on-duty front desk manager, William, to end a phone call he was on. The call seemed to go on for a bit, and it became apparent that the guest on the other end was clearly not happy with his/her accommodations for some reason. I was pretty surprised when I heard William raise his voice to almost shouting level and say to the guest, "No, I will *not* reduce your rate!!!" His outrage was quite obvious to all of us waiting for service, as he flailed his free hand and scrunched up his face. Upon hanging up, he turned to his staff and said quite dramatically, "Send housekeeping to Room [insert room number here]." One of them asked "Is he checking out early?" William retorted "Yes!!!" Then, he turned to we waiting guests and said very pointedly and loudly "And if any of *you* are thinking about checking out early, let me just tell you there is not one room left in the city tonight!!!" I realized then where the guy who checked me in got his training. I told William that I found his behavior to be quite unprofessional, especially as a manager, and he said "How dare you--you don't even *know* me!" I replied "Of course I don't know you; it's merely my impression as a guest in this hotel who observed you shouting at someone on the phone from behind the front desk where everyone could see and hear you. And then to be brought into it!" He just rolled his eyes at me and crossed his arms and said something like "Whatever!" I finally got back to my room and called Starwood Preferred Guest hoping I could switch hotels, but William was right about things being booked up. Suffice it to say, I will never stay at that hotel again, and I'll warn anyone who broaches the idea away from it.

Reviews.Title: “A nearly perfect stay - but read on for details...”
Reviews.Author: Road_warrior_123
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with the location of this hotel for a visit to Chicago. It is central to all the key tourist and business sites. We could walk everywhere we needed to go. Also was impressed with our comfortable and clean room. The heavenly bed, flat panel TV and granite bathroom are the highlights. The housekeeping staff was incredibly courteous and conscientious. Check-in was efficient. Valets and bell staff were helpful. It would have been a perfect stay had the concierge and understaffed lounge area not threaten to undermine the perfect stay. The gentleman at the concierge desk did not slow down enough to listen to my query - he just assumed he knew my question would be the same as the other guests. He cut me off before I could finish my question and was unable to provide adequate assistance as a result. Also the lounge area was so severely understaffed that it was chaotic and we did not even get to place an order. Customers were getting up from their seats to hail waiters and waitresses to order, to get their tabs or for refills. I advise you try other bars or lounges in the area instead. There are many unique hangouts. Or just use room service. Overall this is a great hotel in the four star hotel range. Would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...IMac in the room”
Reviews.Author: Nofibgb
Reviews.Content: Room was very large...not sure if they all are as I think they upgraded us to Club level. Had separate bedroom with large bath. IMac in the room with free internet and two LCD tvs was nice touch. Location was great...very clean, beds are always great. Definitely will return

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BillDen
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. I would give it a 4.5 rating. The location is great. It is close to most of downtown's best attractions and is right on the river. It is right across the street from Harray Caray's restaurant and close to the "L" train stop. There is construction going on right next door; however, there isn't a lot of noise. The rooms were great with excellent bathrooms. The beds were wonderful and the flat screen lcd tv's were a nice touch. The service was impecable by the staff; however, the concierge on one of the nights didn't fit into this category. Parking is around $38 per night which is what you would expect in a city like Chicago. Overall, I would certainly stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Hotel”
Reviews.Author: donnamay
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd stay at this hotel and I would definitely return. The lobby is beautifully chic. The room itself is in excellent condition- everything clean and modern- and fairly large. The bed was extremely comfortable. The bathroom was really nice..marble..and included user-friendly touches like shelves to the side to put your toiletries so the sink isn't cluttered...and a large separate make-up mirror. The hotel is in a good location near many restaurants but the room itself was quiet - I am a very light sleeper and didn't hear a sound. (requested water view). All in all a 5 star experience- highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel - beware construction noise”
Reviews.Author: chrisd
Reviews.Content: May 2, 2007. FYI - I stayed on the concierge level of the hotel. The room was spacious, clean and well appointed with its town Apple computer (fyi not sure it the hotel deletes the interenet histories on the computer prior to every guest checking in...something to consider,,I did it just prior to leaving), desk, sofa and separate bedroom. The continental breakfast on this level met my needs with lots of fresh fruit (no hot items though). I loved the location which was in close proximity to great restaurants, blues clubs (Blue Chicago - the genuine article (i.e. not fancy was my favorite) and great nightlife. I used the fitness center and was very happy with that. If you are sensitive to noise or going on vacation you may want to stay away from the rooms at the end of the hallway that face construction of the new hi-rise that is being built (i.e. rooms that end in 04, 03, 01 and 02 on the corner) They have just broken ground, so the noise will go on for quite some time. I was there on business, bought a small fan at a drugstore and this made it much more tolerable. The staff here was friendly and very professional and I would definitely stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: carlawingo
Reviews.Content: this hotel was magnificent, right from the beginning the valet taking our car was wonderful, pointed us in the right direction to our dinner reservations later that evening as well as how to walk to the Art Institute. check in was smooth, room was available for early check in at 10am with no problem. Location cannot be beat, only a mile to museums, restuarants and night life all around, only a $4 cab ride to theaters (who can walk in heels?), staff very helpful. Must relay the most telling incident-my husband woke up at 4am with terrible pain, we grabbed our belongings and headed to the desk to find out directions to the nearest hospital. Ingrid at the desk was most helpful, and the front office manager even called later that day to check on my husband. they were professional, curteous and caring during a stressful situation with out-of-town guests who were not sure where to go. Thanks again Westin River North for everything!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SouthFLTraveler
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel (April 25-28, 2007) for a convention. My room was on the 11th floor and overlooked the Chicago River. While the weather wasnâ€™t great (cold and rainy) the hotel was wonderful. The front desk staff was great, offering me an upgrade due to being a Starwood Frequent Guest member. The room had plenty of room and was very comfortable. I really cannot say anything bad about the hotel. It is within walking distance to Michigan Avenue and directly across the street from the Chicago House and Blues and Harry Careyâ€™s Restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fan2006
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. Convenient walk to Michigan avenue. Clean room.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: NP18
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the Westin Chicago River North where we were attending a conference. We had decided to stay 'on-site' to save travelling to and from. We had considered attractive hotels like the Mandarin Oriental or the Peninsular but the thought of not having to hail cabs in the rushhour won the day. The experience was excellent and I would have no hesitation in staying there again. Their attention to detail surpassed many 5 star hotels that we've stayed at before. How often do maids who service rooms omit little things like not thoroughly replacing bathrooms items (nearly empty boxes of tissues etc). How often do guests wait ages before housekeeping/ reception etc answer the phone/ act upon the request? Or bellhops who almost count the tip before they leave? The Westin (maybe I should say THIS Westin!?) must score almost a 10. The phone is answered within a few rings, my queries were delt with courteously, the bellhops never (seemed) to expect a tip and showed appreciation at the gesture. Our request for more coat hangers/ help with luggage were responded to almost instantly! We pointed out an oversight at breakfast and the problem was immediately corrected- not often does one 'complain' and the solution is an improvement on the origional! The hotel is clean; their 'Heavenly' beds were only OK, nice to have decent coffee facilities in-room (Starbucks) and reception were most helpful in meeting my request for a higher floored room. To be trueful, I had lower expectations for Westin hotels but this one has been a very good advertisment for the group.

Reviews.Title: “a very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Mrstevewarsaw
Reviews.Content: Took a one-day trip on Superbowl Sunday to Chicago with my friend who is a huge bears fan. Booked last minute through spg.com and got a very decent rate for one night with a 4 o'clock checkout. Have been to the Sheraton four-points twice before but never to the Westin. Found this hotel to be very nice in all areas. The room was clean and spacious with a river view. The location was outstanding for bar-hopping on super sunday. Having many choices within a block or two was especially important as the outside temperature was -2 WITHOUT the wind chill. The only complaint was that the hotel did not seem to have any promotions for the Bears/superbowl in the bar area which was empty 1 hour before kickoff. I don't smoke personally, but maybe the non-smoking in the lounge hurt them in this area, as all other bar/restaurants were PACKED the whole day. After reading some of the other reviews we regret not checking out the house of blues bar accross the street, and looking for alternate parking as it was a bit high at 38$ per day. Overall would stay again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “business travel”
Reviews.Author: wi_light_sleepers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a business meeting, and it was very convenient to the loop. Many excellent restaurants nearby. The bed was great, the room was very clean and well appointed. Nice tv, but the remote didn't work. Fitness center was nice and not terribly busy, but cost an extra $10 per day--if we hadn't eaten so well I might have forgone its use. Staff varied from a bit aloof (front desk) to very helpful (bell boy, valets, maids). I lost a glove but they didn't really seem to want to look for it. I would stay there again, especially if the rates were good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view...”
Reviews.Author: JDSeattle
Reviews.Content: I found this to be an average hotel - check in not overly-friendly, concierge very friendly, the room was large (nice office area with large desk and working space), great view of the river, and average amenities. Great location for walking around the city and seeing the sites. Breakfast was very good in the cafe. Room service was "ok"...nothing special. Probably would stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location...”
Reviews.Author: dmgmd
Reviews.Content: I live in the Chicago suburbs but stayed at the Westin for a meeting. I was happy that I had read Tripadvisor first to know that they rooms with flatscreen TV's. Though that type of room was not available, I was given Executive Lounge access instead which turned out to be great because they had free WiFi access up there so I didn't have to spend $11 for internet in my room. My room was lovely and immaculate, no signs of peeling wallpaper etc mentioned in another review. The bed lived up to its name of being "heavenly" in appearance and comfort. The bathroom was large and very nicely appointed, though I don't think the showerheads are that special. My room had a partial river view which was very nice. Front desk and car valet were fine. I ate three meals at the hotel as part of the meeting; all were good, not great. The location of the hotel is truly excellent. You can walk to many place of interest including the Loop, theater district, Millenium Park (which I did), North Michigan Avenue, and all the restaurants in River North. I would highly reccommend the Westin River North for a wekend getaway so you can be close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, reasonable staff, pretty standard room”
Reviews.Author: DenverBrian
Reviews.Content: This property benefits from a great central location on the Chicago River, with plenty of shopping and restaurants within walking distance. Staff is generally competent and friendly. The decor is a bit skewed towards the W side of Starwood's portfolio - it's a 1970's vintage era hotel that has been refurbed in a kind of retro/chic way to appeal to the 25-35 target market. Rooms are fairly standard, and as others have noted, the overall light levels are low in the rooms. The Heavenly Bed is present and comfortable, but lamps are a bit dusty, and the minibar console in my room was missing an inset panel. Bathrooms include tub/shower combos with curved shower rods that are sagging due to improper installation. There is an odd double showerhead that is oversized for the tub/shower enclosure and I can't imagine most people successfully using both showerheads at the same time. Toilet seats and lids are plastic and yellowing with age against the white porcelain bowl. The frameless mirror hides fluorescent lights that don't light one's face very well. A massive armoire encloses a 20" TV in a space that could easily accommodate a 32" regular TV or a 36" widescreen flat panel. The desk is large but the desk chair is tiny and straight-backed, digging into one's backbone like a small torture device. The closet is enclosed but not lighted insde. My room had several minor errors in amenity placement and maintenance. Upon entry the remote for the TV was inoperative, probably due to dead batteries; a call to guest services brought a replacement in about six minutes. The next morning I endured a slow draining tub that had water up past my ankles by the time my shower was done; a call to guest services brought an engineer in about 15 minutes. That evening, I wanted to have a shirt laundered and couldn't find a valet ticket with the plastic valet bag; a call to guest services promised a response, but 30 minutes later, I had to call again, and after the second call, a staff member arrived with a plastic bag...but no valet ticket. Another five-minute delay and I finally got that little problem resolved. With a reasonable CapEx effort, the rooms at this hotel could be stunning. As it is, it's a very typical Westin property that has no compelling advantages over like-kind Marriotts, Hiltons or Hyatts. Its most redeeming feature is its location. If you are an SPG Gold or Platinum, you will want to seriously consider this property. If not, the location may not be enough to offset the average $350 and up rates at this property.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: screaminE
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a great weekend stay here. This hotel was formerly a Hotel Nikko. A very nice property, we stayed on a club floor (19) which included use of the executive lounge which we did 2 times once at breakfast & once for a cocktail. Very nice but sort of crowded at breakfast. Our room was huge, a nice view of the river & the Marina City towers, comfortable Heavenly bed, with the temp set at 65 as requested (we are Starwood points members) and all the usual amenities. We used the minibar as a fridge and our supply of napkins and clean glasses was replenished. I don't think we got turndown service one of the 3 nights but that was probably ok we were pretty out of it when we got home that night (after drinks, steak dinner & more drinks!) Chicago is a really great city - can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great City-Great Hotel-Okay Service”
Reviews.Author: nrucker
Reviews.Content: Chicago is such a great City. I have never been to a cleaner more friendly large city, like Chicago. On to the hotel review..................... Westin River North This hotel would have gotten 5 stars if it wasn't for their check-in. I had called them 3 days in a row to request an early check in because we were bringing our dog to stay with us. After calling again on the same morning I was told they will do everything they can do, but no guarantees. I never have a problem with this at Marriotts/Hiltons. Upon arriving around 11:30 I was told that our room wasn't ready. Okay, we will just walk around with our dog. I was told that they would put a rush on our room and it would be the first to be cleaned. Upon coming back at 2, I was told by a different person the room was still not ready. When I told her what we had been told, etc, she was so rude and said "I don't know who told you this" but check in isn't until 3 and we may not have rooms available at that time!!!! This type of customer service is ridiculous for this type of hotel. After all was said in done, the manager came right over, asked what the problem was, and had us in a great river view corner room within 30 seconds. The room was gorgeous. Flat panal LCD TV, Great Bed, Great Shower....Big Room. The hotel is nice, kind of a wierd minimulistic theme though. Room Service was good. Concierge was very nice and helpful. If you are looking for dog friendly accommodations in Chicago, the Westin is good. The best would be all Kimpton's, in particular Hotel Burnham. The service and friendliness at the Westin was kinda cold compared to other higher end hotels we have stayed. The location is perfect. Walking distance to everything. Ask for room 1624. Perfect view and location. Architecture River Cruise was great...highly recommend. Hugos Frog Bar was as good as it always is. I love Chicago, if you have never been, you are really missing out. Thanks, Nathan

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Now the Happy Bride! Chicago, IL
Reviews.Title: “Has potential to be a nice hotel, but misses the mark....”
Reviews.Author: Bride2Be
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin River North May 26th and May 27th. (Back story- We normally stay across the street at House of Blues which we LOVE, but this trip we ended up at the Westin River North. I work about a block from here and we do live in Chicago on the North side. It was my husband's birthday weekend and I wanted to do something nice so I planned a birthday weekend. We both recently just turned 30 to give you our age range) The first night the hotel seemed to be hosting some type of prom or similiar function. Their were teens running all over the hotel from about 8 o'clock on. I checked in at about 1 pm with no incident. The front desk staff was friendly and attentive upon check-in. After we arrived back from dinner the first evening we went to our room and then came back down to the lounge for drinks. Big mistake! After three separate attempts to get our drink order we watched and listened to security chase prom-goers through the lobby and hotel. The only time security didn't care was if they came into the lounge and ordered a drink. We finally left when, what seemed to be maybe the chaperone's for the evening came into the evening clearly happy to left off some stress but WAY too loud yelling their drink orders. This didn't go on for just a few minutes which could have been understandable, but at least 10 minutes at which time we left. We went back to our room, hoping to put the events of the lounge/lobby/hotel behing us and enjoy a shower and some sleep. We turned on the shower only to find that there was no hot water. After about 30 minutes of fighting with all the shower water settings and making sure this wasn't our error I hopped in frustrated, tired and fed up while my husband called the front desk. The front desk calls engineering, who checks the temperature and about an hour later my husband finally has a hot shower. Or so he tells me, by this point I'm shivering in bed half asleep and thoroughly disgusted with the Westin. So much for "Heavenly Shower" Day 2. I can only hope it gets better, we discuss checking out and totally scrapping plan for weekend but decide to try and give it another shot. How long can prom last? It is just a one night event right? I stop at the front desk and speak to a brunette. After helping everyone in site including the random people that just walk up even though I am clearly waiting in line, she finally has no choice but to help me. I explain to her the events of the past evening. She proceeds to smile and at points giggle while I tell her my story. I ask her the source of her amusement and she gets confused, and says she doesn't understand what I want. I ask her if the problems are going to continue for another day and she begins to say "Security tried...." and then lets her sentence trail off never finishing....After a minute or so she asks if I want to "complain to a manager". I tell her she has a lot to learn about dealing with customers and walk off. We head off for the days events- massages, shopping, lunch, etc. We arrange to meet back in time to get ready for our Tut at Twilight Tickets at the Field Museum which I arrange for weeks ago. At 5 o'clock we are surprised to find the room still not cleaned by house keeping. My husband jumps in the shower while I keep watch for the maid. After about 15 mins. I venture into the hall in search of her, only to find she speaks no English. I finally write my room number for her and she says she will be there in 5 mins. At about 5:30 my husband and I head to the lounge again to try again and hope that when we return the room will FINALLY be clean. Before we leave I take all our used towels and place them in a pile on the floor of the room, I put a note on the bed and ask for 2 of the extra large 30x60 Westin bath towels since there are two of us and we would like to both have a bath towel when we get out of the shower. I leave a tip with my note. We come back half hour later to find our room finaly clean, YAY. We don't have 2 bath towel, but what seems to be an endless supply of the smaller hair towels (probably 20x12) and 2 robes. This seems like a nice thought, but not quite on the mark. I call housekeeping request what I ASKED FOR ALREADY and then head to the shower. My husband waits for the towels. About 5 minutes into my shower I hear the phone ring. My husband comes to tell me they called back after telling me "no problem they would be right up with my towels" that they have none. They explain to him that they have 1 per room and it's too late in the day to get any. He tries to explain we don't have any, we had 1 it was dirty and the maid took it and only left a little while ago, but this doesn't help. No towel for us. I'm still trying to figure out how/when this shower becomes a "heavenly shower"...I think the whole thing is laughable.No hot water, no towels. There is NOTHING heavenly about this shower, or trip for that matter. After I dry off with the postage stamp towels I am apparently luck to get and so does my husband we finish getting ready. We head to the valet to catch a cab to head to the Field Museum. We arrive at Valet to find an absolute free-for-all. There is no valet or anyone from the Westin in site. There are 8+ people trying to either get out of cabs and unload luggage or get a cab. Cabs aren't willing to take the people since they need to take cabs from the "cab stand", but since there is nobody from valet nobody knows how to get a cab from the cab stand. This chaos goes on for about 5 minutes. We walk across the street to House of Blues and their valet gets us a cab. Upon returning from the museum, dinner and the foundation room we head to the room unwilling to take our chances in the lounge again. We get to the room and settle in. After relaxing for some time we order a pizza from a local pizza restaurant. About an hour later the front desk calls to tell me they won't let the deliver driver come to my room and I have to come to the front desk to get my food. I hang up annoyed. This information is not disclosed anywhere that I have seen. I arrive in the lobby to find NOBODY at the front desk but the delivery driver from the pizza place. I didn't know I needed my credit card, and the front desk certainly didn't mention it. The delivery driver and I walk up to my room so I can give him the imprint of my credit card. Nobody says anything since there is NOBODY in the lobby anywhere, nor the front desk. The front desk had inconvenienced me for NO REASON, but this seems par for the course at the Westin. Perhaps this is their business model. I get my bill slipped under my door, I review the bill. It has an extra $30 in phone calls which I never made. I purposely made all my calls, except 1 from my cell due to the cost of calls. As did my husband. After my interaction with the front desk this isn't worth dealing with, I fill out the survey and sign the check-out form. (Not surprisingly the total charged to my credit card was even higher than the slip I signed at check out when I saw it on my bank statement a few days later) I want to be done with the Westin. We will never stay there again, we will never recommend it to anyone. I would never consider them in any city. They clearly don't seem to care regardless of any member of staff. I sent an email to the Westin, I filled out the satisfaction questions on my check-out form, I filled out a automated form on the Westin website, I have never heard a word from them.

Reviews.Title: “Prime Location!”
Reviews.Author: CHerPig
Reviews.Content: The Westin River North is absolutely 4 star! The rooms are plush, comfortable, and I believe all have a view of the Chicago River. We secured a terrific price through Priceline which made our stay much sweeter. Be aware that this is a BUSINESS hotel. Therefore, there is an extra charge for everything. Wireless internet is free in the lobby area but unavailable in the rooms. Instead, the high-speed internet access charge is $20 per day or $1.50 per hour. Parking at the hotel is $38 per day, but an adjacent public lot charges only $20 per day. No breakfast included with room. Dunkin Doughnuts or trendy breakfast restaurants are nearby. What pleased me most about the hotel was LOCATION!!! We spent 3 days and 2 nights exploring Chicago with students from Germany. This Westin is smack in the middle of everything! We were prepared to purchase metro passes but WALKED everywhere with no problem! Navy Pier was the destination located farthest from our hotel, but there is a FREE shuttle provided from a nearby corner. We used the shuttle to Navy Pier and returned via taxi at a cost of $4 plus tip. CHEAP! Be sure to check out the numerous tours offered by Chicago's achitectural society and visit Buckingham Fountain after dark! We felt very, very safe touring Chicago at all hours! ENJOY!!!

Reviews.Title: “would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: racb
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice now and really like it. I find it relatively quiet and has wonderful views of the river-- so try to get a room with a river view!! I have switched from the loop W which was a bit to kinetic and like this hotel's convenient but not right in the middle of everything location. I tend to take the blue line in from ohare and is a very short work from the clark an lake stop. My room has always been spacious, and very attractive but as someone else wrote not over the top. The hotel was formally a Nikko and still has a slight zen asian look.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but would Hesitate to Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: Aurora100
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three and a half days to attend a conference and most of the time was very pleased with the hotel. Although rooms are a little dark, they are unusually large and quite comfortable. The Westin River North has a sleek modern ambiance and is a much better hotel than the Westin on Michigan Avenue, which seemed somewhat run-down when I stayed there last fall. Even though the Michigan Avenue hotel has a better location if you are in Chicago to shop, I liked the location of the Westin River North as it is right on the river, with easy access to the Loop, but also there are lots of good restaurants nearby, and itâ€™s an easy walk to the shops of Michigan Ave. The one aspect of the hotel that really bothered me is that they charge you an extra $10 for the use of their fitness facility. I have stayed at Westin hotels all over the country and have never encountered an additional charge to use one of their gyms. Since you are already paying top dollar to stay here, I think that they are highly out of line to submit guests to this additional charge. There are lots of hotels to choose from in Chicago, so I would probably go elsewhere on my next business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a City of Great hotels”
Reviews.Author: TeamBell
Reviews.Content: Wow--I always love Westins--the heavenly bed really is. This was our, thousandth(?) trip to Chi town, we always stay somewhere different, because there are so many fantastic hotels. No longer--I will stay this Westin from now on. It is cool--very sleek and contemporary, zen like. It feels relaxed and quiet . The river views are awesome, the bed, perfect. We also heard the Sushi is great there, but haven't yet tried it. Rock on--!

Reviews.Title: “Central for restaurants, sites & shopping”
Reviews.Author: IanR
Reviews.Content: A great hotel, particularly if you get a river view (I only had to ask). The room was spotless, the bed fantastic, the shower even better. The bar was spacious and relaxing. The staff did everything to please. And do try Bin 36 over the road, an amazing restaurant with a cheese bar and a novel opportunity to try numerous wines in one sitting. Highly recommended hotel whether for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “New Year's Weekend”
Reviews.Author: ckvp1
Reviews.Content: We travelled from Fort Lauderdale to Chicago for the New Year's weekend. We could not have been more pleased with the Westin Chicago River North. We were in Chicago in May 2005 and stayed at Hotel 71. No comparison. The Westin is so much better. Cleaner, better elevators, nicer lobby, better rooms. New Year's Eve the security was tight so no one that wasn't staying at the hotel couldn't get to the elevators. Great location as we walked to Marshall-Fields, the Ford Theatre and pretty much everywhere we wanted to go. And only 2 blocks to Lou Malnati's -some of the best Chicago deep dish pizza! Will definitely stay at the Westin Chicago River North again.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant but Some Front Desk Issues”
Reviews.Author: greenmountainguava
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the elegant, spare Asian decor in the public areas of the hotel. Our room was nice too, but not as nice. There was water damage on the ceiling and some disrepair in the corner wall of the bathroom, but the room was very comfortable wth romantic views of the river. The restaurant has a great breakfast & service was impeccable. The bar area is very nice. The bellhops were all quick and helpful--really gracious. The front desk staff was weirdly off the ball. The person at the front desk was rather rude, but we brushed that off. When we got to our room, though, it turned out she had actually given us a room that was already occupied! There were people asleep in bed! The bellman was horrified and rushed to the phone in the hallway to straighten things out. From what we could hear, she was rude to him too. A day later we found they had our check out date wrong (we got our bill under the door a day early, though they had the date right when we checked in). Lastly, after we checked out, we discovered that they had not billed the room charges to the proper credit card. Note that the location is really great for theatre-going, though a little far for walking to and from the Water Tower shopping area.

Reviews.Title: “Love The River North.”
Reviews.Author: mike1742
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel 30 times along with many other in downtown Chicago. You cannot beat the location the service. Great restaurants all within walking distance. A little pricey but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “great weekend at the westin !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend of shopping and celebrating in Chicago. The Westin proved to be a great home base. Our room was large and comfortable and the bathroom, done in black marble, was also quite large and stylish. The hotel gym is far superior to most and never crowded. The lobby overlooks the bar area which creates a great atmosphere to have a drink/appetizer in. The staff was friendly and the location was ideal for Michigan Ave. or the loop. We would suggest taking the 2 block walk to the Mambo Grill to start an evening with their mojitos then walking 2 more blocks to Fado for a perfectly poured Guinness. Did I mention we did some celebrating ?

Reviews.Title: “pleasant getaway”
Reviews.Author: Okemosian
Reviews.Content: We booked a two-night "Romance Package" to shop and play in Chicago. This included a king bed, river view room, coupons for an American breakfast, a bottle of champagne and strawberries, and a 4 p.m. late-checkout. The room was spacious and the view very nice. Bathroom was also luxurious, with the "heavenly" showerhead. (Just be sure it's set to your liking before you step in! It's powerful.) There were a few minor glitches. The champagne and strawberries we requested never arrived the first night, but we decided to go out to dinner anyway, and so had them sent up the next night. In the morning we found only decaf coffee and one paper cup in the room. There was also no bathrobe in the room. The full American breakfast coupons were worth $10 each and you could select only that from the menu (2 eggs, sausage or bacon, toast, etc.) It was fine but we used the coupons only the first morning - went to brunch at the Palmer House on Sunday instead. It was a pleasant stay and we most liked the late check-out - gave us time to squeeze in more shopping (without having to hassle with packing and retrieving our car right away) before heading home. Staff was quite friendly. We usually stay in a corner room at the Swissotel but tried this just for a change. I like the location of the Swisshotel better, but have always found their staff are pretty chilly.

Reviews.Title: “Westin River North Redefines Class”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Recently or more truthfully, I am in the middle of what I expected to be a pleasant experience at the Westin River North Hotel in Chicago. I've stayed here numerous times over the past years, even when it was the old Nikko-but it has improved so dramatically over the past year I felt compelled to write. The Front Desk Manager Steve Johnson personally checked me in, maybe because I am a Platinum member I thought, but I saw him pitching in with the overall check-in process which made even a large crowd of people's check in experience as smooth as mine which was during an unhurried period. I used the lobby quite a bit to work as it has internet connectivity as well as my room did, and had a nice loungelike atmosphere. Food and drink were fine, nothing spectacular here but fine nonetheless. But then Mr. Johnson invited me to the SPG lounge on the 19th floor-I think this is reserved for SPG Gold or Platinum members, I'm not sure, but it really made me feel like I was in a Ritz Carlton as opposed to the Westin and it only got better from there. During my stay I was greeted by name by many of the staff ranging from the bellmen Allen and James as well as Mr. Johnson who made my otherwise normally pleasant experience into one that made me feel a VIP from start to finish. Great job Westin and thanks for making me feel like an honored guest and acting in what I way that I can only say redefines the word class.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: reginafug
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Westin property, the evening after the Chicago Marathon. We had booked a room at the Chicago Sheraton Towers, but through some misunderstanding, we could not stay there for our last night in Chicago and and we had to move to the Westin. Well, after a-not-so pleasant stay at the Sheraton, we were pleasantly surprised with the Westin. As soon as the taxi pulled up to the front door, we were greeted by a very cheerful doorman, and our luggage was taken and held aside until we got our room. The receptionist was lukewarm but efficient. Being a Platinum member, we were updated to a club level floor. Room was very nicely appointed, with that wonderful bed and bathroom amenities. Oh, and loved the computer with free internet in the room! I think this hotel's best asset is the Concierge, Bell Staff and Doormen. They are as cheerful as anyone can be and so eager to help (they ought to teach a hospitality course to their sister hotel, the Chicago Sheraton Towers!). The fitness centre is wonderful and the trainer on duty was extremely helpful. Too bad we didn't stay all four nights of our stay at this wonderful place. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A dream came true”
Reviews.Author: Escaramujo
Reviews.Content: Very nice Hotel. Stayed during the World Series fulfilling my father's life dream to watch the Whitesox in a world series. Got upgraded to a Excutive floor room (Gold Member). Service at the executive lounge was very nice and cordial. Very good location, near everything in downtown. Heavenly bed was great.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago marathon”
Reviews.Author: swbkrun
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin during the Chicago marathon, and we were very impressed! The check in staff was excellent, even providing us with suggestions for dinner, and also allowing us a late check out for after the race, which allowed us to shower before our long drive home. The rooms were great, and we had a nice view of the Chicago River. The rooms are very spacious, including the bathroom, and the bed was very comfortable. We would definitely stay here again! In fact, we stayed here based on another recommendation, and we're glad we did.

Reviews.Title: “Nice discreet business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bondosan006
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in late Sep. Location is convenient for Michigan Avenue - just 10 mins walk away. It is also good for downtown as the Sears tower is 20 mins walk away. Check in was rapid and smooth. The rooms are nice - decent size, good controllable air conditioning, the standard comfortable Westin bed. Breakfast is quick and reasonable. There is a standard continental breakfast which includes a small buffet with a good selection of fresh fruit, pastries, yogurt and cereals for US$14. There are also hot breakfast selections a la carte. I ordered dinner from room service one evening and it was prompt and the food was actually rather good, which was a pleasant surprise. The concierge was helpful when I asked for help buying chocolates (and I did do as she suggested). There were only 3 minuses, all of which were pretty minor. The telephone in my room had an annoying hum. I did not get an upgrade which I normally do as I have a Starwood Platinum card but there was no explanation or mention of this, and the rooms are susceptible to some traffic noise. Having said all that, I prefer this to both the W Chicago and the W Lakeshore, and intend to stay here next time I am in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A friend and I had planned a trip to Chicago to see the Cubs/Marlins game on Saturday the 27th and had reserved a room with two beds for the evening of the 27th. We were arriving in Chicago at 9:30 AM, and called after we landed to inquire about an early check in. We were told that no rooms would be available until the hotels planned no rooms would be ready (even though we had a confirmed reservation) for "at least a few hours", and that the best they could do was a single and a roll away; they further went on to say that if we had checked in earlier, they may have been able to accomodate us (even though after we called they told us to come for the 3PM check in). We had 6PM dinner plans with other friends, and had to accept what they gave us because we needed to be ready to go out. They made no effort to apologize, nor to make up for their mistake (again, we had a confirmed reservation). Even though the hotel was your typical Westin, I don't think I will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Good room, nice service, terrible view.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The room was typical Westin, namely very nice furnishings including the heavenly bed, big tub, marble bathroom, etc. It looks like the place was recently renovated because everything was new. The lobby and the bar are great places to meet up with friends and lounge. The concierge was terrific. Her suggestions for restaurants and activities were just what we wanted. One negative was the view which was of the hotel next door. I could sort of see the Chicago river. Very few of the rooms had nice views. Another problem was that the check-in staff didn't seem to honor the Starwood Gold benefits because my upgrade wasn't much of an upgrade. Overall, it's fine but I'm not aching to go back there.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet oasis”
Reviews.Author: SB321
Reviews.Content: After a tough day in the airport waiting for my delayed flight, I arrived at the Westin on July 20, 2005. The hotel is modern with a friendly doorman and pleasant staff. The room was extremely clean and comfortable with a lovely bath. It's convenient to great restaurants and the House of Blues. I got a wonderful night's sleep on the Heavenly bed and loved the quiet. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Shutterbug422
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin on July 9, 2005. I was planning a bachelorette party in Chicago, so all of the girls and I stayed here. We had a wonderful experience. The lobby is beautiful and very high class. All of the employees were extremely friendly and very helpful. The lady at the front desk let us check in early and made sure we had the river view, which was amazing. Now, I'm a former flight attendant, so I have stayed in about a million different hotels all over the world. This room was very clean and a nice size. The heavenly bed was so comfortable and the heavenly bath with the two shower heads and the bowed out shower curtain rod that provides extra elbow room was wonderful. I didn't want to get out of the shower! So, all in all we had an absolutely wonderful experience here, I definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was okay.........”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms were quite small, compared to other hotel rooms. They were clean, though. Great location and MOST of the staff was nice. Here is where I had a problem...........went down stairs to ask where could I get 4 plates and 4 forks for us to eat a delivery dinner. One desk attendant looked at the other and said, "go ahead and waive the fee". I asked what fee. They said that there is normally a $25 fee for use of the hotel plates and flatware and not ordering in the hotel to encourage patrons not to eat outside of the hotel. I was shocked (and my face showed it). I looked at the other desk attendant and he stated, "Well, this IS the Westin" in a VERY arrogant tone. The only restaurant in the hotel was a sushi/VERY upscale restaurant. If the hotel encourages, eating in, QUESTION: WHY does the conceirge recommend SEVERAL delivery places to eat in the hotel room? I guess they were hoping that the Chicago-style pizza place would supply plates and forks. I told the non-arrogant desk attendant, thanks for waiving the fee. I ended up not needed the plates and cancelled the "room order" for the plates. In addition, I was misquoted on cab fare from several of the bell-hops to the airport compared to what the cab driver charged (a LARGE amount difference).

Reviews.Title: “I found the Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have been traveling to Chicago for years and just recently found the Perfect hotel. The Westin River North had everything I needed as a business traveler at a great price. From the beginning of the stay the hotel got two thumbs up. Stepping out of the cab I was greeted by the friendliest doorman who assisted me with my luggage. Walking from the front entrance to the checkin desk I thought I was a celebrity with all of the staff members greeting me. I was approached by at least three different employees with a good afternoon or friendly welcome. The front desk was equally as great with the perfect attitude not that I'm too busy to help you attitude. I was even offered an upgraded river view room for an additional $40. I strongly suggest this room with its unbelievable views - the best in the city. Plus this was perfect for me since I was going to be working out of my room this evening and enjoy a great view when I work. As I was being escorted to my room by the bellman, he mentioned to me about the wonderful massage services the hotel offers. It was not long until I made the appointment. This was perfect for $55 I was able to get a Hot Stone Therapy Massage which was the most rejuvenating massage I had in a long time. I will be returning to Chicago next month and guarantee I will be staying at The Westin River North.
